991749,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/991749,Customer Data Business Product Owner,Emerson,,,,,"We are seeking a Customer Data Business Product Owner as we embark on a transformation of our Commercial Infrastructure globally. This role will be fully accountable for leading timely, on-budget, scalable delivery of business and technology-driven outcomes from kick-off through completed adoption, meeting approved program business outcome targets in collaboration with NI IT, business team(s), and the Solution Integrator.
In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:
• Lead the strategic vision and execution for our Customer Data, aligning it with the broader SW transformation and T&M business strategy regularly.
• Partner with NI IT and Solution Integration leaders to ensure implementation adherence to customer experience, out-of-the-box, and process efficiency guidelines.

• Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of Customer Data and continuously evaluate the impact of changing processes and technology on productivity and business performance, adjusting scope + execution as needed to maximize return on investment.

• Oversee Customer Data-level budget allocation and manage financial resources, ensuring the project stays on budget and is delivered on time as outlined by the program executive and T&M executive steering team.
• Manages and is accountable for the collaboration between SI and NI Business and IT teams on Customer Data and review SI progress against milestones
-Recognize, promote and celebrate team, program and individual accomplishments

• Collaborate across IT, SI and other technology and functional areas to lead prioritizing Customer Data detailed scope often, ensuring continued alignment to outcomes, and effective user and customer experiences
• The Customer Data Business Lead owns business requirement documentation, decisions, communication and clarification to SI and NI IT teams
• Review implementation priorities and identify and resolve roadblocks to capability implementation
• Work with Program Executive / Steering committee to remove roadblocks, gather support for critical program decisions
• Own, review and coordinate on technical or functional dependences across Customer Data consumers with IT and SI
• Proactively identify, assess, and mitigate risks associated with Customer Data platform implementation, including technical, operational, and compliance risks.
• Act as the main point of contact for business stakeholders, Customer Data & Commercial Infrastructure leaders, IT, and executive management, ensuring their needs are met throughout the project.
• Present plans to leadership frequently, and align on Customer Data team priorities, flagging key risks and concerns in capability delivery.
-Agree on Customer Data recommendations, risk updates, or requests for transformation leadership
• Lead comprehensive change management efforts to ensure adoption across the enterprise, including training, communication, and stakeholder engagement aligned with overall program change plans.
Lead efforts to ensure high adoption rates among users, gathering feedback and making iterative improvements post-launch.
Our Offer to You:

We provide, a variety of medical insurance plans, with dental and vision coverage, Employee Assistance Program, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, employee resource groups, recognition, and much more. 902124,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/902124,Sr Data Analyst,Honeywell,,,,,"Summary

873023,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/873023,Data Officer,Engie,,,,,"Transversal Data Officer
About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE's assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity ""Global Energy Management & Sales"" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group's large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
Our 4 expertises:
• Asset management
• Energy transition services
• Energy supply & global commodities
• Risk management & market access
At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.
More info on GEMS Hub (https://gems.engie.com) or LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions).
Context:

The transversal data officer works within the global Data Office for GEMS. The Data office is under the direct responsibility of the Chief Data officer and is responsible for data governance, quality as well as driving the overall data strategy for the organization under the guidance of the CDO.
Role:

The transversal data officer primary mission is to ensure the proper operationalization of Data Governance in relation with all stakeholders. Besides, the Data Officer must meet Data Governance program objectives, budget constraints and timeline.
Data Office roadmap and program monitoring:
Assists the CDO in defining the Data Office roadmap considering data centric strategies involving Data Science and AI initiatives
Makes sure that Data Office roadmap is updated
Ensures that KPIs allowing to supervise the governance program advancement are defined and monitored
Assists the CDO in prioritizing data subjects and is involved in the construction of IS roadmap on Data subjects
Assists the CDO in organizing and preparing data committees
Data Office resource and budget monitoring:
Ensures resource & budget availability and allocation for the Data Office
Makes resource & budget allocation adjustments if necessary
Reports and escalate to CDO as needed
Change management / Acculturation
Ensures that the governance framework is communicated and promoted to identified audiences using prescribed channels
Participates with HR in the development of skills improvement plans of data actors
Ensures that HR are informed of new data roles nominations
Supports onboarding of new data roles
Use cases identification and Data Governance linkage:
Identifies strategic use cases with an opportunity to deploy the governance framework
Ensures that data roles are identified and nominated in use cases especially where data pain points are detected
Makes sure that Data Office policies are communicated and supervised by identified data roles
Ensures that identified data roles include data objectives in the use cases they intervene in
Ensures that use cases monitor data management KPIs: quality, access, etc.
Monitors major issues and problems
Identifies opportunities of evolution of the Data Governance framework and makes sure they are processed
Catalog ownership
Guarantees the proper evolution of the data catalog and quality of its content regarding users' needs
Hard skills:
Must have:
Excellence Analytical skills, combined with a hands-on approach
Strong understanding of information management tool and trading systems
Good to have:
The capability and/or interest in code languages (Python etc)
Soft skills:
Must have:
Good interpersonal skills and communication
Eager to learn with a strong business drive
Well organized and pro-active
Ability to interact with both business and IT teams
Good to have:
Good knowledge of the energy industry.
Education and professional background:
5-10 years professional experience in similar role or in a business analyst capacity with ideally a previous experience in data management initiatives.
Languages:
Fluent in French and English, Dutch a plus.
Travels:
Some travel may be required in the various locations where GEMS has offices.
If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!
Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.
ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.
About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (""raison d'être"") is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:17:06,,

988370,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/988370,Junior Workload Data Analyst H/F,,,,,,"JOB DESCRIPTION
The positions duties fall into 3 main processes:

You assist the Paris Operating Center (POC) Business Application Coordinator of the Workload Planning System (WPS: an in-house software that is filled by the Heads of Department in the whole T.EN perimeter) in managing the WPS application.

You participate in the Paris OC monthly consolidation process under the responsibility of the Lead Workload Data Analyst. You assist the Lead Workload Data Analyst in providing the required data as per the cut-off dates calendar
You assist the Lead Workload Data Analyst in promoting the data quality inside the Paris OC and in controling the data submitted by the HoD.
Duties in details
Under the responsibility of the Lead Workload Data Analyst, you assist him/her on the following activities:
Liaise with the sources owners that feed WPS through interfaces (MDM, Twist, the Active Directory)
Provide a first-level hotline for users in Paris OC.
Promote the data quality and share the good practices in using WPS
Participates to regular meeting to be informed of the local prediction hypothesis
Follow up the monthly reporting calendar of deliverables enforced by One T.EN Delivery
Follow up the monthly calendar of deliverables enforced by Paris OC
Liaise with several other department to corroborate WPS data in Paris:
People & Culture
Sourcing & Procurement
Cost Control
Business Development
Provide specific resource-related or workload-related documents like for the Commercial Pre-Qualifications or like upon-request simulations
Regularly train new Parisian Heads of Department and review their declarations in the tool to reach with them the accuracy targets
Provide Paris OC Power BI reports about resources and workload prediction
Reporting lines
Hierarchically to the Head of Performance of Paris OC.
Operationally to the Lead Workload Data Analyst
Your profile
Education: you are graduated of a masters degree, whatever the field.
Languages: fluent French and English speaker.
Experience: 3 years at minimum in a position that has exposed you to workload management and tools monitoring
Technical skills:
User of Excel, Power BI or database management
Character traits:
Autonomous
Problem-solving oriented
Affinity with numbers (basic calculations)
Confidence in new software learning and user-experience improvement, interest in the digital governance (without development skill)
Clear and structured writing (design documents)
Interpersonal skills (numerous interactions with Management-level individuals)
Business oriented
Strategic approach (high-level understanding rather than discipline details will matter)
Sense of confidentiality
Would be an asset:
Cost Control or Planning experiences
Whats next ?

Driven by T.EN group's values of inclusion, the division relies on the diversity of its members to progress. This means that this position is open to all and your application will be specifically reviewed.

Once receiving your application, a recruiter performs an initial check between your skills and qualifications with our stated requirements prior to a detailed and focused review carried with the hiring manager. 985785,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/985785,Data Privacy Lead Specialist,Vestas,,,,,"The Lead Data Privacy Specialist is responsible for leading HR data privacy and compliance efforts across global HR Operations, ensuring adherence to international data protection regulations, including but not limited to GDPR, CCPA, and other major global privacy standards. This role serves as a key resource for data privacy within HR shared services, focusing on upholding the integrity of personal data, promoting data privacy awareness, and supporting global privacy initiatives across regions such as the EU, the US, and other high-priority locations.

The Lead Data Privacy Specialist will play a collaborative role in supporting compliance projects, handling data subject rights requests, incident management, and driving best practices within the HR organization to achieve high data privacy standards.
People & Culture > Global People Services > P&C Enablement
Responsibilities
1. Data Privacy Governance and Compliance

Develop, implement, and maintain global data privacy policies, guidelines, and processes specific to HR Operations, ensuring alignment with international data protection standards, including GDPR, CCPA, LGPD, and other relevant regulations
Act as a primary contact and data privacy expert within HR Operations, supporting compliance efforts across the US, EU, and other high-regulation jurisdictions
Proactively monitor and assess regulatory developments across key regions to keep HR Operations compliant with evolving global privacy standards
2. Privacy Risk Assessment and Mitigation
Lead and conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) for HR data processing across international locations, focusing on identifying and mitigating privacy risks
Develop actionable recommendations to mitigate privacy risks and ensure global alignment, particularly with regulations such as GDPR and CCPA
Collaborate closely with global HR, IT, Legal, and Compliance teams to design privacy controls and data protection measures that address country-specific requirements for high-risk jurisdictions
3. Privacy Incident Management
Oversee and evaluate the lifecycle of privacy incidents related to HR data, including investigation, reporting, and resolution, in accordance with global regulatory requirements
Ensure timely reporting to relevant data protection authorities in accordance with jurisdiction-specific timeframes, such as 72-hour GDPR notification requirements
Conduct root cause analyses and implement corrective actions to continuously improve data protection practices globally
4. Data Privacy Training and Awareness
Design and implement comprehensive training programs on global data privacy principles and best practices tailored to HR Operations staff, SSC employees, and relevant global stakeholders
Create and distribute global communications to promote privacy awareness and develop a culture of compliance within the organization
Act as a trusted advisor and subject matter expert, supporting HR Operations globally in addressing data privacy concerns
5. Data Subject Rights Management

Oversee the global response process for data subject requests (DSARs) across all relevant jurisdictions, including requests for access, rectification, and deletion in line with GDPR, CCPA, and other applicable regulations
Establish standardized processes to ensure efficient, compliant handling of DSARs within required timeframes, adapting practices to meet the needs of different regions
Qualifications
Education and Certification:
Bachelor's degree in Law, Data Privacy, Data Protection, IT, or a related field
Professional certifications in data protection and privacy, such as CIPP/E, CIPP/US, CIPM, or equivalent, are highly preferred
Experience:
5+ years of experience in data privacy, data protection, or compliance roles, ideally within a global HR Operations or shared services environment
Comprehensive working knowledge of GDPR, CCPA, LGPD, and other international data protection laws
Demonstrated experience in administering global data privacy programs, especially within HR or a multinational environment
Competencies
Global Regulatory Knowledge: In-depth understanding of international privacy regulations and ability to adapt compliance strategies to meet global and country-specific needs
Analytical Skills: Expertise in assessing and addressing privacy risks within complex, cross-border data processing operations
Project Management: Proven experience in developing privacy initiatives across multiple jurisdictions and collaborating with global teams
Communication: Comprehensive verbal and written communication skills, with a clear ability to convey complex privacy topics to global stakeholders in HR and other functions
Attention to Detail: Meticulous approach to documentation, data protection assessments, and reporting for global compliance
What we offer

We offer you an exciting role with great professional and personal development opportunities in an inspiring, progressive, international work environment at an established manufacturer of wind turbines. We offer attractive company perks like fitness subsidy, health insurance, pension, life insurance, medical allowance, travel allowance, internet allowance, etc. We have a modern, inspiring office overlooking Manila Bay, conveniently located near public transport. We believe in work-life balance and plan annual offsite outings, team building, and sports events. In Vestas, you will experience an innovative environment where no days are ever the same, strengthening your personal as well as professional growth.
Additional Information
We do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including before the advertised closing date. Please be advised to apply on or before the 31st of December 2024.
Additional Benefits
Fitness Subsidy
Retirement Benefit Plan
BEWARE - RECRUITMENT FRAUD
It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process
DEIB Statement

At Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, ""Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry"". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.
About Vestas
Vestas is the energy industry's global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.
With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution - today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.

To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:17:59,,
982964,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/982964,Senior Partner - Data Integrity & HR Systems,AtkinsRéalis,,,,,"Job Description

About AtkinsRéalis

Created by the integration of long-standing organizations dating back to 1911, AtkinsRéalis is a world-leading professional services and project management company dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. 1004469,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1004469,Data Science Intern (Geophysics),Schlumberger,,,,,"Job Title:
Data Science Intern (Geophysics) - 6 months
Ab out SLB:
We are a global technology company, driving energy innovation for a balanced planet.
Together, we create amazing technology that unlocks access to energy for the benefit of all.

At SLB, we recognize that our innovation, creativity, and success stem from our differences. We actively recruit people with a diverse range of backgrounds and cultivate a culture of inclusion that unlocks the benefits of our diversity. We want to ensure that everyone feels a sense of belonging here and we encourage, enable, and empower our people to foster inclusivity, build trust, and demonstrate respect for all across the organization.
Global in outlook, local in practice - and with a united, shared passion for discovering solutions, we hire talented, driven people and support them to succeed, personally and professionally.
Location:
Crawley, UK
Description & Scope:

Estimating local slopes is important for seismic signal processing. We want to evaluate how a Physics Informed Neural Networks (PINN) could be used for such purpose and how it could help us improving on our existing solutions.
The intern is expected to create a new application by either enhancing existing software or prototyping new one, and to apply such technology to synthetic and real seismic data.
Deliverables:
Enhancing the existing software or prototyping a new solution
Application of the enhanced software to synthetic data
Application of the enhanced software to real data
Writing an internal report and, potentially, submitting a manuscript for a peer reviewed scientific journal
Qualif ications and Experience:
Ph.D. student in geophysics with experience in the development of deep learning algorithm and Physics Informed Neural Networks in particular.

976849,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/976849,"S&OP Specialist Data Excellence & Processes, B&R Automation",ABB,,,,,"S&OP Specialist Data Excellence & Processes, B&R Automation

Take your next career step at B&R - a member of the ABB Group - with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At B&R - a member of the ABB Group, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences. Join the automation team at B&R- a member of the ABB Group.
This position reports to
Head of Planning ＆ Fulfillment
Your role and responsibilities

Introduction Embedded in the Planning & Fulfillment department, the S&OP Specialist Data Excellence & Processes will play a pivotal role in the newly set up S&OP organization. Acting as the main contact for any statistical forecast related tasks the position will also take care of further improvements to lay a solid data foundation for the following S&OP phases. Objective of the position The S&OP Specialist Data Excellence & Processes provides the necessary data so that adequate decisions can be made during the S&OP cycles. The position also takes care of the regular maintenance of information and its availability on time. Tasks: • Creating statistical Forecast in SAP IBP out of sales history • Data cleansing - correction of statistical failures and outliers, due to peaks, status/lifecycle, missing data, etc • Processing statistical Forecast as baseline for unconstraint sales plan in best quality possible • Providing remastered data and publishing. • Participating in the S&OP preparation meetings monthly for Spoke 2 (sales & PG) • Monitoring and documentation of data movements, assumptions, data cleansing actions • Comparison forecast:forecast and valuing results and additional KPIs if needed • Conduct analyses by using existing Supply Chain Control Tower with focus on Operations and Planning. • S&OP process improvement & development • Collaborate with internal and external partners. • Active contribution to internal projects (e.g., in process enhancements, software implementation). • Collect and define requirements for additional reporting & controlling needs. • Supporting the S&OP Manager in all analytical matters. • Application and master data maintenance in Production Planning.
Qualifications for the role
Degree in Supply Chain Management & Operations, Controlling, Business Administration or similar discipline.
>3-5 years of relevant work experience
Fluent communication skills in German and English language.
Reliable analytical skills paired with the ability to understand and embrace the complexity of industrial production.
Good understanding of production process, production planning and S&OP.
Good understanding of Operations & Planning KPIs and metrics.
Experience with SAP ERP (mainly PP module), production planning software (e.g., PP/DS) or other supply chain planning software (e.g., SAP IBP) as well understanding of the underlying data structures.
Experience with the use of a Production or Supply Chain Control Tower or other analysis-driven software.
Experience with BI/Dashboard tools (e.g., MS Power BI, Tableau).
Knowledge of MS Office with very good knowledge of MS Excel.
Database know-how desirable.
Affinity for new technologies and the drive for independent learning.
Ability to drive change.
More about us

At B&R - a member of the ABB Group, you can expect an exciting and challenging job with an individually tailored introductory training. You will work in agile teams where you have the opportunity to actively contribute and drive ideas forward. Our flexible work models (e.g. flextime, hybrid) offer you an optimal work-life balance. Our unique B&R spirit is characterized by appreciation, communication at eye level and an informal work culture. We offer you customized training and development programs as well as exciting development opportunities within the company. Numerous other B&R benefits (Parental Leave Program, Employee Assistance Program and many more) round off our offer. In order to comply with legal regulations, we refer to the minimum salary of the collective agreement of the electrical and electronics industry of € 3665,31 gross/month. There is a clear willingness to overpay, depending on qualifications and experience. ABB's Machine Automation Division, also known to our customers as B&R, is an innovative automation company headquartered in Austria with additional offices around the world. B&R became part of ABB's Robotics & Discrete Automation division in 2017 and, together with the ABB Robotics division, employs more than 11,000 people at over 100 locations in more than 53 countries. As a leading global provider of automation solutions, B&R develops, produces and sells industrial electronics, software solutions and mechatronic solutions as well as technologies for machine and factory automation. Since 2020, B&R's automation portfolio has also included Codian brand delta robots. With its innovative solutions, B&R sets new standards and consistently exceeds its customers' expectations. We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. ABB Data Privacy Statement: https://new.abb.com/privacy-notice/candidate",,,,,2024-12-01 15:18:27,,
975071,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/975071,"(New York, US) Market Data Sales / Lead Generation",Novus Precision Partners,,,,,"Market Data Sales / Lead Generation (New York, US)

As a leading resourcing partner in the Asia region, Novus Precision Partners are proud to be working with a prestigious international financial institution, looking to expand their team in New York, US.

Contribute to the collective knowledge of the sales team globally
Skills / attributes required:
Excellent English communication (verbal and written)
Experience with cold calling
Experience with research and maintaining databases
Proficient in MS Office including Word, Excel, and Outlook
Experience in using CRM
Strong project and time management skills
Qualifications / experience required:
Bachelor's degree
1-2-year(s) experience in Lead Generation (Advertising Sales, Sales, Market Research etc)",,,,,2024-12-01 15:18:32,,

975341,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/975341,Data Architect,Chevron,,,,,"Chevron is accepting online applications for the position of Data Architect located in Makati City, Philippines through December 3, 2024 at 11:59 p.m. PH Time
column2: with flexible onboarding date .

column1: Join our Team

Chevron invests on its people to build technical and professional competencies through various training opportunities, development programs, mentoring/coaching engagements , and certification courses. All are applied through experiential learning and actual practice while solving real business problems, but in a safe, supportive, and ""fail-fast"" environment.

Technology will play a crucial role in unlocking ever cleaner and more affordable sources of energy. Chevron is seeking innovative, technology professionals with a desire to thrive in the global digital environment and help us lead the global energy transition. An IT career at Chevron offers you the opportunity to work in a technical environment with a global reach. We differentiate ourselves through the application of cutting-edge technology, and by taking a collaborative approach that includes in-house expertise , proprietary solutions, and strategic partnerships. We also offer flexible work schedules and very competitive benefits.

Data architects lead the design and implementation of data collection, storage, transformation, orchestration (movement) and consumption to achieve optimum value from data. They are the technical leaders within data delivery teams. They play a key role in modeling data for optimal reuse, interoperability, security and accessibility as well as in the design of efficient ingestion and transformation pipelines. They ensure data accessibility through a performant, cost-effective consumption layer that supports use by citizen developers, data scientists, AI, and application integration. And they instill trust through the employment of data quality frameworks and tools. The data architect at Chevron predominantly works within the Azure Data Analytics Platform, but they are not limited to it. The architect is responsible for optimizing costs for delivering data. They are also responsible for ensuring compliance to enterprise standards and are expected to contribute to the evolution of those standards resulting from changing technologies and best practices.
Responsibilities:
Design and implement scalable, high-performance data architectures that meet business requirements.
Model data for optimal reuse, interoperability, security and accessibility.
Develop and maintain data flow diagrams, and data dictionaries.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data needs and translate them into technical solutions.
Ensure data accessibility through a performant, cost-effective consumption layer that supports use by citizen developers, data scientists, AI, and application integration.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security across all data systems.
Lead the design and implementation of data warehouses, data lakes, and other data storage solutions.
Establish and enforce data governance policies and best practices.
Ensure compliance to enterprise standards and contribute to the evolution of those standards resulting from changing technologies and best practices.
Mentor and guide junior data engineers and analysts.
Mentor other data architects.
Influence and guide the evolution of data architecture standards across the enterprise.
Requirements:
Proven experience as a Data Architect or similar role.
Strong knowledge of data modeling, data warehousing, and data integration techniques.
Proficiency in database management systems (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL).
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data lake solutions (e.g., Azure Data Lake, AWS Lake Formation).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Platform).
Strong understanding of data governance and security best practices.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in Erwin, Azure Synapse, Azure Databricks, Azure DevOps, SQL, Power BI, Spark, Python, R.
Familiarity with Azure AI/ML Services, Azure Analytics: Event Hub, Azure Stream Analytics, Scripting: Ansible
Experience with machine learning and advanced analytics.
Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks.
Working with us
There are two Chevron companies operating in the Philippines: Chevron Holdings Incorporated (CHI) and Chevron Philippines Incorporated (CPI).

CHI is a shared services center providing transactional, processing, and consulting services in the areas of finance and accounting, information technology, supply chain management, human resources, downstream customer service and marketing. Established in 1998, CHI serves Chevron affiliates in six continents around the world. Over the years, it has grown to be one of the leading members of the shared services industry in the Philippines.
CHI has received various recognitions as a top employer: the 2022 Diversity Company of the Year
column2: 2021 Asia's Best Employer Brand Award
column4: 2020 HR Asia Best Companies to Work for in Asia
column5: 2019 Circle of Excellence, Top Employer Category at Asia CEO Awards, and the 2018 Wellness Company of the Year at the same Asia CEO Awards.

column1: CPI markets the Caltex brand of top-quality fuels, lubricants, and petroleum products through a network of service stations, terminals and sales offices.

At Chevron, we are committed to fostering diversity and inclusion at all levels of our company and at all stages of the employee experience. We constantly strive to attract, develop, and retain diverse Filipino talent. Globally, Chevron Corporation has achieved a rating of 100 percent in the Human Rights Campaign Equality Index for the past 17 years. The Index ranks American companies based on their commitment to equality in the workplace.
Benefits
Competitive salary
Allowances, medical and optical reimbursements
Health care coverage for you and your eligible dependents
Robust employee centred programs for health and wellness
Time-off to promote healthy work-life balance or to care for your family
Annual corporate incentive bonus when the company meets established goals
Recognition & awards program
Long-term savings plan
Life insurance
Career development opportunities to all employees through onboarding, training and development, mentoring, volunteering opportunities and employee networking groups
Hybrid work model - work remotely from home several days a week
Connect with us:
Facebook
Instagram
LinkedIn
Twitter
YouTube Chevron
YouTube Caltex
Chevron participates in E-Verify in certain locations as required by law.
Makati City, Metro Manila

935588,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/935588,"VP, Data Center Segment -Power Systems Architect",Eaton,,,,,"What you'll do:
The primary function of this role is to guide the product management cycle and influence the market in the critical power space within the datacenter segment.
Principal areas of responsibility
Research trends in the IT and Datacenter industries that may impact the way electrical energy and heat are managed in datacenters, and the way datacenters are built and managed over their lifecycle
Research new technologies available with Eaton ERLs, Universities, and other technology companies of all sizes

Work with BUs and KAMs to formulate possible future scenarios for various types of datacenters, and how Eaton can differentiate by designing the architecture offering the best value proposition to all stages of the datacenter design, build, operations and maintenance. Work with ERLs and BUs to implement architecture recommendations
Interact with key industry leaders to perform VoC, receive feedback on our offerings and influence engineering choices.
Research the IT and datacenter industries and new technologies
Participate in key IT and datacenter technical conferences (trade of academic), engage with customers', thought leaders, and engineers to identify emerging topics, central to the industry
Regularly interact with partners (upstream, downstream, technology) to discuss industry trends
Work with ERLs and university partners to understand emerging technologies and establish research priorities
Represent Eaton in universities with major clusters of labs working on computer science and datacenters
Formulate possible future scenarios for various types of datacenters
Work with leaders to segment the datacenter industry by archetype
Formulate requirements and scenarios for each datacenter archetype that will serve as reference point for VoC, influence and research / NPD
Work with GPLs and Engineering leaders to create roadmaps aligned with scenarios
Actively contribute to the Eaton planning cycle, including Strategy Plan, GPL waterline or direct involvement in important NPDs
Interact frequently with customers and partners
Conduct VoC to deepen our understanding of customers' constraints and requirements and influence their design
Work with partners on common designs to resolve constraints and satisfy requirements
Engage with customers outside of bidding periods to discuss options and drive preferences for Eaton
Contribute directly to specific bids for enterprise/strategic customers
Regularly represent Eaton's view on datacenters in media and conferences
Represent the technical and economic vision of Eaton for the datacenters in public settings and with the press
Promote Eaton's viewpoint with regulators and lawmakers as needed
Qualifications:
Master degree in Engineering, preferably Electrical Engineering
15+ years' experience as a lead engineer/thought leader, with experience in the datacenter or IT industry
Deep knowledge of all the critical power chain systems. Working knowledge of construction methods and thermal management
Experience in datacenter design and construction
Proven track record of successfully interacting at C level with customers and channel partners
Proven ability to speak publicly and engage diverse audiences
Knowledge in product lines of Eaton Electrical segments (plus)
Knowledge and experience with go-to-market / datacenter ecosystem
Proven ability to educate stakeholders on need for change and lead the way forward
Capacity to obtain VoC from customers and partners, even when it contradicts our positions
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship now or in the future.
The expected annual salary range for this role is $195,000.03 - 286,000.04 a year
Please note the salary information shown above is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

907602,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/907602,Financial control and Data Supervisor,Emerson,,,,,"In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

Review through NOETIX and Power BI reports the correct and on time records within the modules Accounts Payable (AP), Accounts Receivable (AR), Purchase Orders (PO), General Ledger (GL), Fixed Assets (FA), Cost (CST), i-Expenses (CST) and i-Expenses (CST).

Ensure compliance and adherence to tax law reforms through the Mexico City Shared Services Center.

Supervise direct reports.
Administrator of the SharePoint for plant output control.

English level B2

At Schneider Electric, we place particular emphasis on ethics in the workplace and compliance with the law and internal regulations. 996741,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/996741,Sr Data Program Management Specialist - M&A,Honeywell,,,,,"Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
The future is what we make it.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn't just about developing cool things. That's why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

As a Sr Data Program Management Specialist here at Honeywell, you will play a critical role in overseeing and managing data programs and initiatives across the organization. You will be responsible for ensuring the successful execution of data projects, driving data governance, and optimizing data utilization. Your expertise in data management and program management will be instrumental in driving operational excellence and innovation in data-driven decision making.

You will report directly to our Data Program Manager, and you'll work out of our Charlotte, NC or Atlanta, GA location on a hybrid work schedule. In this role, you will impact the organization by driving the strategic implementation of data programs, ensuring data quality and integrity, and enabling data-driven decision-making across the company.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Evaluate and enhance existing data migration processes across various teams, ensuring alignment with industry best practices and organizational goals
Guide and oversee large-scale data migration projects, including planning, execution, and post-migration validation
Work with cross-functional teams, including data architects, business analysts, and IT professionals, to define migration requirements and strategies
Utilize Gen AI/AI/Data Science techniques to develop innovative solutions that accelerate data migration processes and improve efficiency
Develop detailed data migration plans, including timelines, resource allocation, and risk management strategies

Standardize data requirements, templates for migration, extraction strategies, testing and measuring productivity through the current Gen AI capabilities, and work with development teams to improve the tools
Evaluate opportunities for the application of Data Science or Gen AI or AI for data cleansing and data transformation, ensuring data quality and accuracy
Establish and enforce data quality standards and best practices throughout the data migration process
Regularly update stakeholders on migration progress, demand, and milestones
Provide training and facilitate end-users on new systems and processes implemented during the data migration
Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation within the data migration framework
Ensure technical teams are reusing the capabilities built and establish governance to follow the defined standards
Align timelines across technical towers to ensure seamless integration and migration
BENEFITS OF WORKING FOR HONEYWELL

In addition to a competitive salary, leading-edge work, and developing solutions side-by-side with dedicated experts in their fields, Honeywell employees are eligible for a comprehensive benefits package. This package includes employer subsidized Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
column2: Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
column3: 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, EAP, and Educational Assistance
column4: Parental Leave, Paid Time Off (for vacation, personal business, sick time, and parental leave), and 12 Paid Holidays. For more information visit www.honeywell.com.

column1: U.S. PERSON REQUIREMENTS

YOU MUST HAVE

996149,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/996149,Technology Director - Data Science(Power Systems/Utilities),"Aspen Technology, Inc.",,,,,"The driving force behind our success has always been the people of AspenTech. What drives us, is our aspiration, our desire and ambition to keep pushing the envelope, overcoming any hurdle, challenging the status quo to continually find a better way. You will experience these qualities of passion, pride and aspiration in many ways - from a rich set of career development programs to support of community service projects to social events that foster fun and relationship building across our global community.
The Role

As a Technology Director (Data Science) in our Technology Group, you provide technical leadership in innovating the next generation of AspenTech's Digital Grid Management solutions. We are looking for sharp, disciplined, and highly quantitative individuals who have a passion for playing with complex data and cutting-edge technologies, in all its forms, including data mining, mathematical modeling and cognitive computing. You will leverage your skills and passion for Machine Learning, AI and Cognitive Computing to enhance AspenTech's Digital Grid Management suite by developing ground-breaking software.
Your Impact

Provide technical guidance to a group of data scientists, engineers, and software developers to develop new machine learning applications for the Energy industry in the intersection of AI and Power Systems.
Collaborate with customers, product managers and technical staff to develop technology strategies to promote continuous innovation in our Digital Grid Management offerings.
Investigate new and developing technologies as they appear in industry and academia and determine how to leverage these new technologies in our software applications.
What You'll Need
Master's in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science with Power Systems Emphasis, or a related major
column2: PhD preferred.

column1: 10+ years of experience in AI/ML applications and software development in the Power System domain.
Strong expertise required in one of these areas: Generation, Transmission, Distribution, Distributed Energy Resource, SCADA, Contingency Analysis, Power System Optimization.
Demonstrated ability to use scientific research to deliver value to customers and are motivated to deliver results in a fast-paced environment.
Track record of experience in Python programming, including data science specific packages, such as Pandas, Numpy, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn etc.
Demonstrated experience with machine learning algorithms (regression, semi-supervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, time series analysis, predictive modeling, cognitive computing).
Familiarity with modelling in simulation software e.g., PSS/E, PSCAD, PowerFactory, Matlab/Simulink or equivalent and respective analytics of results.
Experience with LLM, generative AI, MLops, Graph Knowledge, and/or cloud technologies is a plus.
History of publishing research and results in the ML and Power System field.
Participation in the design, development, evaluation, and deployment of scalable data-driven models and analytical solutions for machine learning application.
Problem-solving ability and attention to details.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, writing, and presentation skills.
Demonstrated ability to convey complex information in a clear and concise manner.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:19:20,,
991549,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/991549,"Trainee IT (Cyber Security/Data/Cloud) - International Graduate Programm (m/w/d) (Essen, DE)",E.ON,,,,,"E.ON SE | Unbefristet | Vollzeit

It's on us - to make new energy work! Wir suchen daher, vorzugsweise zum 01.06.2024, einen Trainee IT (Cyber Security/Data/Cloud) (m/w/d) zur Verstärkung unseres Teams bei E.ON, um die Energiewende in Europa mitzugestalten. Bei Interesse bewirb dich bitte online bis zum 31.12.2024.
Was wir dir bieten
Als Teil des E.ON International Graduate Programms mit Schwerpunkt IT hast du die Möglichkeit, den E.ON Konzern 24 Monate lang kennenzulernen und voranzutreiben. Darauf kannst du dich freuen:
Einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag
Individuelle Unterstützung durch persönliche, selbst gewählte Mentoring-Begleitung, einen ""Buddy"" und HR

Eine maßgeschneiderte Lernreise, bestehend aus gemeinsamen einwöchigen ""Capability & Development Camps"" alle vier Monate sowie auf deine persönlichen Bedürfnisse abgestimmte Training- und Coaching-Sessions
Praxisnahes Lernen und fachkundige Begleitung durch Einblicke in eine Vielzahl von Bereichen im Rahmen von insgesamt ca. sechs nationalen sowie internationalen Placements
Die Möglichkeit, ein konzernweites und globales Netzwerk aufzubauen
Spannende Aufgaben in diversen und internationalen Teams, sowie innerhalb der Trainee Kohorte
Work-Life Balance durch hybrides Arbeiten, flexible Arbeitszeiten, Vereinbarkeit von Privat- und Berufsleben sowie bis zu 20 Arbeitstage Workation
Corporate Benefits, z. B. Mitarbeiteraktienprogramm, betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Mitarbeiterrabatte, spezielle Versicherungen, Fahrrad-Leasing (und noch viel mehr)
Weitere Informationen über das Programm (z. B. Aufbau, Gehalt, Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten nach dem Programm) findest du auf unserer Website.
Was du von uns erwarten kannst

Die E.ON Digital Technology spielt eine Schlüsselrolle bei der Gestaltung der Energiewende, indem wir die digitale Transformation für den gesamten E.ON Konzern in ganz Europa vorantreiben. Wir entwickeln kreative Ideen, gehen neue Wege, lassen Visionen Wirklichkeit werden und erwecken innovative Technologien zum Leben. In flexiblen Arbeitsmodellen und Teams liefern wir nachhaltige Technologielösungen für die Energieherausforderungen von morgen.

Während des Programms hast du die Chance, in verschiedenen funktionalen Bereichen vor allem innerhalb der E.ON Digital Technology zu arbeiten (z. B. Strategy & Architecture, Cyber Security, Data Analytics & IoT, Digital Platforms oder Infrastructure Services)
Außerdem absolvierst du jeweils mindestens ein funktionsübergreifendes und internationales Placement

Darüber hinaus bieten wir dir die Möglichkeit, globale Einblicke in das Geschäft von E.ON mit dem Schwerpunkt auf Themen wie Cloud Computing & Platform, Software Engineering & Development, Data & Artificial Intelligence oder Cyber Security in ganz Europa zu gewinnen (z.B. Schweden, UK, Rumänien)
Was wir uns von dir wünschen

Du hast einen überdurchschnittlich abgeschlossenen Bachelor-Abschluss in einem IT-bezogenen Studium wie Wirtschaftsinformatik, Cyber Security, Data Science oder vergleichbar mit mindestens 2 Jahren einschlägiger Berufserfahrung oder einen entsprechenden Master-Abschluss
Die Bereitschaft, die digitale Transformation des gesamten E.ON-Konzerns aktiv mitzugestalten, zeichnet dich aus
Du sprichst fließend Englisch
Idealerweise hast du internationale Erfahrungen durch Auslandsaufenthalte in Form von Auslandssemestern, Praktika oder ehrenamtlicher Arbeit gesammelt
Deine ersten IT-Kenntnisse, insbesondere in den Bereichen Softwareentwicklung, Webtechnologien, Cloud Computing, Data & AI, Cyber Security oder agiles Projektmanagement, wären ideal
Du kannst dazu beitragen, sinnvolle Beziehungen zu relevanten Schnittstellen aufzubauen, und verfügst über starke Netzwerkfähigkeiten
Du bringst Einfühlungsvermögen, hohe logische Fähigkeiten und die Bereitschaft mit, dich auf neue Technologien & Konzepte einzulassen, die wir mit dir zusammen weiterentwickeln
Hast du noch Fragen?

Für weitere Informationen kontaktiere bitte unser Trainee Recruiting Team, TraineeRecruiting@eon.com, +49 171 3859712. Wir freuen uns, deine Bewerbung bis zum 31.12.2024 zu erhalten. Bitte lade deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen auf Englisch hoch (Lebenslauf, Notennachweise und, falls vorhanden, Arbeitszeugnisse und Abschlusszeugnis). Ein Anschreiben ist nicht notwendig.
Was du sonst noch wissen solltest:
Beschäftigungsart: Unbefristet
Beschäftigungsgrad: Vollzeit
Gesellschaft: E.ON SE
873023,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/873023,Data Officer,Engie,,,,,"Transversal Data Officer
About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE's assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity ""Global Energy Management & Sales"" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group's large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
Our 4 expertises:
• Asset management
• Energy transition services
• Energy supply & global commodities
• Risk management & market access
At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.
More info on GEMS Hub (https://gems.engie.com) or LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions).
Context:

The transversal data officer works within the global Data Office for GEMS. The Data office is under the direct responsibility of the Chief Data officer and is responsible for data governance, quality as well as driving the overall data strategy for the organization under the guidance of the CDO.
Role:

The transversal data officer primary mission is to ensure the proper operationalization of Data Governance in relation with all stakeholders. Besides, the Data Officer must meet Data Governance program objectives, budget constraints and timeline.
Data Office roadmap and program monitoring:
Assists the CDO in defining the Data Office roadmap considering data centric strategies involving Data Science and AI initiatives
Makes sure that Data Office roadmap is updated
Ensures that KPIs allowing to supervise the governance program advancement are defined and monitored
Assists the CDO in prioritizing data subjects and is involved in the construction of IS roadmap on Data subjects
Assists the CDO in organizing and preparing data committees
Data Office resource and budget monitoring:
Ensures resource & budget availability and allocation for the Data Office
Makes resource & budget allocation adjustments if necessary
Reports and escalate to CDO as needed
Change management / Acculturation
Ensures that the governance framework is communicated and promoted to identified audiences using prescribed channels
Participates with HR in the development of skills improvement plans of data actors
Ensures that HR are informed of new data roles nominations
Supports onboarding of new data roles
Use cases identification and Data Governance linkage:
Identifies strategic use cases with an opportunity to deploy the governance framework
Ensures that data roles are identified and nominated in use cases especially where data pain points are detected
Makes sure that Data Office policies are communicated and supervised by identified data roles
Ensures that identified data roles include data objectives in the use cases they intervene in
Ensures that use cases monitor data management KPIs: quality, access, etc.
Monitors major issues and problems
Identifies opportunities of evolution of the Data Governance framework and makes sure they are processed
Catalog ownership
Guarantees the proper evolution of the data catalog and quality of its content regarding users' needs
Hard skills:
Must have:
Excellence Analytical skills, combined with a hands-on approach
Strong understanding of information management tool and trading systems
Good to have:
The capability and/or interest in code languages (Python etc)
Soft skills:
Must have:
Good interpersonal skills and communication
Eager to learn with a strong business drive
Well organized and pro-active
Ability to interact with both business and IT teams
Good to have:
Good knowledge of the energy industry.
Education and professional background:
5-10 years professional experience in similar role or in a business analyst capacity with ideally a previous experience in data management initiatives.
Languages:
Fluent in French and English, Dutch a plus.
Travels:
Some travel may be required in the various locations where GEMS has offices.
If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!
Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.
ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.
About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (""raison d'être"") is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:19:27,,

The positions duties fall into 3 main processes:

Liaise with the sources owners that feed WPS through interfaces (MDM, Twist, the Active Directory)

Promote the data quality and share the good practices in using WPS
Participates to regular meeting to be informed of the local prediction hypothesis

Business Development

Regularly train new Parisian Heads of Department and review their declarations in the tool to reach with them the accuracy targets
Provide Paris OC Power BI reports about resources and workload prediction
Reporting lines
Hierarchically to the Head of Performance of Paris OC.
Operationally to the Lead Workload Data Analyst
Your profile
Education: you are graduated of a masters degree, whatever the field.
Languages: fluent French and English speaker.
Experience: 3 years at minimum in a position that has exposed you to workload management and tools monitoring
Technical skills:
User of Excel, Power BI or database management
Character traits:
Autonomous
Problem-solving oriented
Affinity with numbers (basic calculations)
Confidence in new software learning and user-experience improvement, interest in the digital governance (without development skill)
Clear and structured writing (design documents)
Interpersonal skills (numerous interactions with Management-level individuals)
Business oriented
Strategic approach (high-level understanding rather than discipline details will matter)
Sense of confidentiality
Would be an asset:
Cost Control or Planning experiences
Whats next ?

Driven by T.EN group's values of inclusion, the division relies on the diversity of its members to progress. This means that this position is open to all and your application will be specifically reviewed.

(NYSE: HON) invents and commercializes technologies that address some of the world's most critical challenges around energy, safety, security, air travel, productivity, and global urbanization. We are a leading software-industrial company committed to introducing state of the art technology solutions to improve efficiency, productivity, sustainability, and safety in high growth businesses in broad-based, attractive industrial end markets. Our products and solutions enable a safer, more comfortable, and more productive world, enhancing the quality of life of people around the globe.
SENIOR PRICING ANALYST-PRICING DATA ANALYSIS

As Senior Analyst- Pricing data analysis here at Honeywell, you will be responsible for leading pricing data analysis to generate actionable insights. You will work closely with business leadership to translate business needs into data analysis solutions. You will be responsible for defining pricing data analysis framework for the business. You will work with cross functional team to gather relational pricing data from Honeywell's Enterprise Data Warehouse and utilize business intelligence tools such as Power BI and Tableau to create reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights to business leaders.
You will manage end-to-end data analysis projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives and the successful delivery of actionable insights.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Own pricing data analysis framework, ensuring alignment with business objectives and the successful delivery of actionable insights.
Apply expertise in statistical modeling and data analysis to develop and implement analytical solutions.
Apply expertise in use of business intelligence tools such as Power BI and Tableau to analyze, report and visualize large pricing data sets and analysis.
Provide mentorship and guidance to team members, fostering a learning, collaborative and innovative team culture.
Apply strong analytical and problem-solving skills to address complex data challenges and generate valuable insights.
YOU MUST HAVE
Bachelor's degree or Advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related discipline.
5+ years of experience in data analysis.
Experience in statistical modeling and data analysis.
Experience of using business intelligence tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
• Experience in SQL (Mandatory)
WE VALUE
• Strategic thinking and the ability to contribute to the overall direction of Pricing discipline.
• Demonstrated ability to lead and mentor team members.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status

1005896,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/administrative-or-secretarial-jobs/1005896,Data Analyst,,,,,,"NES Fircroft are recruiting a Compliance support/analyst (Information Assurance) on behalf of our major engineering and services client in Middlesbrough. This is a full time, permanent position working 37.5hrs per week.

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Compliance Support/Analyst to assist with the ongoing management and monitoring of compliance activities. Reporting to the Information Assurance and Security Lead, you will help ensure that we adhere to relevant regulations, standards, and internal policies, supporting the business in maintaining a robust and compliant environment.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to develop their career in compliance and information security, gaining exposure to a range of industry standards, including GDPR, ISO 27001, and other applicable regulatory frameworks.
Key Responsibilities

•    Support with maintaining, updating, and reviewing compliance-related documentation, including policies, procedures, and guidelines, ensuring they are up to date and in line with regulatory changes.
•    Assist with the preparation of reports and documentation for audits, regulatory reviews, and management reporting, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
•    Support the conduct of risk assessments and gap analyses to identify potential vulnerabilities, non-compliance issues, or opportunities for improvement.
•    Assist with both internal and external audits, helping to gather and organise evidence, track audit findings, and manage remediation plans.
•    Work closely with cross-functional teams, including IT, legal, and operations, to support the implementation of compliance initiatives and address regulatory requirements.
Key Skills and Competencies
•    Ability to review and interpret data, regulations, and policies to support decision-making and compliance activities.
•    Strong focus on accuracy and quality when handling compliance documentation and reports.
•    Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex compliance requirements to non-experts.
•    Aptitude for identifying issues, proposing solutions, and following through with action plans.
•    Able to collaborate effectively with a variety of internal stakeholders and support a culture of compliance across the organisation.
Essential Requirements
•    Good working knowledge of information security/compliance standards and frameworks such as ISO 27001, Cyber Essentials Plus and GDPR.
•    Some experience in compliance, information security, or risk management roles.
•    Previous experience in audit support would be desirable

With over 90 years' combined experience, NES Fircroft (NES) is proud to be the world's leading engineering staffing provider spanning the Oil & Gas, Power & Renewables, Chemicals, Construction & Infrastructure, Life Sciences, Mining and Manufacturing sectors worldwide. 984195,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/984195,Data Manager,bp,,,,,"Job Family Group:
IT&S Group
Job Description:
About bp / team

We are a global energy business involved in every aspect of the energy system. We are working towards delivering light, heat and mobility to millions of people, every day. We are one of the very few companies equipped to solve some of the big complex challenges that matter for the future. We have a real contribution to make to the world's ambition of a low carbon future. Join us, and be part of what we can accomplish together. You can participate in our new ambition to become a net zero company by 2050 or sooner, and to help the world get to net zero.
And we know we can't do it alone. We're looking for people who share our passion for reinvention, to bring fresh opinions, ambition, and to challenge our thinking in our goal to achieve net zero!

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society, our industry and our planet.

Being part of the Wells & Subsurface Data Operations (DataOps) group, you will apply your domain knowledge and familiarity with domain data processes to support the Wells & Subsurface organisation, which is part of bp's Production & Operations business with hubs in London, Pune, and Houston. The DataOps team provides daily operational data management, data engineering and analytics support to this organisation across a broad range of disciplines and petro-technical applications.
You might be a good fit for this role if you:
have experience of the types of data and data processes in subsurface workflows and how Geologists, Petrophysicists, Geoscientists and Geophysicists interact with other subsurface disciplines.
have practical knowledge and hands-on experience in the SLB suite of Petrophysics, Geology and Geophysics applications including SLB Techlog
are customer-focused and a good communicator. You continually seek ways to improve user experience and productivity.
are curious, and keen to apply new technologies, trends & methods to improve existing standards and the capabilities of the Subsurface community.
are well organized and self-motivated, you balance proactive and reactive approaches and multiple priorities to complete tasks on time.
apply judgment and common sense - you use insight and good judgment to inform actions and respond to situations as they arise.
Responsibilities
Hands-on manage corporate data, including data modeling, data cataloging, data governance, quality control and risk control.
Develop and apply procedures, standards and guidelines to collect, secure, handle and share data across the organization.
Align, integrate and consolidate data assets across organizations for better consistency, reliability and efficiency of data operation.
Triage, troubleshoot and authorize the maintenance of data-related problems.
Leverage domain knowledge to partner with business entities to identify patterns, relationships, opportunities and problems in business data. Drive business data requirements.
Develop functional data design based on the business data requirements
Help Data Engineers understand the functions that they need to provide technical design and implementation.
Qualifications
Essential
Bachelor's degree in a STEM field.
At least 2 years industrial experience in managing data.
Hands-on experience with modern, large-scale databases and IT systems.
Solid knowledge and skills of SQL
Proficient at digesting, understanding and analyzing large amounts of data.
Knowledge of data security and privacy compliance policies, like GDPR, NIST and CCPA
Customer-centric and pragmatic mindset.
Focus on value delivery and swift execution, while maintaining attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Desired
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Geology, Geophysics, Petroleum Engineering or other related subsurface area.
Understanding of well log data, the handling of well log data and its associated industry standard file types and data structures.
Expert user of the SLB Techlog product
An understanding of Petrophysics workflows and processes in the interpretation of well log data
Ability to conduct basic log conditioning processes on raw data
Familiarity with industry acquisition tooling (including Wireline & LWD) and associated curve nomenclature
Experience in other G&G industry application packages
Familiarity with Python scripting
Travel Requirement:
Negligible travel should be expected with this role
Relocation Assistance:
This role is eligible for relocation within country
Remote Type:
This position is a hybrid of office/remote working
Skills:

Commercial Acumen, Communication, Data Analysis, Data cleansing and transformation, Data domain knowledge, Data Integration, Data Management, Data Manipulation, Data Sourcing, Data strategy and governance, Data Structures and Algorithms (Inactive), Data visualization and interpretation, Digital Security, Extract, transform and load, Group Problem Solving

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. 952502,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/952502,Data Architect - Industrials & Energy Sector - Senior - Consulting - Location Open,EY,,,,,"At EY, you'll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we're counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.
EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities.
US Consulting - AI & Data - Data Architect, Industrials & Energy Sector - Senior
The opportunity

EY is seeking a Data Architect with strong technology and data understanding having proven delivery capability. Lead the design, development, and management of the organization's data architecture, ensuring scalable, efficient, and secure data solutions that align with business goals and support enterprise-wide data initiatives.
In this role, you will create, maintain, and support the data platform and infrastructure that enables the analytics front-end
column2: this includes the testing, maintenance, construction, and development of architectures such as high-volume, large-scale data processing and databases with proper verification and validation processes.

column1: Your key responsibilities
Design, develop, optimize, and maintain data architecture and pipelines that adheres to ETL principles and business goals
Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines, build out new integrations using AWS native technologies to support continuing increases in data source, volume, and complexity
Define data requirements, gather and mine large scale of structured and unstructured data, and validate data by running various data tools in the Big Data Environment
Support standardization, customization and ad hoc data analysis and develop the mechanisms to ingest, analyse, validate, normalize, and clean data
Write unit/integration/performance test scripts and perform data analysis required to troubleshoot data related issues and assist in the resolution of data issues

Implement processes and systems to drive data reconciliation and monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders, downstream systems, and business processes
Lead the evaluation, implementation and deployment of emerging tools and processes for analytic data engineering to improve productivity
Develop and deliver communication and education plans on analytic data engineering capabilities, standards, and processes
Learn about machine learning, data science, computer vision, artificial intelligence, statistics, and/or applied mathematics
Solve complex data problems to deliver insights that help achieve business objectives
Implement statistical data quality procedures on new data sources by applying rigorous iterative data analytics
Strong understanding & familiarity with all Hadoop Ecosystem components and Hadoop Administrative Fundamentals
Strong understanding of underlying Hadoop Architectural concepts and distributed computing paradigms
Skills and attributes for success
Experience in the development of Hadoop APIs and MapReduce jobs for large scale data processing
Hands-on programming experience in Apache Spark using SparkSQL and Spark Streaming or Apache Storm
Hands on experience with major components like Hive, Spark, and MapReduce
Experience working with NoSQL in at least one of the data stores - HBase, Cassandra, MongoDB
Experienced in Hadoop clustering and Auto scaling
Good knowledge in apache Kafka & Apache Flume
Knowledge of Spark and Kafka integration with multiple Spark jobs to consume messages from multiple Kafka partitions
Advanced experience and understanding of data/Big Data, data integration, data modelling, AWS, and cloud technologies
Strong business acumen with knowledge of the Industrial Products sector is preferred, but not required
Ability to build processes that support data transformation, workload management, data structures, dependency, and metadata
Ability to build and optimize queries (SQL), data sets, 'Big Data' pipelines, and architectures for structured and unstructured data
Experience with or knowledge of Agile Software Development methodologies.
Demonstrated understanding and experience using:
Data Engineering Programming Languages (i.e., Python)

Relational SQL databases
