AWS cloud services and technologies (i.e., Lambda, S3, DMS, Step Functions, Event Bridge, Cloud Watch, RDS)
Databricks/ETL
IICS/DMS
GitHub
Event Bridge, Tidal
To qualify for the role you must have
Flexible and proactive/self-motivated working style with strong personal ownership of problem resolution
Excellent communicator (written and verbal formal and informal)
Ability to multi-task under pressure and work independently with minimal supervision.
Partner with Business Analytics and Solution Architects to develop technical architectures for strategic enterprise projects and initiatives
Coordinate with Data Scientists to understand data requirements, and design solutions that enable advanced analytics, machine learning, and predictive modelling
Support Data Scientists in data sourcing and preparation to visualize data and synthesize insights of commercial value
Collaborate with AI/ML engineers to create data products for analytics and data scientist team members to improve productivity
Advise, consult, mentor and coach other data and analytic professionals on data standards and practices, promoting the values of learning and growth
Foster a culture of sharing, re-use, design for scale stability, and operational efficiency of data and analytical solutions
Ideally, you'll also have
Experience in leading and influencing teams, with a focus on mentorship and professional development
A passion for innovation and the strategic application of emerging technologies to solve real-world challenges
The ability to foster an inclusive environment that values diverse perspectives and empowers team members
FY25CH
What we offer

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you'll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The base salary range for this job in all geographic locations in the US is $105,800 to $174,800. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $127,100 to $198,600. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Join us in our team-led and leader-enabled hybrid model. Our expectation is for most people in external, client serving roles to work together in person 40-60% of the time over the course of an engagement, project or year. Under our flexible vacation policy, you'll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You'll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
Continuous learning: You'll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We'll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We'll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You'll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
EY accepts applications for this position on an on-going basis. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

1003194,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1003194,Data Scientist,Exxon Mobil,,,,,"About us

At ExxonMobil, our vision is to lead in energy innovations that advance modern living and a net-zero future. As one of the world's largest publicly traded energy and chemical companies, we are powered by a unique and diverse workforce fueled by the pride in what we do and what we stand for.

The success of our Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses is the result of the talent, curiosity and drive of our people. They bring solutions every day to optimize our strategy in energy, chemicals, lubricants and lower-emissions technologies.

We invite you to bring your ideas to ExxonMobil to help create sustainable solutions that improve quality of life and meet society's evolving needs. Learn more about our What and our Why and how we can work together .
ExxonMobil in Malaysia

ExxonMobil is one of the world's largest publicly traded energy providers and chemical manufacturers, ExxonMobil develops and applies next-generation technologies to help safely and responsibly meet the world's growing needs for energy and high-quality chemical products.

In Malaysia, we are involved in significant oil and gas production operations and the marketing of chemical products. We also host a global business and technology center in Kuala Lumpur that provides high-level information technology and engineering expertise to ExxonMobil's upstream, downstream and chemical businesses worldwide.
What role you will play in the team

You will be part of our exciting and rapidly expanding Kuala Lumpur Modeling, Optimization & Data Science(MODS) team working and collaborating on a global scale providing deep technical insights and support to ExxonMobil's Product Solutions business and supply chain/commercial activities.

As a key member of the team and depending on your level of experience, you will be the single point of contact to improve business performances, or actively developnew models for integration to supportour business lines in Product Solutions.
Position is based in Kuala Lumpur and not limited to Malaysians only.
What you will do
Develop, deploy and act as the single point of contact for specific data science problems within maintenance domain, technology support, uptake and value generation
Develop and evaluate new models using Timeseries modeling/NLP/Computer vision using Python and/or integrating 3rd party tools with EM data/platforms
Support Principal Engineer(s) in development and execution of their technology area strategy consistent with the overall discipline vision and ensures alignment with business objectives
Assist in developing and delivering technical training content
Understand maintenance workflow and enhancements requests and develop new model/features and testing plan
Demonstrate industry leadership at conferences or via publications/patents (where applicable)
Develop a level of expertise in specific technical disciplines to be recognized as a future leading global expert
Supports discovery, development and deployment activities for the focused technology area consistent with the Technology Portfolio strategic vision and business partner goals
About you
Skills and Qualifications
What you should have
Degree in engineering, computer science or related disciplines
Open to campus and experience hires
Working knowledge in at least one of the programming languages (Python/C++/others)
Interested in upskilling in Timeseries modeling/Machine learning/Deep learning, learn about cloud technologies
Completed basic online courses/certification in data science or related subject
Initiative to learn new things
column2: e.g. learning technology development and delivery

column1: Nice to have
Understanding of surface engineering concepts
Understanding of Machine learning or deep learning concepts
Understanding of supply chain concepts
Your Benefits:
We are committed to providing benefits that are competitive and support the needs of our employees.
Application Process
Please be informed that only shortlisted candidates will be notified, and you can find out more about our hiring process here .

Equal Opportunity Employer

1001813,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1001813,"Senior Manager Data Governance & Management (m/w/d)* (Quickborn, DE)",E.ON,,,,,"Schleswig-Holstein Netz GmbH | Quickborn bei Hamburg | Unbefristet | Vollzeit

Schleswig-Holstein Netz plant, baut und betreibt Strom- und Gasnetze im Norden. Fast 3 Millionen Menschen verlassen sich täglich darauf, dass Strom und Gas durch unsere Netze zu ihnen kommen. Wir sind Teil der HanseWerk-Gruppe - einem der größten Energiedienstleister Norddeutschlands mit 2.000 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern an verschiedenen Standorten. Unsere Erfahrung stecken wir in frische Ideen, die wir als Serviceleistungen Privatkunden, Kommunen und Unternehmen anbieten. Werde Teil unseres engagierten Teams und gestalte mit uns die Energiewende!

Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams der Schleswig-Holstein Netz GmbH suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt für unseren Standort Quickborn bei Hamburg einen Senior Manager Data Governance & Management (m/w/d)*.
Deine Aufgaben
Data Governance gestalten und implementieren: Du baust die Data Governance-Struktur auf und bist eigenverantwortlich für die Klassifizierung relevanter Dateneinheiten und -prozesse.

Strategische Planung und Koordination: Du planst und steuerst die Einführung der Data Governance in allen Geschäftseinheiten der Schleswig-Holstein Netz GmbH und entwickelst gemeinsam mit unseren Konzernpartnern Strategien, Richtlinien, Standards und Prozesse zur effizienten Datenverwaltung.
Werkzeuge und Schulungen: Du übernimmst die Einführung eines Data Quality Tools in den Geschäftsbetrieb und leitest Informations- und Schulungskampagnen zur Verbesserung der Datenqualität.
Modernste Technologien: Du nutzt innovative Technologien in der Azure Cloud wie den Unity Catalogue, Databricks und Data Management Tools (z. B. ERWIN von Quest).
Berichtswesen und Kommunikation: Du erstellst Berichte und Präsentationen in Deutsch und Englisch für die Geschäftsleitung und den Vorstand und präsentierst diese kompetent.
Fachliche Zusammenarbeit: Du bist zentraler Ansprechpartner für Applikationsmanagement, Datenschutz, Informationssicherheit sowie die Fachabteilungen im Unternehmen und Konzern.
Dein Profil
Deine Persönlichkeit: Du arbeitest eigenverantwortlich und motiviert, kommunizierst hervorragend, trittst sicher auf und fühlst dich in agilen Teams wohl.
Deine Qualifikation: Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium, idealerweise in Informatik, Mathematik, Ingenieurwesen oder Betriebswirtschaft.
Deine Berufserfahrung: Du bringst mehrjährige praktische Erfahrung in Data Management, Data Stewardship oder Data Governance mit.

Deine Kompetenzen: Du bist analytisch stark, löst Probleme strukturiert und besitzt idealerweise Kenntnisse in Metadaten-Management-Systemen (z. B. Erwin DIS von Quest) oder bist bereit, diese zu erlernen.
Deine Branchenerfahrung: Du hast idealerweise Erfahrung im Energiesektor, insbesondere im Netzbetrieb, und kannst dich schnell in neue Fachthemen einarbeiten.
Deine Sprach- und Technikkenntnisse: Du verfügst über sehr gute Deutsch- (mindestens C1) und gute Englischkenntnisse sowie wünschenswerte Kenntnisse in IT- oder Enterprise-Architektur.
Da wir eine lernende Organisation sind, freuen wir uns über deine Bewerbung, auch wenn du nicht alle Anforderungen zu 100 % erfüllst.
Deine Benefits
Transparente Vergütung: Du erhältst eine attraktive tarifliche Vergütung, Weihnachtsgeld, eine Jahressonderzahlung, vermögenswirksame Leistungen (480 €/Jahr) und eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge.
Zeit für dich: Bei uns hast du eine 37-Std.-Woche, 30 Urlaubstage und zusätzlich frei an Heiligabend und Silvester. Du hast eine Zeiterfassung und kannst dein Zeitguthaben in Freizeit umwandeln.

Flexibilität: Du hast flexible Arbeitszeiten ohne Kernarbeitszeit. Mobiles Arbeiten ist für uns selbstverständlich. Mit dem Workation-Angebot kannst du bis zu 20 Tage im Jahr aus dem EU-Ausland arbeiten.
Sinnstiftende Aufgabe: Bei uns leistest du einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Energiewende - in einem großen Unternehmen und mit einem sicheren Job.
Gesundheit: Ob JobRad, Betriebssport, Sportevents oder durch ausgewogene Ernährung in unserer Kantine - dein persönliches Wohlbefinden ist uns wichtig.
Entwicklung & Weiterbildung: Mit unserem Weiterbildungsangebot fördern wir deine berufliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung, auch durch Projektarbeit im gesamten E.ON-Konzern.

Familie: Als zertifizierter familienfreundlicher Arbeitgeber kooperieren wir mit Partnern, die dich bei der Kinderbetreuung oder bei der Pflege von Angehörigen unterstützen. Zusätzlich erhältst du bei uns einen Geburtenzuschuss von 350€.
Auszeit: Mit unserem Sabbatical-Angebot kannst du eine Auszeit von bis zu 6 Monaten nehmen. Zudem kannst du bei uns Ferienunterkünfte europaweit zu günstigen Konditionen buchen.
Freistellung: Bei besonderen Anlässen, wie z.B. Eheschließung, Umzug, Hochzeit der Kinder oder Silberhochzeit, kannst du dich über den gesetzlichen Rahmen hinaus von der Arbeit freistellen lassen.

*Mit unserer offenen und wertschätzenden Unternehmenskultur heißen wir alle Menschen willkommen. Denn wir sind davon überzeugt, dass uns Unterschiede bereichern - sei es in Herkunft, Geschlecht, Alter, Lebens- und Arbeitsstilen, Talenten, Fähigkeiten und Einschränkungen.
Hast du noch Fragen?

Dann kontaktiere Alexandra Magdalena Lilge gerne per Telefon +4941066299598. Oder bist du jetzt schon überzeugt, dass dies der nächste Schritt in deiner Karriere sein soll? Dann bewirb dich gleich online - ganz ohne Anschreiben. Bitte beachte, dass wir aus datenschutzrechtlichen Gründen Bewerbungen per E-Mail nicht berücksichtigen können.
Solange die Stelle ausgeschrieben ist, suchen wir nach passenden Kandidaten (w/m/d).
Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!
So geht es weiter
Nach Eingang der Bewerbung erhältst du innerhalb der nächsten Tage ein Feedback von uns. Halte dir gerne schon einmal den Kalender für ein mögliches Vorstellungsgespräch frei.
Personaldienstleister bitten wir höflichst von Anfragen abzusehen.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:20:49,,
974912,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/974912,"Team Leader, Energy Data Management (Location: Geneva) Gas & Power Trading IT",Total Energies,,,,,"Context & Environment

In this role, you will be responsible for a delivery team of 8-10 persons and the management and development of a portfolio of systems used within the gas and power trading businesses. The systems scope includes the development and management of the Energy Data Management (EDM), Asset Management and CRM platforms used by the business globally and the related integration to the grid/system operators in each market for the collection of data, but you will be expected to work closely with other delivery teams for the integration of systems and to contribute to run and change activities across teams. To support the continued expansion of the gas and power business, and particularly TotalEnergies transition to power, there is a significant change program in progress that you will be expected to contribute to.
You will report to the Manager of Energy Management Systems, Gas & Power Trading IT.
Activities
Supervise a team of 8-10 persons, approve their time reports, absences, holidays, etc
Ensure the appropriate staffing of your team according to Trading IT guidelines, which shall include both internal and contract resources
Plan and report the activities of your team, manage your delivery team backlog and prioritize activities according to IT and business inputs
Act as a third line support for issues affecting systems in your perimeter, ensure availability and aim to resolve all incidents according to the agreed service levels
Manage any third-party suppliers within your perimeter and according to contract
Coordinate configuration and change requests, as requested by business stakeholders
Provide management level reporting of your backlog and support tickets
Contribute to projects that are managed across delivery teams
Work closely and cooperate with other delivery teams from within Gas & Power Trading IT and the other IT/Technology teams within Trading IT
Enforce governance and standards, including project approvals, technology standards, testing and quality assurance, and so on
Stay informed of market/technology developments relevant to the scope of work
Candidate Profile
5+ years' of work experience in a power utility or a trading environment, and preferably with knowledge of the energy markets
Preference is for somebody that has worked as a Project Manager, Business Analyst, Developer or Application Engineer and that has management ambitions
Knowledge of EDM and CRM systems and processes, including back office and finance functions (settlement and reconciliation), within the energy sector
Training and experience (with certifications) of any of IT service management (e.g. ITIL) project management (e.g. PMI, Prince 2), agile methodologies, cloud and database technologies, is desirable
Educated to at least degree level or an equivalent in a business, computer science or a similar technology or engineering discipline
Fluent in English
column2: competency in French is advantageous

Become one of the drivers of energy transition with TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping.

TotalEnergies is a broad energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people
Trading Shipping :

Give your best to better energy and make the commitment with TotalEnergies. We are one of the most active players in the international oil markets, trading with a vast network of customers and suppliers worldwide: national oil companies, producers, other oil majors, refiners, traders, distributors and end-users.
We have developed a set of trading strategies and expertise, which allows us to respond permanently to market changes and opportunities, on all physical and paper oil markets.

Satisfying the energy needs of a growing world population, curbing global warming, and adapting to changing customer behaviors and expectations are the three challenges that TotalEnergies must meet over the next 20 years. With its biomass blending and trading activity, TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping is an active participant in the development of sustainable biofuels. Our maritime transport expertise also helps to reduce the carbon footprint of sea transportation and we recently announced the time chartering of new vessels equipped with LNG propulsion.
Learn more about us on:

999830,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/999830,"Digital Upskilling Lead (f/m/d) - Data & AI (Berlin, DE)",E.ON,,,,,"E.ON Digital Technology GmbH | Permanent | Part or Full time
You have a passion for technology and want to make the world a greener place?
Then become a playmaker (f/m/d) and join our team as Digital Upskilling Lead (f/m/d) - Data & AI at E.ON Digital Technology.

We play a key role in shaping the energy transition by leading E.ON's digital transformation across Europe. We explore new paths by developing ideas, breaking new ground, making visions reality, and bringing new technologies to life. We deliver sustainable technology solutions because...
... it's on us to make new energy work!
The Team - your impact

This is your opportunity to become a member of our Digital Empowerment team within E.ON's Digital Technology organization. Our role is to empower all employees of the E.ON Group to acquire critical digital skills.

Digital Empowerment provides comprehensive learning experiences in key digital technologies to empower employees to embrace digital change through a structured digital upskilling approach that provides the mindset, skillset and toolset to transform E.ON into an all-digital company.
Your Role - meaningful & rewarding
You make us better - You drive and improve Data and AI literacy across the entire E.ON Group - from field worker to top executive
You know your users - In close collaboration with our business units you develop and deliver a relevant and highly engaging Data and AI learning curricula for all employees
You take accountability - You manage your upskilling area as a product and take full accountability for the success of your offerings within the agreed budget
You deliver fast - You define the strategy, set the direction and deliver learning experiences, leveraging agile delivery methods and steering your product team
You know your topic - You have a solid understanding of the topic of Data & AI and how to engage and educate a highly diverse workforce and you keep that knowledge current
You are a master of collaboration and can connect with stakeholders at all levels in the organization
Your Profile - authentic & open-minded
You have a degree in Human Resources, Education, Business Management, Computer Science or a related discipline or other significant work experience
You have several years of relevant experience within the areas of Learning Experience ideally in a client-facing/commercial oriented role and Data and/or AI
Proven experience with customer/employee journey design and associated analytics to measure the effectiveness of your products, as well as agile methodologies
Ability to work both independently as well as functionally lead, using strong communication and cross functional collaboration skills
You have a demonstrated ability to understand business needs and translate them into product requirements and solutions
You are fluent in German and English
Our Benefits - smart & useful
Enjoy flexibility: You can combine coming to the office and working from home flexibly. It's even possible to go on workation for up to 20 days per year within Europe.

Advance your development: We grow and we want you to grow with us. Learning on the job, exchanging with others, or taking part in an individual training - our learning culture enables you to bring your personal and professional development to the next level.
Get connected: Take the opportunity to engage in our Digital Empowerment Communities for collaboration, learning, and network building.

Recharge your battery: You have 30 days of paid vacation per year plus Christmas and New Year's Eve off. Your battery still needs charging? You can exchange parts of your salary for more paid vacation or you can take a sabbatical.
Elevate your mobility: From car and bike leasing offers to a subsidised Deutschland-Ticket - your way is our way.
Think ahead: With our company pension scheme and a great insurance package we take care of your future.
This is by far not all... We are looking forward to speaking with you about further benefits during the hiring process.
Do you have questions?
For further information please contact Sarah Klammer, sarah.klammer2@eon.com.
Please understand that for data protection reasons we can only accept applications submitted via our portal. Unfortunately, we cannot consider application documents that reach us by email or post.
What you need to know:
Job Req ID: 232312
Contract type: Permanent
Working time: Part or Full time
Company: E.ON Digital Technology GmbH
Location: Berlin, Essen, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Hannover, München, Würzburg
Function area: Data / IoT

971410,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/971410,Staff Data Manager,bp,,,,,"Job Family Group:
IT&S Group
Job Description:
About bp / team

We are a global energy business involved in every aspect of the energy system. We are working towards delivering light, heat and mobility to millions of people, every day. We are one of the very few companies equipped to tackle some of the big complex challenges that matter for the future. We have a real contribution to make to the world's ambition of a low carbon future. Join us, and be part of what we can accomplish together. You can participate in our new ambition to become a net zero company by 2050 or sooner, and to help the world get to net zero.
And we know we can't do it alone. We're looking for people who share our passion for reinvention, to bring fresh opinions, ambition, and to challenge our thinking in our goal to achieve net zero!

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society, our industry and our planet.

Being a Squad Lead within the Wells & Subsurface Data Operations (DataOps) group, you will manage a team that supports the team, which is part of bp's Production & Operations business with hubs in London, Pune, and Houston. The DataOps team provides daily operational data management, data engineering and analytics support to this organisation across a broad range of disciplines and petro-technical applications.
You might be a good fit for this role if you:
Are experienced in overseeing a subsurface data management team!
have an extensive background in hands-on subsurface data management across a variety of systems and industry applications
can balance hands-on data management together with squad leadership
Are customer-focused and a good communicator. You continually seek ways to improve user experience and productivity.
Are curious, and keen to apply new technologies, trends & methods to improve existing standards and the capabilities of the Wells & Subsurface community.
Are well organized and self-motivated, you balance proactive and reactive approaches and multiple priorities to complete tasks on time.
Apply judgment and common sense - you use insight and good judgment to inform actions and respond to situations as they arise.
Responsibilities

As part of a cross-disciplinary team, working closely with business partners, other data managers, product managers, data engineers, data analysts and software engineers. You will set data standards, co-design data schemas, ensure quality at the source and write code to (semi-)automate manual data processes wherever possible.
You'll utilise your deep data domain knowledge and business context around data sources and data products.
Work with business partners to coordinate data remediation plans to ensure data sets and data products are fit for purpose at business entity level.
Able to cleanse, transform, reconcile, and standardize data by creating new or modifying existing scripts / automation, to ensure high quality data is available to meet business requirements.

Identify new and impactful opportunities to automate processes and collaborate with data engineers to build new tools and approaches to automate data ingestion, data integration, manipulation and quality control, where needed.
Adhere to and advocate for data management standard methodologies
Have the opportunity to present results to peers and senior management, sharing your findings and influencing decision making.
Create space to mentor and coach others, enabling them to grow.
Qualifications
Essential
Master's degree or equivalent experience in Geology, Geophysics, Petroleum Engineering or other related subsurface area.
Extensive background in hands-on subsurface data management across a variety of systems and applications including SLB Petrel and SLB Techlog suites.
Experience leading, growing and developing a data team of around 7-30 people
Your experience will be hands on in data management, data governance and process automation in complex, fast-paced environments across all data lifecycle stages.
Deep data domain knowledge and experience in the relevant business area.
Expert SQL knowledge.
Advanced scripting experience in Python, Scala or R.
Experience with big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, Hive, and Spark) is a plus.
Solid understanding of data security and privacy compliance policies, like GDPR, NIST and CCPA
Customer-centric and pragmatic attitude. Focus on value delivery and swift execution, while maintaining attention to detail.
Phenomenal communication and customer management skills. Ability to lead large organizations through influence.
A continuous learning and improvement attitude.
Desired
Deep understanding of the data generated and consumed by at least three subsurface disciplines (e.g. Geophysics, Petrophysics, Reservoir Engineering)
Excellent people management, interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Familiarity with the OSDU platform and ecosystem
Accept a culture of change and agility, evolving and adapting continuously
Travel Requirement:
Negligible travel should be expected with this role
Relocation Assistance:
This role is eligible for relocation within country
Remote Type:
This position is a hybrid of office/remote working
Skills:

Commercial Acumen, Communication, Data Analysis, Data cleansing and transformation, Data domain knowledge, Data Integration, Data Management, Data Manipulation, Data Sourcing, Data strategy and governance, Data Structures and Algorithms (Inactive), Data visualization and interpretation, Digital Security, Extract, transform and load, Group Problem Solving
Legal Disclaimer:

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, socioeconomic status, neurodiversity/neurocognitive functioning, veteran status or disability status. Individuals with an accessibility need may request an adjustment/accommodation related to bp's recruiting process (e.g., accessing the job application, completing required assessments, participating in telephone screenings or interviews, etc.). If you would like to request an adjustment/accommodation related to the recruitment process, please contact us.

If you are selected for a position and depending upon your role, your employment may be contingent upon adherence to local policy. This may include pre-placement drug screening, medical review of physical fitness for the role, and background checks.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:21:15,,

990991,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/production-jobs/990991,"Customer Project Principal Planner, Data Centres",Schneider Electric,,,,,"Customer Project Principal Planner
Tier 1 Projects
Sydney, Brisbane, OR Melbourne (Hybrid Work Environment)
Must have full working rights in AU to be considered for this role
Most Sustainable Company in the World, TIME Magazine 2024
LP Gender-Equality Index (GEI), Bloomberg
Inclusive Employer, Diversity Council Australia
World's Most Admired Companies, Fortune Magazine

We have an exciting opportunity for a passionate individual to join the team as a Project Principal Planner in our Sydney, Brisbane or Melbourne offices.

The Principal Planner will be responsible for for managing planning teams using both internal and external resources to deliver professional schedules for our projects. Our projects range from small to large technical services packages with high levels of system integration and are often on construction sites or within operating Data Centers.

The project planner will initiate, develop and maintain project schedules for all large projects, supporting the project managers and technical resources to implement consistent and accurate project schedules and associated reporting functions. The project schedules will follow the Schneider Electric Customer Project Process (CPP) and will enable clear monitoring and visualization of progress, budgets and resource requirements.
What We Offer:
Inclusive Culture: We welcome individuals from diverse backgrounds and encourage applications from all, including women and the LGBTQI+ community

Family-friendly Policies and Flexibility: Hybrid work environment, Paid Leave, Carer's Leave, Grandparent Leave, Community Service, Family and Domestic Violence Leave, Miscarriage Leave, Child's first day of school
Career Growth Opportunities: With access to over 50,000 learning solutions, you'll have the support to shape your unique work-life journey.
Inclusive Leadership and Mentorship: Networking programs tailored to support you in growing your career
Freedom Inspires Innovation
We trust and empower our people to work flexibly, allowing them to thrive and perform at their best.
Our objective is to build teams that are motivated and enabled to perform, to make Schneider Electric a great place to work.
Responsibilities
Work as part of the DC RAC PM team, attend team meetings, 1 to 1 sessions with manager, project managers and other stakeholders to achieve deliverables and outcomes
Deliver project schedules to achieve desired outcomes
Manage project schedules to ensure progress reporting and forecasting enable margin improvement
Ensure compliance to the Schneider Electric Customer Project Process
Manage Risk and opportunity across all projects via the project schedule
Maintain a high level of Customer Satisfaction
Ideal Candidate
Trade/Engineering/Technical based qualification in electrical or refrigeration trade and / or University Degree and / or Post Graduate qualification or relevant experience
At least 5 Years of Project Planning / Implementation / Business management experience required preferably in the Data Centre industry.
Project scheduling certification (desirable)
Project Management certification (desirable)
A history of being able to create, monitor, and analyze large project schedules according to best practices
Ability to track, report, and evaluate project progress whilst ensuring accuracy and version control of project schedules
Ability to identify potential scheduling delays and recommend corrective actions
Strong understanding of project management controls, forecasting and reporting
Background in digital systems / tools, process improvement and data visualization
Background in project execution in a relevant industry such as IT, technology, engineering or construction (highly desirable)
Proven ability to engage stakeholders (up to and including senior management levels) and build positive business partnerships

We will continue to make progress in areas of gender equality, equal pay, pro-women brand, and inclusive culture. Join our team and be in an inclusive environment where we believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.
All applicants must have working rights in Australia at the time of application and will be required to provide documented evidence if selected for interview.

Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles from external agencies or suppliers via any method. If any candidates are submitted in an unsolicited manner, we will consider this as a direct candidate application to Schneider Electric and no fee will be payable.
Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?

When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.

IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.
We are looking for IMPACT Makers
column2: exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.

column1: Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!
₠36 billion global revenue
+13% organic growth
150 000+ employees in 100+ countries
#1 on the Global 100 World's most sustainable corporations
You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and 'inclusion' is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.
You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here

At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here

Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:21:31,,

990879,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/990879,Project Manager (Electrification Distribution Solution - Data Center),ABB,,,,,"Project Manager (Electrification Distribution Solution - Data Center)

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. Write the next chapter of your ABB story.
This position reports to
Regional Project Manager
Your role and responsibilities

In this role, you will have the opportunity to lead the execution of medium-size projects. Each day, you will ensure that all related activities are executed in accordance with procedures, regulations, standards, specifications and targets. You will also showcase your expertise by leading the project team members to achieve project requirements, deliver contracted deliverables, and meet the committed project result. The work model for the role is: #LI-hybrid This role is contributing to the Medium Voltage Switchgears of Electrification Distribution Solution in Thailand. You will be mainly accountable for: • Leading and establishing the project execution approach, and overseeing planning, monitoring and control activities for internal and external resources to accomplish all project goals. • Involves in continuous improvement and simplification. Ensures compliance with relevant cybersecurity regulations, standards, and contractual requirements. Supports in improving guidelines, tools, and templates • Supporting local Sales and Tendering through early involvement in tenders. Monitoring and controlling project progress, efficient resource utilization, and project financials. Overseeing project invoicing status, cost, expenses, and cash flow. • Ensures that the project consistently applies contract and claims management in accordance with ABB policies and contractual agreements. • Coordinates with Supply Chain Management and successfully procures required services, materials, and equipment for the project from external and internal suppliers. Acts as the key contact for the customer and an escalation point for project issues. Builds and maintains strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders and effectively communicates with all stakeholders. • Forecasts schedule to determine if the project is still within defined tolerance ranges and identifies any necessary change requests to drive the closure. Plans and tracks all project activities, establishes scheduling risks and opportunities to deliver projects on time according to commitments to the customer and ABB.
Qualifications for the role
Degree of Engineering.
You are at ease communicating in English and Thai.
Ability to demonstrate your experience in Project Management minimum from 5 years
Stakeholder Management - Chairing meetings and Equipment Inspections on site, SOT's. etc
Possess an enhanced knowledge of Supply Chain/ Procurement - Incoterms and Tax/Duties, SAP and Budget Management
Extensive knowledge of electrical products/services
Familiar with working at site
What's in it for you?
Evolve in your career: through trainings and our Open Job Market, your career development continues!
Learn from highly experienced, genuine, and caring colleagues - people who are committed to helping you achieve your personal and professional goals.
Flexibility: we have hybrid work options, make the best out of them!
More about us

ABB's Distribution Solutions Division facilitates the efficient and reliable distribution, protection and control of power by improving electric power quality while strengthening the resilience of the grid. The Division offers segment-specific products and solutions that largely serve utilities, industry and infrastructure segments, often providing the requisite medium-voltage link between high-voltage transmission systems and low-voltage users. With ABB Ability™ enabled connected solutions at its core, the offering includes medium-voltage air- and gas-insulated switchgear (1 to 66 kilovolts), indoor and outdoor circuit breakers, reclosers, fuses, contactors, relays, instrument transformers, sensors, motor control centers, as well as low-voltage switchgear for the ANSI standard markets."" We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory",,,,,2024-12-01 15:21:35,,

851526,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/851526,Tech lead Data (F/H),Engie,,,,,"Envie de participer à la transition énergétique en poursuivant notre objectif de faire d'ENGIE le leader du confort vert en France ? Rien de plus simple, postulez sur cette offre etrejoignez nos équipes d'ENGIE France Retail !
France Retail du Groupe ENGIE, propose à ses millions de clients particuliers et professionnels en France de l'électricité verte, du gaz naturel ainsi que des services #JagisAvecENGIE.
Au sein de la DSI France Retail à la Direction Grand Public (DGP) en charge de la commercialisation des offres d'énergies et services aux clients particuliers nous recrutons notre :
Tech Lead Data Engineer » (H/F)
Bagneux (92) puis en 2025 dans notre nouveau Campus à la Garenne Colombes
La DSI France Retail comporte 5 départements au service du marché résidentiel (Direction Grand Public) dont le département COE (Centres D'Excellence).

Le COE Data a pour mission de gérer et développer le patrimoine data des particuliers de Engie France B2C à des fins d'analyse, pilotage, connaissance client & ciblage, mais également pour fournir de nouveaux services et usages aux clients.
Le COE Data travaille de concert avec différents métiers et principalement avec la Direction Marketing Data & Communication.

Ainsi, le Centre d'Excellence Data est en charge de l'entrepôt de données (Data Warehouse) « Amadeus », de la solution de campagne Marketing (Salesforce Data Cloud & Marketing Cloud), et de la nouvelle plateforme Data de type Lakehouse pour France Retail.

L'environnement technologique est très riche (base Teradata, ETL Informatica, Tableau, Power BI, Databricks, Spark, S3, Glue, Athena, AWS Lambda, Base faible latence TiDB, API, ... ), avec de nombreux outils, un écosystème sous AWS, un contexte Big Data, Data Science, IA Generative et l'utilisation de 2 principaux langages : SQL et Python.
Vos missions :

Le profil recherché est un Tech Lead pouvant travailler sur tout l'écosystème DATA de la DSI France Retail, en particulier sur la nouvelle plateforme Data de type Lakehouse (pour des usages analytiques et opérationnels) : AWS/Databricks.

Il sera responsable de la conception, de l'architecture et de la mise en œuvre des solutions sur la plateforme DATA de France Retail en prenant en compte les aspects Finops. Ses principales activités sont :
Gérer la Design Authority du COE Data (définition des normes & bornes pratiques, des choix technologiques, de la roadmap technique et formalisation des décisions de conception)

Garantir la qualité, la performance, la scalabilité mais également la sécurité, la conformité réglementaire et l'opérabilité de la plateforme Data et des projets visant à exploiter et valoriser les données
S'assurer de la qualité des développements (en collaboration avec les intégrateurs), et veiller à garantir une bonne conception & modélisation
Collaborer avec les parties prenantes (architecte, infra, développeurs, métier...) pour faire évoluer la plateforme
Piloter les chantiers techniques : veille technologique, études et benchmarks de solution, rationalisation, montées de version...
Animer la communauté des data engineers
Le Tech Lead Data sera référent sur tous les outils et technologies utilisées dans le COE Data.
Vos compétences :
Vous disposez d'un diplôme en informatique (Bac +5) et d'une expérience de 7 ans minimum dans le domaine IT dont 3 en tant que tech lead au cours de laquelle vous avez développé :
Une expertise technique :
Solide compétence dans les langages SQL, Python et Spark (PySpark/SparkSQL).
Expertise sur les technologies AWS et Databricks

Expérience significative en data engineering sur les flux de données, les bases de données (SQL et NoSQL), les appels API, les micro services, le streaming de données (ex : Spark Streaming, Apache Kafka, etc) et les technologies Big Data
Une architecture technique
Solides connaissances d'un écosystème datawarehouse ou d'une plateforme Data (flux de données, modélisation & gouvernance de données, qualité données, reporting & KPI)
Bonne connaissance des problématiques infra (conteneurisation, configuration & gestion d'infrastructure avec terraform, principes DevOps,...)
Expérience pour formuler des conceptions détaillées.
Leadership technique :
Expérience significative en tant que leader technique ou chef de projet IT dans des projets de développement (principes clean code, techniques de tests, pipeline CI/CD...)
Expérience pour encadrer et coacher les Data Engineers
Et naturellement vous disposez de :
Bon relationnel et bonne communication (écrite et orale)
Bon esprit d'analyse et de synthèse
Esprit d'équipe et sens de la relation client
Autonome, méthodique et organisé
Bon niveau écrit et oral en anglais
Notre promesse :

ENGIE France Retail est l'entité du Groupe ENGIE dédiée à la commercialisation d'énergie (gaz naturel et électricité) et des services associés aux clients particuliers et aux artisans, commerçants, professions libérales et TPE. ENGIE France Retail compte 7 000 collaborateurs et des millions de clients partout en France.

Nos équipes innovent chaque jour pour faire d'ENGIE France Retail l'acteur de référence sur les marchés des solutions énergétiques respectueuses de l'environnement, du confort durable et des nouveaux usages. Notre ambition est d'aider nos clients à agir en faveur de la transition énergétique, en consommant moins et mieux.

Afin d'accompagner cette ambition, une nouvelle DSI se développe et recrute de nouveaux talents dans tous les métiers de pointe de l'IT pour répondre aux impératifs du court terme sans négliger la préparation des solutions qui répondent aux enjeux stratégiques de demain. l'aventure vous tente ? rejoignez-nous !
En tant qu'employeur responsable, Engie France Retail valorise la diversité des profils de ses collaborateurs et s'engage en faveur de l'égalité des chances.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:21:39,,
851542,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/851542,Tech lead Referentiel Data (H/F),Engie,,,,,"Expert Référentiel Client & Prospects (H/F) de l'équipe CloudRef
de la Direction Client Professionnels (DCP) de la DSI France Retail
La DCP fournit aux professionnels des services et équipements associés à la commercialisation et à la consommation d'énergie, ainsi qu'à la production décentralisée d'énergie
Poste basé à La Défense T1 (France)
Périmètre d'activité :
Au sein du Département « Domaines Applicatifs et Data» de la Direction Clients Professionnels de la DSI France Retail, vous êtes l'Expert Référentiel Data de l'équipe CloudRef.

A la Direction des Clients Professionnels (DCP), nous nous engageons pour rendre possible et accélérer la transition énergétique de nos clients. C'est une fierté pour les collaborateurs présents et futurs d'avoir cet impact positif sur les personnes et la planète.
Notre ambition est de devenir le 1er intégrateur de services liés à la commercialisation, à la consommation et à la production décentralisée d'énergie, sur le marché des professionnels.

La DCP est organisée en différentes directions. Les équipes Data sont réparties dans la « Direction Marketing et Data » (DMD) et la « Direction des systèmes d'information » (DSI). Vous serez intégré à la partie SI et serez rattaché aux « Domaines Applicatifs et Data» de la Direction Clients Professionnels de la DSI France Retail. Vous travaillerez avec le Product Owner du référentiel CloudRef qui est lui rattaché à la « Direction Marketing et Data » (DMD).
L'équipe Data SI se compose de 2 sous équipes, CloudRef et Plateforme Data. Le poste proposé concerne l'équipe CloudRef.

L'équipe CloudRef administre les outils de MDM (Master Data Management) CloudRef. Elle est en charge du référentiel de données client et prospects, contrats, sites, offres et promotions de la DCP chez Engie. Sa mission est d'une part l'alimentation du éférentiel à partir de données externes afin de consolider et mettre en qualité nos données et d'autre part de mettre à disposition ces données en lecture et en écriture par le biais de services web implémentant des règles de gestion pour s'assurer de la cohérence de la donnée.
Nos principaux consommateurs sont le CRM Pega de la DCP (ISI), l'espace client, la GED ...
La gestion de ces données de référence se fait par le biais d'un ensemble d'outils de MDM (Master Data Management) développé par l'équipe pour les besoins de la DCP.

Elle fonctionne en mode agile avec des sprints de 3 semaines synchronisés avec l'ensemble des équipes de la DSI et quelques équipes métiers. L'outil de suivi des sprints et des PI utilisé est Jira. La méthode SAFE est déployée au sein de la DCP avec notamment la tenue de PI planning regroupant toutes les équipes DSI et quelques équipes métiers tous les 4 sprint. L'ensemble des travaux menés n'est pas inscrit au PI planning, seulement les sujets transverses qui sont suivis par nos équipes UP (Architecte DCP) et RTE (Train).
Le poste proposé est de devenir Expert Référentiel Data au sein de cette équipe.

Il est rattaché aux « Domaines Applicatifs et Data» de la Direction Clients Professionnels de la DSI France Retail et piloté par le Product Owner de l'équipe CloudRef. Il devra collaborer au quotidien avec l'ensemble de l'équipe CloudRef ainsi que d'autres équipes de la DSI.
Missions et Activité(s) principale(s) :
En lien avec l'ensemble de l'équipe CloudRef, l'expert référentiel Data a pour missions principales de :
• Maintenir et faire évoluer ce MDM (Master Data Management) à l'aide des outils mis en place (Excel, VBA, SQL),
• S'assurer du bon déroulement des traitements d'alimentation du référentiel,
• S'assurer du bon fonctionnement des services web permettant d'accéder à ses données,
• Prendre en compte les évolutions du modèle de données en accord avec le Modèle Objet Métier,
• Mettre en place les nouveaux besoins de synchronisation du référentiel avec des sources de données externes au travers d'un ou plusieurs nouveaux flux de données,
• Être le garant du bon fonctionnement des mécanismes de génération automatique des éléments techniques pour toutes ces évolutions :
• Scripts de mise à jour du modèle de données,
• Classes java d'implémentation des services,
• Requêtes d'alimentation des données à partir d'un ODS,
• Documentation des objets et des contrats d'interface des services Web,
• Projets SoapUI de validation automatique des contrôles de surface des services Web,
• JSON Schema des contrats d'interface avec les partenaires.

• Être le garant de l'adaptation du processus du droit à l'oubli du RGPD mis en place dans le référentiel lors de l'évolution du modèle et de l'ajout de flux de données (le référentiel gère ce processus pour tout le SI Engie DCP en communiquant avec les autres systèmes).
• Effectuer des relectures des codes produits par l'équipe et assurer une cohérence dans ces codes
• Former l'équipe et l'aider dans son travail au quotidien
• Proposer des améliorations (nettoyage de code, performances, outils ...)
• Assurer une veille technique, proposer des innovations
• Participer aux recrutements dans l'équipe
Qualité
• Esprit d'équipe
• Implication
• Rigueur, esprit d'analyse,
• Sens du relationnel, qualité d'écoute,
• Autonomie, esprit d'initiative, capacité d'adaptation
• Ténacité, capacité à convaincre
• Souci du détail
Niveau de Formation
BAC +5 en informatique, ou expériences permettant d'acquérir des compétences équivalentes.
Il est demandé un profil avec un niveau de séniorité de 5 à 10 ans d'expérience minimum dans le domaine informatique, dont 3 années minimum dans la Data
Connaissances techniques / expérience dans les domaines suivants :
Indispensables
• SQL,PostgreSQL
• Excel
• capacité à analyser les problématiques liées à la donnée et à la chaine de traitement
d'alimentation d'un référentiel
• VBA
• Flyway
• Spring Batch
• Linux
• AWS S3
• SoapUI
Souhaitées
• Java
• Jira
• Confluence
Profil / Connaissances métier :
• Connaissance du monde de l'énergie
• Connaissance MDM et référentiel data
• Maîtrise des principes de l'agilité et de l'agilité à l'échelle.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:21:43,,
851453,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/851453,Master Data Management & MDG Expert(M/F),Engie,,,,,"Come join one of the most ambitious Transformation Program of Engie
ENGIE's strategy to drive the energy transition and to industrialize the company, making it simpler,

faster, and more integrated, is set. GET, Global Enterprise Transformation, is the Program decided by ENGIE to accelerate and standardize the ERP system as well as the effectiveness of processes, embarking the Company on a centrally steered and business-led transformation focused on making ENGIE an integrated industrial company.
Therefore, GET Program is among the top 5 ENGIE priorities with genuine ExCom sponsorship.
Be part of the Change and come build the Future at one of the most ambitious Transformation Program of the moment.

With a view to harmonization, ENGIE has embarked on a major program to transform its processes and IT tools. This project, which extends over several years, concerns all the entities of the group and requires a sustained support.
To implement this support, we are looking to recruit a :
GET Master Data Management & MDG Expert (M/F)
The head office is based in Courbevoie (La Défense), but the physical presence on the head office is not mandatory. We are also looking for international profiles.

The GET program aims to deliver the future business and IT core model with a central ""one ERP / One ARIBA"" platform. The functional context of the program covers a set of functional areas including accounting, controlling and procurement as main areas.

The GET program offers a unique opportunity to onboard on one of the most ambitious and strategic Enterprise transformation programs with a very high IT footprint with S/4 & SAP ARIBA as central IT components. Innovation is at the heart of GET Program with an ambition to implement a best in class processes & solution.
The GET Master Data Management & MDG Expert role is proposed to reinforce the internal team supporting the core model delivery and coordinating the pilots/rollouts.
This role will be N-2 to GET IT Lead and directly reporting to the core model IT lead.
Job Responsibilities:
Bring high level expertise on MDM and especially SAP MDG
Help the business teams in business requirement definition and ensure coherence with the SAP capabilities
Responsible for reviewing the integrator delivery and challenge the proposed solutions
Align with the business team to ensure the proposed solution is aligned with the core model and the program guidelines
Work with the integrator teams and SAP teams to secure design authority presentations for arbitrations
Secure testing phases and ensure quality of test delivery by the IT integrator
Drive discussions in multi-cultural / global context with multiple stakeholders
Position requirements
Very good knowledge of the SAP MDG and overall the MDM area.
Understanding the process of translating business requirements and processes into data collection and usage principles in MDG.
At least 5 years experience in similar position
Good references in the previous experiences with other customers
Fluent English (oral/written)
May require national & international mobility.
Priority position reserved for ENGIE SA Corporate employees whose position is removed and for DTR employees"".",,,,,2024-12-01 15:21:47,,
851497,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/851497,Expert Data Manager H/F,Engie,,,,,"Vous êtes motivé.e
pour mettre vos compétences au service d'un acteur majeur de la transition énergétique, expert et distributeur du gaz naturel ?
pour participer à l'avenir de la distribution du gaz naturel (compteur communicant, technologies du réseau intelligent, développement du biogaz et du GNV, ...) ?
Vous souhaitez acquérir un véritable savoir-faire technique gazier dans une entreprise qui investit dans les innovations digitales ?
Rejoignez-nous à GRDF !
GRDF, filiale indépendante d'ENGIE, est le principal gestionnaire de réseau de distribution de gaz naturel en France.
GRDF distribue le gaz naturel à plus de 11 millions de clients, pour qu'ils disposent du gaz quand ils en ont besoin, quel que soit leur fournisseur.

Pour cela, et conformément à ses missions de service public, GRDF conçoit, construit, exploite, entretient le plus grand réseau de distribution d'Europe (198 886 km) et le développe dans plus de 9 500 communes, en garantissant la sécurité des personnes et des biens et la qualité de la distribution.
Chaque jour, ce sont 11 431 femmes et hommes qui s'investissent dans leur mission. Partout en France, des équipes sont prêtes à intervenir 24h/24 et 7j/7 pour fournir le meilleur service possible.
Au sein de la Région Ile de France, GRDF recrute :
Un.e Expert Data Manager H/F
Poste basé à Paris (75009)
En tant qu'Expert Data Management, sous la responsabilité du Chief Data Officer, vos missions principales sont les suivantes :
• La valorisation et la promotion du patrimoine Data de GRDF
• L'accompagnement et la montée en compétence des acteurs de l'écosystème data
• La réalisation et/ou la coordination de travaux data centric.
Votre rôle sera stratégique et divers.
Vous valorisez et promouvez le patrimoine Data de GRDF de diverses manières tout en facilitant la connaissance (cartographie) et les cas d'usages du patrimoine.

Votre positionnement est essentiel. Il s'agit d'avoir un réel rôle de Business Partner de la DSI et des métiers afin de générer de la valeur de l'entreprise. Il vous sera également demandé d'identifier et de réaliser des chantiers permettant de faire de la Data un levier de performance
De plus, vous accompagnez et assurez la montée en compétences des acteurs de l'écosystème Data de GRDF en
• Evaluant la maturité des acteurs/directions/applications
• Acculturant la data à destination de la DSI et des métiers (animation d'événements, modules de formation, partage des bonnes pratiques de data quality/gouvernance ...)
• Intervenant sur la mise en place des démarches de mise en qualité des données, la conformité aux règlementations de protection des données, l'urbanisation et architecture fonctionnelle
En complément des missions précédentes, vous réalisez et coordonnez les travaux data. Vous avez pour objectif le pilotage aux projets d'entreprise orientés Data.
• Vous contribuez à l'élaboration, au portage et à l'évolution du cadre de la gouvernance Data.
• L'animation et la participation aux différentes instances du cadre de gouvernance est importante.
• Pour finir, vous participez, rédigez des « positions papers » (data mesh, référentiels, sourcing des données ...) et feuilles de routes (data catalogue ...) et assurez une veille réglementaire.
Etes-vous notre futur Data Manager ?
Vous êtes diplômé d'un bac+5 minimum en Informatique et possédez au minimum 5 ans d'expérience en Data Management et des compétences en gestion de projet et/ou BI (modélisation).

Au-delà de ces prérequis, il est essentiel d'avoir une bonne capacité à appréhender les sujets sous un angle technologie et métier. De nombreuses interactions sont prévues avec l'ensemble des acteurs de l'écosystème Data.

• Les softskills sont essentielles, le futur Data Management doit posséder d'excellentes qualités relationnelles, d'animation et coordination transverse. Mais également une capacité d'écoute, de synthèse, et de communication orale et écrite.
LA DSI GRDF vous attend, les évolutions professionnelles sont nombreuses !
Lieu de Travail : 6 Rue Condorcet, 75009 Paris

L'emploi est régi par l'obligation de respect des engagements du code de bonne conduite de GRDF, lequel est constitué des principes d'indépendance, de non-discrimination, de protection des informations commercialement sensibles, d'objectivité et de transparence
column2: www.grdf.fr

column1: En tant qu'Employeur responsable, GRDF valorise la diversité des profils de ses collaborateurs. Son engagement en faveur de l'égalité des chances est reconnu par le Label Diversité.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:21:52,,
878586,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/878586,Data Scientist Time Series H/F,Total Energies,,,,,"Context & Environment

La branche OneTech est l'un des piliers de la stratégie de transition énergétique de TotalEnergies visant à atteindre la neutralité carbone d'ici 2050. La mission de nos 3 400 employés - ingénieurs, techniciens et chercheurs - répartis sur 9 sites en Europe, est de fournir l'expertise technologique et scientifique nécessaire à la mise en œuvre de la stratégie de l'entreprise.

Rejoignez nos équipes dans les lignes Clients, Techniques, R&D et Fonctions Support qui accompagnent toutes les branches opérationnelles dans leurs projets de développement et en soutien à leurs opérations !
Activities

La digitalisation est essentielle pour soutenir la transition énergétique de l'entreprise, ce qui signifie que de plus en plus de données sont disponibles. Ces données sont le terrain de jeu de l'équipe Solutions Digitales et IA.
Notre objectif est de soutenir la transition de l'entreprise en exploitant les données à l'aide d'algorithmes de machine learning et de deep learning.
Le poste concerne la manipulation de séries temporelles variées (solaire, éolien, recharge de véhicules électriques, etc.).
En tant que Data Scientist, vous :
• Serez en contact direct avec les clients internes pour définir leurs besoins.
• Proposerez, avec vos collègues, l'approche à adopter (bibliographie, méthodologie).
• Coordonnerez les intervenants de l'étude, y compris les ressources externes.
• Développerez et entraînerez des modèles personnalisés (machine/deep learning) pour répondre aux besoins métiers.
• Participerez au déploiement (stratégie de réentraînement, mise à disposition des résultats) avec les équipes back-end et devops.
• Interviendrez sur toute la chaîne de traitement des données (nettoyage, enrichissement, etc.).
• Contribuerez au développement selon les directives de l'équipe data science.
• Effectuerez une veille technologique en ML, notamment sur les séries temporelles, et proposerez de nouvelles études à fort impact potentiel.
• Prendrez en compte les contraintes HSE et opérationnelles dans les solutions techniques.

988966,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/administrative-or-secretarial-jobs/988966,Contract SAP Data Technician,,,,,,"NES Fircroft is a leading global technical recruitment company providing professional contract and permanent staff to a diverse world-wide client base within the oil & gas Industry.
Our valued client is seeking a Contract SAP Maintenance Data Technician in Lloydminster, SK for a 1-year contract.  The shift is Monday to Friday, 40 hours per week.

The Lloydminster Business Technology team has an exciting opportunity available for an Contract SAP Plant Maintenance Data Technician. Supporting the Canadian Thermal and Conventional Heavy Oil business, the SAP Master Data Team is responsible for the accurate digital representation of Company’s of facility, well and equipment data in a Maintenance Management System (SAP).

This position requires a technically minded individual who preferably has experience with data management, data governance, and data administration of Maintenance Management Systems such as SAP, Maximo, JD Edwards or similar.
This position involves investigating and collaborating with internal and external teams to verify data and documents before accurately entering the data into SAP in accordance with Company standards.
This position involves a diversity of challenges requiring the identification of issues, investigation, collaboration, and selection of an appropriate solution.
This position mainly follows defined processes to complete work.
Attention to detail and ability to accurately assess information to make decisions is key to this role.
This role is primarily in an office environment and does not include field work.
This position is best suited for a team player that can work with multiple stakeholders to achieve success.
Partners include operations, maintenance, engineering, finance, supply chain and service teams.
Responsibilities:
The SAP master data team is responsible for the administration and management of SAP Plant Maintenance to digitally represent the company’s Canadian upstream operational assets.
This position is responsible to perform data management activities within SAP Plant Maintenance such as verifying data accuracy, executing data changes from requests, and perform data cleansing.
This position is responsible to work collaboratively with a range of customers including maintenance, operations, construction, and engineering to load equipment data into SAP.
This position is responsible to comply with data standards, procedures, and best practices but must challenge work processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness of the teams? activities.
This position works mainly independently, making decisions based on standards and training, receiving guidance on complex or unusual issues.
This position is responsible to interpret data reports, technical documents, engineered drawings and various sources of data to ensure high accuracy and data quality.
This position may be required to influence stakeholders to maintain data quality standards.
This position may act as a coach and trainer to colleagues or other SAP users.
Deliverables:
Receive and review asset data change requests from business stakeholders.
Create SAP work tickets and assign to the appropriate SAP Technician for completion.
Process work tickets to create/update SAP Function Location, Equipment and Assembly master data.
Complete work tickets assigned to you according to the priority and timelines outlined.
Verify asset data accuracy through investigation, document review, conversations, audits, etc. and correct discrepancies prior to loading into SAP.
Documents include technical drawings, calibration reports, assessment reports, inspection reports, service reports, audits, etc.
Coach and mentor team members in an effective manner to ensure knowledge is transferred and skills are shared throughout the team.
Create and maintain work instructions specific to this position.
Competencies:
Attention to detail - able to find errors and anomalies in large data sets
Critical thinking - able to investigate and determine a course of action based on the information available
Willingness to learn new tasks and increase technical knowledge
Effective communication skills with field and office personnel
Able to adapt to changing priorities to meet deadlines
Able to organize and manage multiple work streams
Qualifications:
High School Diploma
2 years experience with Microsoft Office
column2: o Excel to analyze data using sorting, filtering, data transformation, pivot tables, and graphs. The ability to learn and apply formulas to large data sets.

column1: Outlook to send and receive emails, and calendar to schedule meetings and manage time.
Word to create professional documents such as work instructions and procedures.
Business / Technical Diploma or equivalent training is an asset.
Experience with SAP PM, HR, FI, MM, BW is an asset.
Oil and gas equipment knowledge is an asset

986794,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/986794,Sr Pricing Data Analyst,Honeywell,,,,,"Honeywell International Inc. SENIOR PRICING ANALYST-PRICING DATA ANALYSIS

Own pricing data analysis framework, ensuring alignment with business objectives and the successful delivery of actionable insights.

Bachelor's degree or Advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related discipline.
5+ years of experience in data analysis.
Experience in statistical modeling and data analysis.
Experience of using business intelligence tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
• Experience in SQL (Mandatory)
WE VALUE
• Strategic thinking and the ability to contribute to the overall direction of Pricing discipline.
• Demonstrated ability to lead and mentor team members.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

984195,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/984195,Data Manager,bp,,,,,"Job Family Group:
IT&S Group
Job Description:
About bp / team

We are a global energy business involved in every aspect of the energy system. We are working towards delivering light, heat and mobility to millions of people, every day. We are one of the very few companies equipped to solve some of the big complex challenges that matter for the future. We have a real contribution to make to the world's ambition of a low carbon future. Join us, and be part of what we can accomplish together. You can participate in our new ambition to become a net zero company by 2050 or sooner, and to help the world get to net zero.
And we know we can't do it alone. We're looking for people who share our passion for reinvention, to bring fresh opinions, ambition, and to challenge our thinking in our goal to achieve net zero!

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society, our industry and our planet.

Being part of the Wells & Subsurface Data Operations (DataOps) group, you will apply your domain knowledge and familiarity with domain data processes to support the Wells & Subsurface organisation, which is part of bp's Production & Operations business with hubs in London, Pune, and Houston. The DataOps team provides daily operational data management, data engineering and analytics support to this organisation across a broad range of disciplines and petro-technical applications.
You might be a good fit for this role if you:
have experience of the types of data and data processes in subsurface workflows and how Geologists, Petrophysicists, Geoscientists and Geophysicists interact with other subsurface disciplines.
have practical knowledge and hands-on experience in the SLB suite of Petrophysics, Geology and Geophysics applications including SLB Techlog
are customer-focused and a good communicator. You continually seek ways to improve user experience and productivity.
are curious, and keen to apply new technologies, trends & methods to improve existing standards and the capabilities of the Subsurface community.
are well organized and self-motivated, you balance proactive and reactive approaches and multiple priorities to complete tasks on time.
apply judgment and common sense - you use insight and good judgment to inform actions and respond to situations as they arise.
Responsibilities
Hands-on manage corporate data, including data modeling, data cataloging, data governance, quality control and risk control.
Develop and apply procedures, standards and guidelines to collect, secure, handle and share data across the organization.
Align, integrate and consolidate data assets across organizations for better consistency, reliability and efficiency of data operation.
Triage, troubleshoot and authorize the maintenance of data-related problems.
Leverage domain knowledge to partner with business entities to identify patterns, relationships, opportunities and problems in business data. Drive business data requirements.
Develop functional data design based on the business data requirements
Help Data Engineers understand the functions that they need to provide technical design and implementation.
Qualifications
Essential
Bachelor's degree in a STEM field.
At least 2 years industrial experience in managing data.
Hands-on experience with modern, large-scale databases and IT systems.
Solid knowledge and skills of SQL
Proficient at digesting, understanding and analyzing large amounts of data.
Knowledge of data security and privacy compliance policies, like GDPR, NIST and CCPA
Customer-centric and pragmatic mindset.
Focus on value delivery and swift execution, while maintaining attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Desired
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Geology, Geophysics, Petroleum Engineering or other related subsurface area.
Understanding of well log data, the handling of well log data and its associated industry standard file types and data structures.
Expert user of the SLB Techlog product
An understanding of Petrophysics workflows and processes in the interpretation of well log data
Ability to conduct basic log conditioning processes on raw data
Familiarity with industry acquisition tooling (including Wireline & LWD) and associated curve nomenclature
Experience in other G&G industry application packages
Familiarity with Python scripting
Travel Requirement:
Negligible travel should be expected with this role
Relocation Assistance:
This role is eligible for relocation within country
Remote Type:
This position is a hybrid of office/remote working
Skills:

Commercial Acumen, Communication, Data Analysis, Data cleansing and transformation, Data domain knowledge, Data Integration, Data Management, Data Manipulation, Data Sourcing, Data strategy and governance, Data Structures and Algorithms (Inactive), Data visualization and interpretation, Digital Security, Extract, transform and load, Group Problem Solving
