999491,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/999491,FIELD SERVICE ENGINEER (MEDICAL EQUIPEMENT) IRELAND,,,,,,"Our client is one of the world’s leading health care suppliers and is in the Top 20 ranking of Medical Devices Companies. The company employs over 68,000 people in 64 countries and is active in 18 therapy fields and applications with a focus on hospitals, medical practices, pharmacies, nursing, emergency services and at-home care. They are recognised as a Great Place to Work in Ireland and one with a mission to become the most progressive workplace in the life sciences industry.   They are seeking to recruit a FIELD SERVICE ENGINEER to join a team of 3 experienced engineers providing technical support to renal dialysis equipment. A structured training programme will be put in place for the successful candidate incorporating certified manufacturer training courses in conjunction with hands on experience working alongside senior engineers on customer sites. The engineer will be challenged in this role to develop and establish expertise in the company renal equipment and technology. This is a unique opportunity to work within a dynamic, collaborative, and professional engineering team with exposure to cooperate on projects with our international colleagues.
Reporting to: Healthcare Technology Manager
In this role your core responsibilities will include:
To engage in the technical repair, both preventative and corrective, of equipment at customer sites or other locations.
To advise and lead on the installation requirements for a renal dialysis unit.
To undertake technical and user support training (both locally and in Germany) for company products and any other relevant equipment.

987841,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/987841,PAVEMENT ENGINEER : USA,,,,,,"We are seeking to recruit on behalf of our client a PAVEMENT ENGINEER who will be based In Champaign, Illinois, USA on a long-term contract, an experienced and highly skilled Senior Pavement Engineer to lead and manage our pavement engineering projects with a focus on pavement management systems (PMS).

The successful candidate will have a strong technical background in both empirical and mechanistic-empirical pavement design, and will be responsible for overseeing pavement evaluations, preparing detailed technical reports, and guiding decision-making processes through the development of deterioration models and fine-tuning decision trees, building the department and winning work and growing the business.

In this role, you will be responsible for conducting pavement evaluations, interpreting test data, and working with advanced pavement analysis tools. You will also collaborate with cross-functional teams and external stakeholders to ensure high-quality outcomes in line with international standards.
Key Responsibilities:
Leadership & Project Management: Lead and manage pavement engineering projects from conception to completion, ensuring adherence to quality, budget, and timelines.
Pavement Design: Develop both empirical and mechanistic-empirical pavement designs for a variety of pavement types and conditions, ensuring alignment with industry best practices and standards.
Pavement Management Systems (PMS): Utilize your expertise in PMS to develop, calibrate, and implement pavement deterioration models and decision trees.

Data Interpretation: Conduct and interpret data from destructive and non-destructive testing methods such as FWD (Falling Weight Deflectometer), GPR (Ground Penetrating Radar), Friction Tester, and LCMS-2. Provide training to junior engineers on equipment use and data interpretation.
Prepare detailed technical reports, proposals, and bids that clearly outline project methodologies, results, and recommendations for clients.
Software Utilization: Utilize advanced pavement analysis software to support project development and analysis. Stay updated on new software advancements and implement where appropriate.
Ensure all designs and recommendations comply with international standards such as FAA AC’s, ICAO, GACA, Saudi ARAMCO, AASHTO, and DMRB.
Communicate effectively with clients, government agencies, and other stakeholders. Provide technical advice and ensure that
client requirements are fully understood and met.
Stay current with industry developments and innovations in pavement engineering and apply this knowledge to improve the company’s services.
Minimum Requirements:
Experience: 10+ years of experience in pavement engineering, with a focus on pavement management systems (PMS) and leadership roles.
Proficient in developing and calibrating deterioration models and fine-tuning decision trees.
Strong background in both empirical and mechanistic-empirical pavement design.
Solid experience in interpreting data from FWD, GPR, Friction Tester, and LCMS-2.
Familiarity with key industry standards (FAA ACs, ICAO, GACA, Saudi ARAMCO, AASHTO, DMRB).
Skilled in using popular pavement analysis software.
Ability to interpret results from destructive and non-destructive testing methods.
Reporting & Bid Preparation: Proven ability to prepare bids and write comprehensive technical reports.
Training Capabilities: Capable of providing training and guidance to junior engineers on data interpretation and the use of technical equipment.
Educational Background:
Professional Engineer (PE) license.
MSCE (Master of Science in Civil Engineering), ME (Master of Engineering), or Ph.D. in a relevant field, preferably from the US, Europe, or UK.
Programming Skills: Proficiency in programming languages relevant to pavement design and analysis.
Software Knowledge: Familiarity with commercial pavement design and evaluation software.

1005112,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1005112,Lead Pipeline Engineer,,,,,,"Job Title: Lead Pipeline Engineer
Client: Large global engineering consultancy doing a project in South East Asia
Location: Must be based in Jakarta
Job Overview:

The Lead Pipeline Engineer will be responsible for the overall engineering of pipeline systems, including the development of design concepts, criteria, and specifications. This role will involve performing detailed analysis and calculations, as well as reviewing and ensuring compliance with relevant government regulations, industry codes, and best practices. The Lead Pipeline Engineer will ensure that the design satisfies the COMPANY's scope of work (SoW) and Basis of Design (BoD) requirements. The role will also involve leading critical assessments related to pipeline stability, routing, and material selection, particularly for large diameter, deep-water pipelines.
Key Responsibilities:
Pipeline Engineering Design: Develop and oversee pipeline engineering designs, including concepts, design criteria, and specifications, ensuring compliance with COMPANY SoW and BoD requirements.
Route Selection & Assessment: Define and assess pipeline routes for large diameter pipelines, particularly in challenging environments such as deep-water and highly active seismic areas.

Buckling & Stability Analysis: Lead lateral and upheaval buckling assessments along the pipeline route, including recommendations for mitigation strategies. Oversee the assessment of vessel and material requirements for buckling protection, particularly in areas with soft soil, steep angles, or escarpment crossings.

Free Span & On-Bottom Roughness: Manage and perform free span analysis and on-bottom roughness assessments to identify potential issues that may require pre-intervention or rectification works before or after pipelaying.
Shore Approach Design: Lead the design of shore approaches, utilizing both trenching and trenchless methods (such as Horizontal Directional Drilling), as well as pipeline shore pull designs.

Advanced Finite Element Modelling: Oversee finite element modelling for advanced analysis related to free span determination, on-bottom roughness, pipelaying processes, inline structures, HDD simulations, and on-bottom stability.
CO2 Pipeline Design: Provide expertise in CO2 pipeline design, particularly during the FEED and detailed design phases, ensuring adherence to industry standards and safety requirements.

1005111,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1005111,Lead Subsea Control Engineer,,,,,,"Job Title: Lead Subsea Control Engineer
Project: Subsea SURF Project in Southeast Asia
Company: Large Global Engineering Consultancy
Location: Perth, Australia / Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Duration: Beginning of 2025 to End of 2025 (Contract-Based)
Position Overview:

We are advertising on behalf of our client, a large global engineering consultancy, for the position of Lead Subsea Control Engineer for an exciting subsea SURF project in Southeast Asia. The successful candidate will be responsible for the design and engineering of the Subsea Control System for the SURF facility, including FPSO topside located equipment and FPSO integration. This will involve developing design concepts, specifications, and criteria, performing analysis and calculations, and ensuring compliance with government regulations and industrial codes. The role is critical in satisfying the company's Scope of Work (SoW) and Basis of Design (BoD) requirements.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead the subsea control system engineering for the SURF facility, ensuring the integration of FPSO topside equipment and subsea systems.

Develop design concepts, specifications, and criteria for the subsea production control system (SPCS) for deepwater projects with interfaces to floating facilities, including subsea instrumentation, subsea distribution systems, and subsea control topside mounted equipment.
Perform analysis and calculations for hydraulic, electrical, and communication systems within the subsea control system.
Lead the design and specification of subsea production control systems, ensuring effective communication using fiber optic and power communication methods.
Lead the subsea control system integration with FPSO/FPU/Host Platform Integrated Control and Safety Systems (ICSS).
Ensure efficient interfacing of subsea control systems with other SURF systems and FPSO/FPU/Host Platform facilities.

Oversee the FEED and EPC project activities for subsea control systems, ensuring compliance with project quality control (QC) procedures and timely project delivery from design through to construction and pre-commissioning.
Manage and supervise the subsea control system design and integration, ensuring it meets project specifications, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support the smooth integration of subsea control systems with other project systems.
Provide leadership and mentoring to junior engineers, ensuring the technical excellence of the subsea control engineering team.
Key Requirements:
Bachelor of Science Degree in an engineering-related field (advanced degree preferred). Chartered Engineer status within a recognized engineering institution is highly desirable.
At least 15 years of experience in the oil and gas industry, specifically designing subsea control systems for deepwater projects.
Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Lead Subsea Control Engineer, including at least two (2) prior roles as Lead Subsea Controls Engineer during the FEED or detailed engineering EPCI stages.
Extensive experience in defining subsea control system design and specifications for subsea production control systems in deepwater projects with interfaces to floating facilities.
Proficient in hydraulic, electrical, and communication system analysis for subsea control systems.
Experience with subsea production control system communication, including fiber optic and communication on power systems.
Strong knowledge of subsea control system integration with FPSO/FPU/Host Platform ICSS (Integrated Control and Safety System).
Experience working with other SURF systems and FPSO/FPU/Host Platform facilities to ensure seamless integration.

Extensive experience in FEED and EPC project activities related to subsea control engineering, with proficiency in all phases of project execution, from design through to construction and pre-commissioning.
Strong leadership, project management, and communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to manage teams and collaborate with other engineering disciplines.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in the design and integration of subsea control systems for large SURF facilities with multiple subsea wells.
In-depth knowledge of quality control procedures and project delivery best practices for subsea control systems.

1005109,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1005109,Lead Umbilical Engineer,,,,,,"Project: Subsea SURF Project in Southeast Asia
Company: Large Global Engineering Consultancy
Location: Perth, Australia / Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly experienced and qualified Lead Umbilical Engineer to join our team for a subsea SURF project in Southeast Asia. The successful candidate will be responsible for leading the Umbilical engineering of the SURF facility, ensuring that all design concepts, specifications, and calculations meet the project's requirements, as well as complying with relevant industry codes, regulations, and COMPANY SoW (Scope of Work) and BoD (Basis of Design).
Key Responsibilities:
Lead the design, engineering, and specification of umbilical systems for subsea SURF facilities, ensuring compliance with design criteria, regulations, and best industry practices.

Develop and review design concepts, criteria, specifications, and analysis for deepwater production umbilicals, including steel tubes and various umbilical types (e.g., electro multiplex hydraulic, direct hydraulic).
Perform static and dynamic analysis of umbilicals, interfacing with floating facilities and conducting fatigue analysis.
Design and interface umbilical systems with subsea controls and distribution systems, including SUTA, SDU, TUTU, etc.
Lead and manage the umbilical system design interface with floating facilities (e.g., I/J tube, hang-off solutions) to ensure safe and efficient integration.
Oversee and ensure quality control during the FEED (Front-End Engineering Design) and EPC (Engineering, Procurement, and Construction) stages of the project.
Work closely with the project management team to meet milestones, and provide technical leadership throughout the project's lifecycle, including construction and pre-commissioning.
Manage the umbilical system design and ensure it meets the high-pressure, high-temperature (HPHT) and high CO2 well stream requirements.
Key Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in an engineering-related field (advanced degree is preferred). Chartered engineer status within a recognized engineering institution is highly desirable.
A minimum of 15 years of experience in the oil and gas industry, with at least 10 years in riser/umbilical system engineering.
At least 5 years of experience as a Lead Umbilical Engineer, including two (2) previous roles as Lead Umbilical Engineer during the FEED or detailed engineering EPCI stages.
Extensive experience with deepwater production umbilical systems, including the design and specification of steel tube umbilicals and both electro multiplex hydraulic and direct hydraulic umbilicals.
Proven experience in performing static and dynamic analysis of umbilicals, including fatigue analysis and interfacing with large floating facilities.
Strong experience in subsea umbilical system design and interfacing with floating facilities (e.g., I/J tube, hang-off solutions).
In-depth knowledge of FEED and EPC project activities related to umbilical system engineering for deepwater SURF facilities, including construction, pre-commissioning, and project management.
Experience in high-pressure, high-temperature (HPHT) and high CO2 well stream environments is essential.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to manage teams, provide technical leadership, and work effectively across multiple project phases.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with subsea systems in 600m water depths.
Expertise in project management and quality control procedures related to umbilical system delivery.
Location:
Perth, Australia
Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia",,Location:,,,2024-12-01 15:51:49,,

1005105,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1005105,Lead Planning Engineer,,,,,,"Job Title: Lead Planning Engineer
Client: Large global engineering consultancy doing a project in South East Asia
Location:Must be based in Jakarta
Job Overview:

The Lead Planning Engineer will be responsible for providing all planning and scheduling services during the FEED phase of the project. This role is pivotal in ensuring the timely, efficient, and successful completion of the project by developing, maintaining, and reporting on project schedules. The Lead Planning Engineer will work closely with other disciplines, perform risk analysis, and ensure alignment on project priorities to meet COMPANY's internal requirements and project objectives.
Key Responsibilities:

Schedule Development: Prepare an integrated FEED Study schedule to identify key activities, critical work sequences, and overall duration to ensure successful project completion. Interface with other studies or surveys to ensure all aspects of the project are aligned.
Progress Monitoring: Update the integrated FEED Study Schedule monthly to report progress to COMPANY, identifying any deviations from the plan and recommending corrective actions.
Project Execution Planning: Develop an Integrated Overall Project Execution Schedule, highlighting key activities and critical work sequences to ensure timely and successful project delivery.
Risk Analysis: Conduct schedule risk analysis when necessary to identify potential project delays or issues and develop mitigation strategies.
Interface Scheduling: Develop and maintain project interface schedules, ensuring the proper status reporting of interfaces between CONTRACTOR and COMPANY.
Progress Reporting: Develop and maintain the overall project progress reporting system, coordinating progress reporting to COMPANY on a regular basis.
Risk Reviews: Participate in regular risk reviews within CONTRACTOR's organization, ensuring any potential project risks are identified and managed.
HSSE Engagement: Actively engage in HSSE leadership, awareness, and training programs to promote a strong safety culture on the project.
Coordination: Work closely with other CONTRACTOR disciplines to ensure alignment on project priorities, avoiding conflicts and promoting smooth project execution.
Specialist Recommendations: Provide recommendations to the Project Controls Manager regarding any specialized input or resources required to meet project objectives.
Required Qualifications and Experience:
Education:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in a relevant field.
Experience:
Minimum of 15 years of experience in the oil and gas industry.
At least 10 years of experience in project planning and scheduling.
At least 5 years of experience in a Lead Planning Engineer role.
Significant experience in FEED and EPCI phases for offshore pipeline or equivalent projects.
Proven track record in planning large-scale projects within the oil and gas industry.
Demonstrated capability in planning and scheduling services for worldwide projects with a major engineering contractor.
Technical Expertise: Extensive experience in project controls functions within the oil and gas or petrochemical industries.
Software Proficiency: Hands-on experience using project control systems and software applications such as Primavera v6 and PertMaster.
Project Specific Experience: Demonstrated experience in planning pipeline or equivalent projects, with the ability to list project names and phases.
Skills and Competencies:
In-depth knowledge of project planning and scheduling techniques.
Ability to develop and manage integrated project schedules.
Strong understanding of risk management and scheduling analysis.
Proven ability to work with diverse teams and coordinate project activities.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to report on schedule progress to internal and external stakeholders.

933966,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/933966,Civil Engineer/Transmission Line Engineer - Kiewit Power Engineering,Kiewit,,,,,"Requisition ID: 173410
Job Level: Entry Level
Home District/Group: Kiewit Power Engineering
Department: Design Engineering
Market: Power
Employment Type: Full Time
Position Overview

Kiewit Power Engineering is seeking an Early Career Civil Engineer/Transmission Line Engineer. As part of this team of highly specialized design professionals, you will support a variety of substation, transmission and distribution projects ranging from 12kV to 500kV in both engineering detailed design and Engineer, Procure, Construct (EPC) projects for clients throughout the country.

We are looking for ideal candidates to grow the Kiewit team by helping establish, maintain, and improve company standards and tools while also utilizing these standards and tools to contribute to project success. Candidates shall be familiar with current drawing and technical tools, programs, and software with an understanding of design documentation creation and layouts. Candidates shall be capable of exhibiting flexibility in work assignments while maintaining a growth mindset and continuing to develop in their technical and professional career.
District Overview

Kiewit Engineering Group, Inc is a full-service consulting and engineering firm serving the infrastructure and engineering markets. Our combined staff of more than 1,300 engineers and design professionals have expertise that spans all major engineering disciplines to serve transportation, power, water/wastewater, mining, building, and oil, gas & chemical markets. Backed by 130 years of construction experience, our construction-driven engineering focuses on constructability and safety in the earliest phases of projects to ensure on-time and on-budget project delivery.

Our rapidly growing Power district, which includes structural, civil, piping, mechanical, process, process safety, electrical, instrument and control disciplines, is a multi-faceted division of Kiewit with best-in-class technical expertise focused on the EPC delivery model for power facilities. We offer a variety of engineering services, including owner's engineering, project development, detailed engineering and design, construction management and plant services. Our engineering teams bring power projects to life across North America in the following areas:
Gas-fired generation
Power delivery
Environmental retrofits
Renewables and new technology
Water/wastewater
Location
This position is based out of our Portland, OR office.
Responsibilities
Working collaboratively in a team environment to understand scope, prepare deliverables, and provide project updates.
Performing cost effective designs based on industry, company, and/or client standards.
Generating transmission line design criteria for PLS-CADD.
Building, modifying and analyzing transmission line, pole and tower models within PLS-CADD, PLS-POLE and PLS TOWER.
Developing construction assembly drawings, material specifications, and structure loading packages for submittal to vendors.
Developing construction deliverable packages that include plan & profile drawings, phasing drawings, and standard installation specifications.
Traveling out of town for short periods of time as required by projects and assignments.
Attending external and internal meetings to support processes.
Qualifications
• Bachelor of Science Degree in Civil Engineering or related field from an accredited Engineering Institute.
• 3.0 cumulative GPA preferred
• 0-2 years of experience as a transmission engineer, transmission line engineer, civil engineer or related position preferably including:
- Route alignment planning, structure spotting, and structure and line design of overhead transmission lines using PLS-CADD, PLS-POLE, and PLS TOWER
- Lattice tower analysis and design utilizing PLS TOWER and ASCE 10
- Foundation design of transmission structures using FAD Tools and LPILE
• Understanding of NESC, and relevant ASCE, IEEE and regional codes and standards #LI-OT1
Other Requirements:
• Regular, reliable attendance
• Work productively and meet deadlines timely
• Communicate and interact effectively and professionally with supervisors, employees, and others individually or in a team environment.
• Perform work safely and effectively. Understand and follow oral and written instructions, including warning signs, equipment use, and other policies.
• Work during normal operating hours to organize and complete work within given deadlines. Work overtime and weekends as required.

We offer our fulltime staff employees a comprehensive benefits package that's among the best in our industry, including top-tier medical, dental and vision plans covering eligible employees and dependents, voluntary wellness and employee assistance programs, life insurance, disability, retirement plans with matching, and generous paid time off.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

There's no limit to what you'll do at Kiewit. Whether you're building or supporting projects that provide communities with dependable energy, safe transportation, clean water, or access to health care, the work you do will positively impact people's lives for generations to come.
Here you'll have endless opportunities to expand your expertise through on-the-job experience and internal and external training and development opportunities.

We offer our full-time staff employees a comprehensive benefits package that's among the best in our industry. From top-tier health care programs to employee assistance programs and retirement planning, we aim to provide you with the tools you need to be successful in the areas of life that matter most to you.

Kiewit is an equal-opportunity employer, and we believe a diverse workforce is vital to the success of our business. We continue our efforts to attract, develop and retain employees from all backgrounds who are passionate about our industry.
We are committed to veteran and military hiring and will consider relevant military experience as equivalent to qualification requirements.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:53:08,,
986755,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/986755,BMS Sr. Advanced Project Engineer,Honeywell,,,,,"Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges
BMS Sr. Advanced Project Engineer
We have an opportunity for a BMS Sr. Advanced Project Engineer to join us at Honeywell, in Aarhus Denmark.

Honeywell

Honeywell Building Automation is transforming the way every building operates to help improve the quality of life for the people who use them. 986870,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/986870,Design Engineer - Thermal Systems Design,GE Renewable Energy Power and Aviation,,,,,"Job Description Summary
At GE Aerospace we believe that the world works better when it's moving. Together we are creating a future of aviation where human safety is of the greatest importance.

In our company we have been offering a flexible working model for many years now as to give our employees the possibility to adjust working hours to suit their individual needs. Our employees easily combine their professional and private responsibilities and have time to pursue their passions. No matter what stage of your career you are at, you can count on the support and mentorship of the best experts in the industry.

Over 1300 people work on GE Aerospace Warsaw campus. This is where we design aircraft engines and develop advanced technologies such as cooling methods for engine components as well as create statistical models and software applications for aviation. We develop all solutions in diverse teams, in which the best experts eagerly share their knowledge. At GE Aerospace we work together to achieve success. What is more, a career at GE Aerospace is not only an opportunity to work in an international environment, but also a chance to gain experience while visiting laboratories, factories and repair shops around the world.

At GE Aerospace we give our employees space for comprehensive development by supporting a variety of employee initiatives and interest groups, including GE Women's Network, PRIDE Alliance, HealthAhead and GE Aerospace Volunteers. Our flexible working model is based on the concept of work-life balance, because at GE Aerospace we believe that people come first in our organization.

As a Design Engineer in Advanced Technology Thermal Systems Design team (18 people), you will be responsible for supporting thermal design of rotor/stator engine components. This position offers a unique opportunity to contribute to development efforts in new technology projects for jet engines. Additionally, you may work on the thermal design of other engine components, such as combustor and heat exchanger. In this role you will develop your knowledge and competences to identify problems, find solutions, and demonstrate thermal design and analytical skills.
Job Description
Roles and Responsibilities
Perform the thermal design, analysis, or evaluation of assigned projects using sound engineering principles and adhering to business standards and product / program requirements
Participate in development of rotor/stator design for assigned project
Collaborate with design team members and experts to meet project goals
Exchange technical information, promote open dialogue and asks questions to solve problems
Prepare and present technical data on internal and external reviews
Assure proper documentation of technical data generated for the assigned projects and/or tasks consistent with engineering policies and procedures
Required Qualifications
MSc/BSc in Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, or Computer Science
Understanding of heat transfer and fluid mechanics
Ability to effectively communicate within the team
Good level of English
Benefits
Join us to see your career take flight today.
We offer:
Flexible work schedule and hybrid work model adjusted to your needs
Fascinating job in dynamically growing aerospace industry
Competitive salary, annual bonus, copyright costs tax reduction
Diverse career opportunities globally
Environment of continuous learning and improvement
Onboarding support to make your start easier, mentoring support through your career
Benefits fit to all lifestyles
Wide variety of employee initiatives
#LI-Hybrid
Additional Job D escription
Additional Information
Compensation Grade
PB1
Relocation Assistance Provided: No",,,,,2024-12-01 15:53:22,,
874905,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/874905,Chief Civil Maritime Engineer,AtkinsRéalis,,,,,"Job Description
Shape the Future of our cities and environments.

Are you ready to take up a vital role in shaping some of our exciting projects? How about joining our talented team, where everyone has a voice, and together we face our clients' challenges head-on. It's a diverse and inclusive work environment where world-class talent knows no distinctions.

Bring your skills to the mix as a Chief Civil Maritime Engineer, you'll play a vital role in every aspect of maritime engineering on Transformational Programmes for critical UK infrastructure with opportunities to work on iconic engineering projects at home and abroad.

We specialise in all aspects of maritime engineering, within multiple challenging and engaging sectors such as Water, Aviation, Defence, Energy and Cities & Development. We continue to provide industry-leading maritime solutions right through the project lifecycle, with value added through client-side support as well as construction phases. If being a part of a team with a passion for this industry is for you then we would love to talk to you.
We currently have opportunities in our Bristol office.
Your Purpose:
Own and direct teams who undertake technical design work following relevant design standards and codes, and to high-quality levels.
Defining briefs, scopes of work, and input into bid proposals.
Successfully manage time and budgets to key project milestones and programmes.
Work closely with teams in the UK and overseas to deliver integrated design solutions.
Setting quality assurance standards in design.
Grow, develop and manage civil engineering capability within the practice.
What you can bring:
Chartered Civil / Structural Engineer.
Experience in owning design delivery, including multidisciplinary design within the port and maritime environment.

Comprehensive knowledge in the civil and structural design of port and maritime infrastructure supporting port operations, the berthing and mooring of vessels and the transit of people and goods around the globe.
Working experience with current UK and European design standards including BS6349.
What we offer?

AtkinsRéalis recognise that there are many well qualified people who are looking to further their career, but who cannot commit to full time employment. We support flexible working arrangements and are interested to discuss how we can accommodate individual requirements. As part of this commitment, we understand the need for a diverse and flexible workforce, where a work-life balance is important. So, by default AtkinsRéalis offers flexible working, where there is no fixed 9 'till 5, no need for a 5-day week, no requirement for a full-time contract, and no requirement to spend all your working time in the office.
Rewards and Benefits:

We offer a competitive salary that is regularly tested against other consultants with a default 25-days leave each year plus bank holidays and options to buy some or sell of that leave. Salary and benefits will be commensurate with experience and qualifications.
New name, new era. We are AtkinsRéalis. It will take some time for all our information to update - you can still refer to our fantastic benefits via the link below:
YourReward at SNC-Lavalin (snclavalin.com).
Training:

AtkinsRéalis is committed to developing its people both personally and professionally. Our colleagues have the advantage of access to a high ranging training portfolio and development activities designed to help make the best of individual's abilities and talents. 874908,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/874908,Principal Dams and Reservoirs Engineer,AtkinsRéalis,,,,,"Job Description
Shape the Future of our cities and environments.

Are you ready to take up a vital role in shaping some of our exciting projects? How about joining our talented team, where everyone has a voice, and together we face our clients' challenges head-on. It's a diverse and inclusive work environment where world-class talent knows no distinctions.

Bring your skills to the mix as a Principal Dams and Reservoirs Engineer, you'll play a vital role in every aspect of dams and reservoir engineering on Transformational Programmes for critical UK infrastructure with opportunities to work on iconic engineering projects at home and abroad.

We specialise in all aspects of dams and reservoir engineering, within multiple challenging and engaging sectors such as Water, Aviation, Energy and Cities & Development. We continue to provide industry-leading engineering solutions right through the project lifecycle, with value added through client-side support as well as construction phases. If being a part of a team with a passion for this industry is for you then we would love to talk to you.
We currently have opportunities in our Epsom.
Your Purpose:
Lead a team to undertake technical design work following relevant design standards and codes, and to high-quality levels.
Prepare briefs, scopes of work, and input into bid proposals.
Successfully manage time and budgets to key project milestones and programmes.
Work closely with teams in the UK and overseas to deliver integrated design solutions.
Adhere to quality assurance standards in design.
What you can bring:
Chartered Civil Engineer.
Interest in developing into the role of Reservoir Supervising Engineer.
Experience in leading design delivery, including multidisciplinary design.
Sound knowledge of hydraulic and/or geotechnical engineering as applied to the management and design of dams and reservoirs and their associated hydraulic structures.
In depth knowledge of current UK design standards, guidance and working practices including the Reservoirs Act.
What we offer?

AtkinsRéalis recognise that there are many well qualified people who are looking to further their career, but who cannot commit to full time employment. We support flexible working arrangements and are interested to discuss how we can accommodate individual requirements. As part of this commitment, we understand the need for a diverse and flexible workforce, where a work-life balance is important. So, by default AtkinsRéalis offers flexible working, where there is no fixed 9 'till 5, no need for a 5-day week, no requirement for a full-time contract, and no requirement to spend all your working time in the office.
Rewards and Benefits:

We offer a competitive salary that is regularly tested against other consultants with a default 25-days leave each year plus bank holidays and options to buy some or sell of that leave. Salary and benefits will be commensurate with experience and qualifications.
New name, new era. We are AtkinsRéalis. It will take some time for all our information to update - you can still refer to our fantastic benefits via the link below:
YourReward at SNC-Lavalin (snclavalin.com).
Training:

AtkinsRéalis is committed to developing its people both personally and professionally. Our colleagues have the advantage of access to a high ranging training portfolio and development activities designed to help make the best of individual's abilities and talents. We also actively support staff in achieving corporate membership of relevant institutions.
Additional Information:

This role may require security clearance and offers of employment will be dependent on obtaining the relevant level of clearance. If this is necessary, it will be discussed with you at interview. 959543,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/959543,Telecom Specialist/Telecom Engineer,AtkinsRéalis,,,,,"Job Description
Telecom Specialist/ Engineer

The Telecom Specialist/ Engineer is required to work within a multi-discipline team to design efficient and reliable telecommunication facilities. The engineer will coordinate his/her design activities to maintain project schedules and ensure successful project completion. The engineer will also assist the Estimating Team in preparation of estimates and project proposals.

This position is accountable to provide all design activities in accordance with all applicable codes and standards, including all AtkinsRéalis's policies and procedures, such as Safety, Environmental, Quality Assurance and Quality Control.
This role will be based in Burnaby, BC.
Your role within the team:
Preparation of project specifications for material/equipment purchase and installation.

Design of telecommunication facilities including Microwave and UHF radio links, fiber optic transmission links including the cable (ADSS and OPGW), SONET & SDH/TDM multiplex systems, IP/MPLS Network systems, teleprotection, VSAT systems, cable protection systems, telecom power systems and telecom towers & antennas.
Delivery of accurate and thorough designs that will meet industry standards and specifications as well as meet good engineering practices with excellent constructability.
Review of internal and external designs for code compliance with good design practice and constructability.
Resolving site queries, attending site meetings and performing site inspections during the construction phase of projects.
Maintaining complete project documentation with respect to telecom design and construction, including all completion packages, as-built requirements and return data information.
Making and maintaining appropriate commitments to project teams and coordinating design activities with multi-disciplined project team members.
Maintaining good working relationships with internal groups that support projects such as procurement, project management, etc.
Maintaining good working relationships with material suppliers, contractors, and any others that affect the quality, schedule and cost of projects.
Mentoring and providing guidance to developing engineers within the department.
Why choose AtkinsRéalis as an employer?
Because we offer:
The opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.
An exciting environment where work-life balance is important.
A wide array of learning and development opportunities.
Competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.
A work environment focused on health and safety.
The ideal candidate:
A degree in Telecom or Electrical Engineering from a recognized institution.
Coop experience for junior candidates is an advantage.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in telecom engineering DESIGN on above mentioned technologies (Registration with EGBC preferred) for experienced engineers.
Proficiency in Pathloss - Microwage Software.
Knowledge of Canadian and British Columbia codes and standards, including OH&S Regulations, CSA codes is an asset.
These positions require a high level of interpersonal communication skills, dtrong client focus.
Occasional travel to site locations is required.
Are you up for this challenge? Apply today, submit your CV with a cover letter, and join our team to help engineer a Better Future for our Planet and its People.

At AtkinsRéalis, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds, and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion, or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

986679,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/986679,Lead Project Engineer,Wood PLC,,,,,"JOB DESCRIPTION
Wood is currently hiring Lead Project Engineer with experience in onshore FEED Gas processing facilities Oil & Gas industry to be based in Abu Dhabi office
RESPONSIBILITIES
Review ITT/RFQ documentation and interpret the scope of work for all sizes of projects.
Work and take ownership of proposals including written proposals, presentations, etc.
Prepare/collate manhours/qualifications for the proposal from stakeholders.
Collaborating with centers of excellence and other affiliate offices as required to prepare a winning proposal.
Take part in the onshore and offshore site visits for proposal preparation.
Liaise with subcontractors, vendors & OEMs to obtain the costs for their services
Liaise with technology providers / Licensors as required for the proposals
Provide customer responses (including expressions of interest, presentations, etc.)
Ensure that the proposal is compliant and delivered on time.

Prepare/Review/analyze proposal sections for consistency and clarity, compliance with solicitation, requirements, and alignment with proposed solutions and themes, and writes/re-wrote proposal sections as necessary to deliver high-quality, winning proposals.
Prepare and deliver presentations (pre-proposal or post-proposal) to Clients and other internal stakeholders
Take on the responsibility of Proposal Lead or Proposal Coordinator as required due to the workload of the proposals team including (but not limited to) the following:
-Develop and implement the proposed management plan (responsibility/compliance matrix)
-Develop and implement the proposal schedule
Support and contribute to the continual improvement of proposal procedures and processes
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Typically requires 15 years in a project delivery environment
Experience in High Sour Gas project is required.
Basic knowledge and experience in Project Success and Benefits Management on small, standard projects.
Basic knowledge and experience in stakeholder and requirements management
Experience in developing basic estimates based on past performance and some understanding of the uncertainties in estimates and their currency during the project phases.
Knows how to calculate costs and has some experience in producing planned and actual cost and invoicing needs.
Experience in the preparation of proposals for Studies, FEED, and Detail Engineering projects is preferred.
Basic knowledge of contract models, purpose, value in risk management, and the consequences of default.
Awareness of project initiation processes and tools.
Awareness of national and international quality assurance standards.
Knowledge of the company-specific and general industry practices in locating and acquiring sub-contract goods and services.
Knowledge of the relevant national and international legal, regulatory, ethical and social requirements and consequences of non-compliance
Knowledge of the basic principles of WBS, Networks, CPA. Awareness of task logic and durations in design, construction, or other relevant activities.
Knowledge of the creation of project plans and S-curves using resource hours and methods for obtaining achieved progress.
Awareness of the sources of change on projects and ability to identify change
ABOUT US

Wood is a global leader in consulting and engineering, helping to unlock solutions to critical challenges in energy and materials markets. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in 60 countries, employing around 35,000 people. www.woodplc.com
Diversity Statement

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:53:43,,
924455,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/924455,Product Classification Engineer,ABB,,,,,"Product Classification Engineer

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.
This position reports to
Head of Supply Chain Management
Your role and responsibilities

The mission of the Product Classification Engineer (PCE) is to support the business in product classification within the trade compliance area. This means product classification of physical goods in line with the Swedish Tulltaxan and classification of products, software and technology in line with Swedish export control regulation of dual-use items as well as the US Export Administration Regulation. The trade classification work plays an important role to ensure that all business transactions related to exports and imports are aligned with laws and regulations, as well as ABB trade policies and guide-lines. The PCE is the point of contact to our customs brokers when information about correct HS codes is needed. In collaboration with the Country Trade Compliance Officer as well as Local Trade Compliance Officer and other PCE colleagues you will be responsible for product classification activities, including proper documentation and work with continuous improvement of the classification processes. In this role you will be a part of Supply Chain Management at ABB Process Industries reporting to the Head of Supply Chain Management. • Perform sanity check or execute product classification, including proper documentation, ac-cording to Tulltaxan (Swedish customs classification) • Perform sanity check of classification of products, software and technology received from suppliers, including proper documentation, according to Swedish dual-use regulation • Perform sanity check of classification of products, software and technology received from suppliers, including proper documentation, according to US Export Administration Regulation • In case of implementation of certain sanctions packages, support the business with sanctions applicability analyze of product portfolio • Regularly upload export control classification data into SAP GTS Compliance (GTS = Global Trade Services) • Review classified items in case of any updates of Tulltaxan, the Swedish export control regulation or US Export Administration Regulation • Be part of the ABB local and global trade compliance community • Live ABB's core values of courage and care, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business
Qualifications for the role
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
Basic technical knowledge of some of the ABB product portfolio
Good understanding of end-to-end sales processes, risk management, and product
Manage assignments with limited direct supervision
Effectively communicate across all levels of the business
Business mindset, strong sense of ownership, sense of details and self-driven personality
Team player with good communication skills, capable of communicating fluently in Swedish and English, both verbally and in writing.
Good knowledge of sanctions and export control laws and regulations is a merit
Good knowledge in export control classification is a merit
Good knowledge in customs classification is a merit
More about us

We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory Recruiting manager Daniel Gwiten +46 72 461 24 22 will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives -Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Blomqvist, +46 768 06 00 11
column2: Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16
column3: Unionen: Krista Andersson, +46 706 44 02 85. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Sara Vestin, +46 724 64 46 88. Please note that, to be eligible for employment at ABB, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:53:47,,

958777,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/958777,Lead Mechanical Engineer - Power Electronic Modules,GE Renewable Energy Power and Aviation,,,,,"Job Description Summary

The Mechanical Engineer in this role is responsible for the design, development, and drafting of packaging solutions for advanced semiconductor power modules used in power electronics systems. Includes activities linked to the technical improvement of existing products and components. Responsible for departmental operations planning/execution or is focused on execution of professional activities within a technical discipline. This role involves close collaboration with Configuration Management team to ensure that all design changes and documentation are accurately tracked and maintained.
Job Description

Design and Development: Develop and optimize mechanical packaging designs for semiconductor power electronic modules, ensuring they meet performance, reliability, and manufacturability requirements. Create definitions of parts, and assemblies in the form of 2D cross sections, 3D models, tolerance stack-ups, and various electronic data formats to support analysis, manufacturing, assembly, tooling, and inspection.
Thermal Management: Design packaging solutions that effectively manage thermal loads to ensure the reliability and longevity of power modules.
Material Selection: Select appropriate materials for packaging that meet thermal, mechanical, and electrical requirements.

Configuration Management: Work closely with the Configuration Management team to ensure all design changes are accurately documented and tracked. Maintain up-to-date records of design revisions and ensure compliance with configuration management processes.
Collaboration: Collaborate with electrical engineers, manufacturing teams, and suppliers to ensure seamless integration of packaging solutions into the overall product.
Compliance: Ensure all packaging designs comply with industry standards and regulatory requirements.
Documentation: Maintain detailed documentation of packaging designs, test results, design changes, and configuration management records.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements and cost reductions in packaging design and manufacturing.
Prototyping and Testing: Create prototypes and conduct rigorous testing to validate packaging designs. Analyze test data and make necessary design adjustments.

Uses judgment and has ability to propose different solutions outside of set parameters to address more complicated manufacturing processes with technical variety and/or interdependent production cycles. Uses technical experience and analytical thinking. Uses multiple internal and limited external sources outside of own teams to arrive at decisions.
Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. May lead small projects with low risks and resource requirements. Explains information
column2: developing skills to bring team members to consensus around topics within field. Conveys performance expectations and may handle sensitive issues.

column1: Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited university or college in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in mechanical design
Proficiency in CAD software, AutoCAD, SolidEdge, ANSYS Workbench
Strong understanding of thermal management and mechanical stress analysis
Knowledge of industry standards and regulatory requirements
Familiarity with configuration management tools and processes
Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree or higher from an accredited university or college in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
2-5 years of experience in mechanical design
Experience in Aerospace industry.
Experience in SiC/GaN power module design/packaging.
Strong oral and written communication skills
Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems.
Ability to document, plan, market, and execute programs
Established project management skills
Experience with power electronics and power module packaging
Familiarity with reliability testing and failure analysis
Experience working with configuration management systems
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication and teamwork abilities
Additional Job Description
Additional Information
Compensation Grade
LPB1

GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunities Employer. GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening.
Relocation Assistance Provided: Yes",,,,,2024-12-01 15:54:06,,
915216,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/915216,Electrical Engineering - Recent Grad/Full Time,Honeywell,,,,,"Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
The future is what you make it.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.
Working at Honeywell isn't just about developing cool things. That's why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.
Are you ready to help us make the future?
ABOUT THE ROLE:

As an Electrical Engineering Recent Graduate here at Honeywell, you will have the opportunity to apply your knowledge and skills in a dynamic and innovative environment. You will work alongside experienced professionals and contribute to the design and development of cutting-edge electrical systems and components.

In this role, you will support electrical engineers in the design of power and control systems for case conveyors, automatic storage and retrieval systems, and other automated equipment. You will collaborate with multi-functional departments to ensure project success, both in-house and in the field. Work with multi-functional team members, providing engineering support to resolve well-defined technical problems.
Be a contributor of an electrical engineering team delivering material handling solutions to the distribution and fulfillment industry.
Location: This position is available in multiple locations across the United States.
Pay Range:

The annual base salary range for this position is $78,000/yr - $102,500/yr. Please note that this salary information serves as a general guideline. Honeywell considers various factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to the scope and responsibilities of the position, the candidate's work experience, education and training, key skills, as well as market and business considerations.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Must be currently pursuing a bachelor's degree (or higher) from an accredited college or university in Electrical Engineering or similar field.
Must graduate from an accredited college or university between December 2024 and May 2025 and be available to begin full-time work between January 2025 - July 2025
Must have obtained degree within 12 months of the date of hire
WE VALUE:
Experience with Microsoft Office products, including Excel, Word, Project, PowerPoint, and Outlook
Excellent analytical skills
Good communication skills and the ability to work effectively with other organizations and individuals at all levels
Positive, can-do demeanor
Ability to work well in a team and must adapt well to a changing environment
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to learn quickly and a desire to broaden skills and experience
Eagerness to help and offers help when tasks are presented
BENEFITS:

In addition to a competitive salary, leading-edge work, and developing solutions side-by-side with dedicated experts in their fields, Honeywell employees are eligible for a comprehensive benefits package. This package includes employer subsidized Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
column2: Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
column3: 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, EAP, and Educational Assistance
column4: Parental Leave, Paid Time Off (for vacation, personal business, sick time, and parental leave), and 12 Paid Holidays. For more information visit: Benefits at Honeywell

req469303,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/986125,Sr R&D Engineer Scientist - Process Modeling,Honeywell,,,,,"Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
The future is what you make it.

An excellent career opportunity is currently available for an Sr. R&D Engineer Scientist in the Modeling Development group within UOP's Research and Development organization located in Des Plaines, IL. This position affords a unique and visible opportunity to develop reactor and process models which are critical to the development of sustainable process technologies from their inception in R&D through the commercialization stage. You will be part of a team that supports the development and commercialization of new technologies like sustainable aviation fuel production from renewable feedstocks, crude to petrochemicals, battery energy storage, blue hydrogen, green hydrogen, and waste plastics recycling.
LOCATION: Des Plaines, IL (Chicago Area)
Are you ready to help make the future with us?
When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.

UOP, a Honeywell company headquartered in Des Plaines, Illinois, is a leading international licensor of processing technology and supplier of engineering services, catalysts and adsorbents, equipment, specialty materials and digital solutions for the global refining, gas processing and petrochemical industries. With more than a century of leadership in hydrocarbon processing technologies, UOP has led six revolutions in technology that transformed our industry. For more information visit www.uop.com.
BENEFITS:
Benefits provided may differ by role and location. Learn more at benefits.honeywell.com.
• Unlimited Vacation Plan with No Preset Maximums
• Flexible Work Schedule
• Medical/Rx Health Savings Account (HSA)
• Dental/Vision
• Short/Long-Term Disability
• Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
• 401(k) Plan
• Education Assistance
Honeywell considers various factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to
the scope and responsibilities of the position, the candidate's work experience, education and training, key skills, as well as market and business considerations.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Apply process modeling expertise to support R&D project teams throughout the technology development process
• Deliver kinetic and empirical model solutions for early-stage research to establish fundamental understanding
• Utilize state-of-the-art modeling techniques and simulation software to support process design and optimization, scaling up our technologies from R&D into production
• Engage with sales to build tools representing our UOP technologies, ensuring that our offerings are competitive and maximizing value delivered to clients
• Find creative solutions to technical problems, both working individually and within diverse cross-functional teams
• Maintain and grow our technical knowledge base for reactor modeling, data analytics, and advanced parameter estimation methods, sharing knowledge with a focused team of subject matter experts

• Be part of a team that applies its expertise and knowledge to technical projects, finding innovative, cost-effective means to improve research, techniques, procedures, and products and technologies. You will develop, conduct and evaluate new approaches to meet project objectives faster and more efficiently and you develop and commercialize products & technologies
• Travel both domestic and internationally approximately 10% annually.
YOU MUST HAVE:
• Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution in a technical discipline such as the sciences, technology, engineering or mathematics

• 5+ years of experience in modeling, process simulation, process development or reaction engineering or a PhD in Chemical Engineering with 2+ years of experience in modeling, process simulation, process development or reaction engineering.
WE VALUE:
• Experience and capability in statistics, experimental design, data analytics, and advanced parameter estimation and numerical methods.
• Familiarity with machine learning, data science tools and algorithms
• Excellent computer programming skills.
• Strong interpersonal skills and the capability to work effectively across multiple functional departments.
• Knowledge of chemical engineering fundamentals including fluid flow, heat transfer, mass transfer and reaction engineering.
• Knowledge of UOP technologies: Refining/Petrochemicals/Gas Processing applications.
• Knowledge of Six-Sigma principles and their use in managing risk and uncertainty.

874417,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/874417,Senior Mechanical Engineer,AtkinsRéalis,,,,,"Job Description
Shape the Future of our cities and environments.

Are you ready to take up a vital role in shaping some of our exciting projects? How about joining our talented team, where everyone has a voice, and together we face our clients' challenges head-on. It's a diverse and inclusive work environment where world-class talent knows no distinctions.

Bring your skills to the mix as a Senior Mechanical Engineer, you'll play a vital role in every aspect of mechanical engineering on Transformational Programmes for critical UK infrastructure with opportunities to work on iconic engineering projects at home and abroad.

We specialise in all aspects of mechanical engineering, within multiple challenging and engaging sectors such as Water, Aviation, Defence, Energy, Cities & Development and Education. We continue to provide industry-leading mechanical engineering solutions right through the project lifecycle, with value added through client-side support as well as construction phases. If being a part of a team with a passion for this industry is for you then we would love to talk to you.
We currently have opportunities in our Leeds office.
Your Purpose
Manage a team to undertake technical design work following relevant design standards and codes, and to high-quality levels.
Prepare briefs, scopes of work, and input into bid proposals.
Successfully manage time and budgets to key project milestones and programmes.
Work closely with teams in the UK and overseas to deliver integrated design solutions.
Adhere to quality assurance standards in design.
What you can bring
Chartered Mechanical Engineer.
Experience in design delivery, including multidisciplinary design.
Sound knowledge in mechanical equipment, such as pumps, blowers, screens and chemical dosing plant as well as an in-depth understanding of current UK design standards and working practices.
Strong understanding of legislation such as CDM and ATEX.
Why work for AtkinsRéalis?

We know that different people have different priorities, which is why we're here to support you and why we're ranked as one of LinkedIn's Top 25 Companies as well as one of the Times Top 50 employers for women. Flexible and remote working is a central part of our culture. So talk to us about what's ideal for you - from reduced weeks to buying more leave over school holidays. And if you're returning from a career break, ask us how we can help you transition back into work with us.

As an organisation, we're committed to engineering a better future for our people and our planet, from leading the way on global Engineering Net-Zero programmes to creating social value through EDAROTH community housing, we are proud to do our bit for the society we live in.

AtkinsRéalis recognise that there are many well qualified people who are looking to further their career, but who cannot commit to full time employment. We support flexible working arrangements and are interested to discuss how we can accommodate individual requirements. As part of this commitment, we understand the need for a diverse and flexible workforce, where a work-life balance is important. So, by default AtkinsRéalis offers flexible working, where there is no fixed 9 'till 5, no need for a 5-day week, no requirement for a full-time contract, and no requirement to spend all your working time in the office.
Rewards and Benefits:

We offer a competitive salary that is regularly tested against other consultants with a default 25-days leave each year plus bank holidays and options to buy some or sell of that leave. Salary and benefits will be commensurate with experience and qualifications.
Training:

AtkinsRéalis is committed to developing its people both personally and professionally. Our colleagues have the advantage of access to a high ranging training portfolio and development activities designed to help make the best of individual's abilities and talents. We also actively support staff in achieving corporate membership of relevant institutions.
Additional Information:

This role may require security clearance and offers of employment will be dependent on obtaining the relevant level of clearance. If this is necessary, it will be discussed with you at interview. The vetting process is delivered by United Kingdom Security Vetting (UKSV) and may require candidates to provide proof of residency in the UK of 5 years or longer. If applying to this role please do not make reference to (in conversation) or include in your application or CV, details of any current or previously held security clearance.

We are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive community - a place where we can all be ourselves, thrive and develop. To help embed inclusion for all, from day one, we offer a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements and employee networks to support staff from different backgrounds. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we value applications from all backgrounds, cultures and ability.
#LI-INFRASTRUCTURE | #LI-UK| #LI-ATKINS| #DAT
Worker Type
Employee
Job Type
Regular

At AtkinsRéalis, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:54:37,,

1006842,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1006842,Cybersecurity Engineer,Emerson,,,,,"Job Summary

If you are an IT / Cyber savvy person, Emerson has an exciting role for you! We are looking for a 'Cybersecurity Engineer' who will be part of a team that delivers global services to protect Control systems and supporting IT architecture against cyber-attacks.
Primary Location : EEEC Pune
During job orientation program, you will undergo Comprehensive Training Program (includes E-learning, Classroom & On-Job) that support Emerson businesses.

The process control industries have many critical applications and require a high degree of safety and availability. Hence it is required to implement Cybersecurity solutions for process control systems at customer's sites around the world.

The successful candidate will also perform cybersecurity assessments of control systems and surrounding IT infrastructure and work closely with a team of peers to provide IT and OT Cybersecurity configuration recommendations.
Integration and technology testing to assure proper process and procedures exist for both the integrity and security of our systems.
Need to work with internal test groups to ensure that validation of security functionality is comprehensive and correct.
We value autonomy, self-reliance, fast movers, analytical ability, accuracy & quality work.
In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:
Design and architect security tools and solutions in process control systems, ensuring systems are properly configured, optimized, and tested.
Review and provide solution for customer's security procedures and concepts.
Analyze risks and threats to process control systems.
Train users on supported security products and procedures.
Collaborate with senior engineers and consultants with customers in developing best practices and security standards.
Security requirements include drafting technical and security related documents, controls and packages for customers as well as peer documentations.
Work to understand and address our customers' security concerns and requirements.
Who You Are:

You promote high visibility of shared contributions to goals. You quickly and significantly take action in constantly evolving, unexpected situations. You actively seek input from pertinent sources to make timely and well-informed decisions. You handle the risk that comes with moving forward when the outcome is not certain.
For This Role, You Will Need:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
2 to 3 or more years of practical IT work experience, 2+ years related to the implementation of cyber security solutions or cybersecurity standards and initiatives.
Analytical thinking ability and good team player
Suggesting and implementing improvements to the processes
Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:
Experience and knowledge of defense in depth, trust levels, privileges, and permissions.
Practical experience with security software such as SIEM's, NSM, A/V, White listing technologies, patch management solutions, firewalls, routing / switching, packet analysis etc.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, along with ability to clearly communicate technical information to a range of audiences.
Highly motivated to work in the security area and interact with customers.

Experience with cyber security standards and practices in multiple industries (e.g. ISA99/IEC 62443, NERC, etc.), and certifications from qualified organizations such as GICSP, CISSP or ISACA are a plus.
Experience in design, implementation, or life cycle support of process automation and control systems is a plus.
Experience with Industrial Control Systems challenges in multiple industries from Energy to manufacturing and more is a plus
Our Offer to You:
By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do.

Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets. We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees.
We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion. We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship.

We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential. We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company.

We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office.
Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities.
Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.
Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company's values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson.
If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com.
WHY EMERSON
Our Commitment to Our People

At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.

We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world's most complex problems - for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You'll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor.

At Emerson, you'll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let's go. Let's think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let's go, together.
ABOUT EMERSON

Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.

With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.

We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you're an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you'll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team - let's go!",,,,,2024-12-01 15:54:51,,
