If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com.
ABOUT EMERSON

Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.

With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.

We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you're an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you'll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team - let's go!
No calls or agencies please.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:54:54,,
1006825,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1006825,Performance Engineer,Engie,,,,,"Linkebeek, Brussels, Belgium - Mechanics & Thermal Processes
Are you excited about embarking on a journey with us in a carbon-neutral world?

We are seeking a collaborative colleague who is passionate about making a positive impact on ENGIE Laborelec's success and overall performance. If you have a deep interest in the energy transition, power generation and technology, we urge you to explore this opportunity.
Bring your expertise, grow with us and build your career in a safe and diverse environment.
Who are we?

ENGIE Laborelec is a research and expertise center focused on electrical power technology, with a team of over 380 employees from different backgrounds. We are part of the ENGIE Group, and more particularly the entity ENGIE Research & Innovation. We support the entire electricity value chain, providing customized solutions to a diverse range of customers from various fields and industries. We are dedicated to achieving a net zero carbon future and finding sustainable solutions.
About the team

Our Power & Infrastructure Business Line provides high added value activities to the Global Business Units of ENGIE, the power generation sector, grid operators, and the industry in Europe. This covers applied research and on-the-field technical expertise.

As Performance Engineer, you will play a key role in supporting the design, analysis and optimization of thermal installations and processes. Under the guidance of experienced engineers and experts, you will be responsible for assisting in the development and implementation of thermal solutions that cater to our clients' unique requirements. This is an excellent opportunity for a passionate individual to grow their career in thermal engineering and contribute to cutting-edge projects.
What you'll be doing
Your responsibilities as Performance Engineer
As a Performance Engineer, you will work alongside a supportive team, and will have access to professional development opportunities to help you grow in your own career.
Your mission

Manage or participate to projects related to combined cycle power plants, innovative thermal processes and industry processes in Europe and internationally (especially in Middle-East and Latin America).
Conduct in-depth simulations, analysis, and modelling of thermal processes using state-of-the-art software tools to optimize performance and enhance efficiency,

Collaborate with senior experts to assist in design and evaluation of thermal systems and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of thermal systems within larger projects,
Foster a customer centric attitude
column2: commercial or business development experience is a plus,

column1: Develop and maintain a strong technical network within your activities and respective expertise field,
Contribute to the testing, calibration, and validation of thermal equipment, ensuring strict adherence to industry standards and safety regulations,

Contribute to the development of new products and service activities related to thermal power plant process optimization, decarbonisation of existing and new assets, ... (from fuel specifications to the emission monitoring).
If you identify with any of the following, we encourage you to apply!
Do you?
Hold an engineering degree in mechanical or electrical domain, with a good knowledge of thermodynamic principles, heat transfer and fluid mechanics
Are proficient in either Dutch, French, or English with a willingness to improve your language skills.
Be customer-oriented with excellent communication skills, ready to travel within Belgium, Europe, and occasionally outside Europe for short-term missions.
Bring your team spirit while being capable of working independently, taking initiatives, and developing synergies with internal departments and external partners.
Here's a taste of what Laborelec offers you
Flexible Working Environment: A green campus and hybrid workspace (Up to 3 days home working/week) offering flexibility for a good work/life balance
Employee Resource Groups: An exciting position in a prominent research and expertise center, with the possibility of further career development within ENGIE.
An inspiring work environment: Shared with bold colleagues from different backgrounds.

Learning & Development: Growth is a big reason people choose to join our team. We provide opportunities through ""lunch and learn"" programs, training, coaching, mentorship programs, and other workshops.
Benefits: 34 leave days, 5 days free care for sick children, linen ironing service...
Wellness: You will have access to our fun room and fitness space for your enjoyment and well-being
Where we work
Our headquarters is based in Belgium (Linkebeek, near to Brussels), and we have several branches in Europe (France, Germany & the Netherlands), LATAM (Chile) and MESCAT (KSA & UAE).
Our values : The 4B's
Be You, at Laborelec, we encourage you to be yourself and allow your skills and knowledge to shine through.
Be Safe, keeping our employees safe is our top priority.
Become, as a Laborelec employee, you can build your career.
Belong, join our dynamic community at Laborelec and become an integral part of our team.
Our commitment

At ENGIE Laborelec, we are committed to building a team that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve, including people of all races, genders, ages, religions, disabilities, and sexual orientations.
We'd love to hear from you if this opportunity sparks your interest.
Your HR contact: Damien Colmant damien.colmant@engie.com

We believe any recruitment decision should be a sustainable one, taken by both parties and in full transparency. Don't hesitate to reach out in case you have specific questions you want to get answered before applying.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:55:05,,
1006758,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1006758,Nuclear & Power Senior Process Engineer (Full-time / Part-time),AtkinsRéalis,,,,,"Job Description
Join us to Build a Cleaner, Safer Net Zero World!
Shaping the next generation nuclear power together!

Engineers at AtkinsRéalis are at the heart of delivering transformative projects in the UK nuclear industry, reducing carbon emissions whilst achieving future energy security. Your work will span across areas including new nuclear power station design, developing fusion technologies, or implementing new nuclear waste management processes and defence projects.

AtkinsRéalis is looking to grow our team of process engineers within the Nuclear & Power business. If you have the passion to join some of these exciting projects, then we would love to discuss with you.
About the Opportunity:

We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds and skills, and take a strengths-based approach, looking to fit roles to the applicant's strengths to allow them to support the development of their own careers and success of the business.
BEng/MEng in Chemical Engineering with Chartership (preferable).
SC clearance (preferable).
Experience in the nuclear industry would be ideal but we welcome the learning you can bring from other industries too.
Focused on providing high quality work to the client.
Communicate well in written and verbal form.
Enjoy mentoring and guiding junior engineers and take a key role within the team.
Why work for AtkinsRéalis?

In AtkinsRéalis, we value your priorities and support you to get the most out of life, both at work and outside it. We provide a tailored ""Total Reward"" package, offering a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements and employee networks to support staff from diverse backgrounds.
Flexible working policy, Hybrid working.
Pension double matching arrangement up to 10%.
Competitive annual leave and option to purchase additional annual leave.
Life assurance.
Private medical scheme.
Visa sponsorship for senior candidates.
Read more about 'Total Reward here: YourReward at AtkinsRéalis (atkinsrealis.com)

We are not all the same and that's our greatest strength. We value the diverse perspective that our people bring and recognize everyone for their contribution. You will be part of a genuinely collaborative environment where everyone's voice is valued and treated equally. We are Disability Confident, an Inclusive Employer, and support STEM Returners.

It is also our vision to see more women taking up senior roles at AtkinsRéalis. In the energy sector, we have signed up for the AXIS Pledge, promising to make equal pay, equal leadership, and equal opportunities a reality.
Read more about our Vision for Women here: Women at AtkinsRéalis (atkinsrealis.com)
More about us:

Our Power New Build covers a wide array of clients and projects in the UK and internationally. We deliver services and projects that range from new nuclear power station design, developing fusion technologies, to implementing new nuclear waste management processes. We provide consultancy and design services across all stages of the project lifecycle, from concept design through to site-based commissioning. There is innovation at all stages to improve solutions and provide an optimum service.
Read more about the Power New Build business here: Power New Build | AtkinsRéalis
Additional Information:

This role may require security clearance and offers of employment will be dependent on obtaining the relevant level of clearance. If this is necessary, it will be discussed with you at interview. The vetting process is delivered by United Kingdom Security Vetting (UKSV) and may require candidates to provide proof of residency in the UK of 5 years or longer. If applying to this role please do not make reference to (in conversation) or include in your application or CV, details of any current or previously held security clearance.

We are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive community - a place where we can all be ourselves, thrive and develop. To help embed inclusion for all, from day one, we offer a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements and employee networks to support staff from different backgrounds. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we value applications from all backgrounds, cultures and ability.

Employee

1006750,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1006750,Electrical Engineer - Low Voltage & Medium Voltage,AtkinsRéalis,,,,,"Job Description
Do you want to bring the new vision of nuclear energy to reality?

AtkinsRéalis is one of the world's principal multi-disciplinary consultancy firms for engineering, design, and construction, offering unparalleled opportunities for talented individuals in search of a rewarding career. At AtkinsRéalis, we offer more than just a job. We offer an opportunity to make a difference and shape the world to benefit future generations and the environment.
Following a very successful 2023 AtkinsRéalis is looking for a talented Electrical Engineer to support a variety of exciting projects including:

Hinkley Point C (HPC), Sizewell C (SZC), Small Modular Reactors (SMR) and defence-based work. You'll be joining a friendly and rapidly growing Integrated Engineering Solutions (IES) team within the Power New Build part of our business. This team specializes in supporting the delivery of nuclear new build projects for clients that are major operators in the nuclear sector. Read more about how you can thrive with us: Equality, diversity & inclusion in the UK & Europe (atkinsrealis.com)
Ideally applicants will be:

Significantly educated in electrical/electronic engineering, mechatronics, building services or engineering mathematics. You may possess a BTEC National Diploma, HNC/HND, foundation degree, bachelor's degree, or any level 3+ qualification in any of these subjects.
Energised to take responsibility for design, optioneering, evaluation and assessment of Electrical systems, as stand-alone technical tasks, or part of large multi-disciplinary projects.

Able to act as a connector supporting multi-disciplinary designs alongside our Mechanical, Process and Civil/Structural engineers as well as having resilience to overcome key client project challenges when providing design and commissioning support.
What we offer?

AtkinsRéalis recognise that there are many well qualified people who are looking to further their career, but who cannot commit to full time employment. We support flexible working arrangements and are interested to discuss how we can accommodate individual requirements. As part of this commitment, we understand the need for a diverse and flexible workforce, where a work-life balance is important. So, by default AtkinsRéalis offers flexible working, where there is no fixed 9 'till 5, no need for a 5-day week, no requirement for a full-time contract, and no requirement to spend all your working time in the office.
Rewards and Benefits:

We offer an industry standard salary that is regularly tested against other consultants with a default 25-days leave each year plus bank holidays and options to buy extra or sell some of that leave. Salary and benefits will be commensurate with experience and qualifications. Benefits are found on our Your Reward website ranging from flexible holidays to health and wellbeing benefits.
YourReward at AtkinsRéalis (atkinsrealis.com)
Latest Projects Articles
Why work for AtkinsRéalis?

The UK is the first major economy to legislate for a Net Zero target by 2050. To achieve this, our nuclear and clean energy teams are ensuring a mix of secure and sustainable energies that can meet our industry and lifestyle demands today, and in 30 years' time. We help to power our world through exciting new technologies and intelligent cybersecurity systems on projects that vary greatly in size, scope, and scale. So, you'll be creating the right safe and resilient systems across nuclear power, renewables, decarbonisation development, new builds and energy efficiency.
Read more about our Vision for Women: Women at AtkinsRéalis (atkinsrealis.com)
Meeting your needs:

When you start with us, you'll enjoy ""Total Reward,"" a package that can be tailored to your lifestyle, career and personal needs. From flexible holidays to life assurance, health & wellbeing benefits, and career planning for the senior stage of your career. Making sure you're supported is important to us. So, if you identify as having a disability, tell us ahead of your interview. And let's talk about any adjustments you might need.
New name, new era. We are AtkinsRéalis. It will take some time for all our information to update - you can still refer to our fantastic benefits via the link below:
YourReward at AtkinsRéalis (atkinsrealis.com)
More about us:

AtkinsRéalis is a leading global consultancy with over 100 years of design and engineering expertise. With us, you'll be surrounded by the skills, knowledge, and support to help you succeed. Together, we can deliver projects which have a positive, sustainable impact on the world.
AtkinsRéalis Projects (atkinsrealis.com)

HRD250448,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1006883,Cyber Security Architect/Engineer I - UAE Nationals Only,Honeywell,,,,,"Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs

Honeywell

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. R&D Team Lead

The Measurement & Analytics Division is among the world's leading manufacturers and suppliers of smart instrumentation and analyzers, working at the heart of industrial digital transformation. The Measurement & Analytics Division's portfolio consists of analyzers measuring compositions of gases and liquids
column2: instrumentation measuring process variables such as temperature, pressure, flow, and level

The Measurement & Analytics Division serves key industries such as oil and gas, chemical, water and wastewater, power, hydrogen, batteries, as well as the marine industry. Parameters such as emission levels and production inputs are measured by providing 'before' and 'after' values, enabling efficient operations and environmental sustainability through measurement. column1: 1006730,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1006730,Quality Engineer - Mechanical Engineering,ABB,,,,,"Quality Engineer - Mechanical Engineering

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. Write the next chapter of your ABB story.
This position reports to
Quality Technician
Your role and responsibilities

As a Quality Engineer, reporting to the Quality Service Manager, you are responsible for ensuring compliance and implementing the quality strategy within the organization. This includes cultivating a quality-focused culture, utilizing systems and tools, and leveraging competent teams. The goal is to meet and exceed customer expectations while ensuring sustainable operations. The Quality Engineer assists the organization in achieving an optimal combination of prevention, continuous improvement, robust root cause analysis, rapid response, and sustainable problem-solving. The role involves collaborating with local functions impacting quality outcomes to meet organizational unit objectives and aim for world-class performance. This position is part of ABB's Electrification, Installation Products division and is based in Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu. • Lead the deployment of quality management strategies and objectives. • Collaborate with leadership to innovatively shape the design and development of the functional domain. • Support management with quality-related content, tools, and systems. • Continuously identify and address risks and opportunities in quality management. • Conduct audits to assess compliance with defined systems. • Analyze organizational quality data to identify risks, failures, and non-conformities. • Support local teams to ensure stakeholder requirements are met, focusing on prevention rather than control. • Execute and/or coordinate activities related to designated quality domains, such as customer and complaint management, departmental planning, product safety and compliance, design and development process adherence, internal audits, and reporting. • Champion the customer voice, ensuring risks, issues, and solutions are evaluated from the perspective of customers/stakeholders. • Handle customer case resolution (internal and external) through robust root cause analysis and preventive and corrective actions. • Maintain and enhance the quality management system, including processes and tools to ensure seamless and reproducible process execution, identifying gaps, and exploring improvement opportunities. • Utilize the local quality management system to provide teams with procedures for sustainable execution. • Support local teams in implementing an operational approach and process management system, continuously assessing its effectiveness. • Create and deliver training materials on the quality management system and related content. • Coordinate and participate in industry benchmarking activities, both within and outside ABB, to continually challenge the status quo. • Assist in initiatives to enhance agreed-upon quality aspects.
Qualifications for the role
Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering.
3 to 5 years of experience in a similar role.
Green Belt certification is an asset.
Bilingual in French and English, with excellent oral and written communication skills (English is essential for communicating with clients and suppliers outside Quebec).
Knowledge of electricity is an asset.
Excellent communicator with strong data analysis and reporting skills.
Customer satisfaction oriented.
Comfortable managing supplier relationships.
Team player with strong collaboration skills across multiple departments.
Capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.
Benefits
Retirement plan
Accident insurance
Healthcare plan
Wellbeing program
More about us

ABB Installation Products Division (formerly Thomas&Betts),is the number one manufacturer of electrification products in North America with a 125-year history of providing innovation and customer- focused solutions for connecting and protecting electrical systems, as well as a unique differentiated medium voltage offering. Our products are used all around you, every day - orbiting the earth, working on Mars, on the fastest trains we ride, in the fastest cars of the world, crossing oceans, in factories producing your food, in the tallest buildings of the world, in the most modern hotels and in the walls of your home. With a portfolio of more than 200,000 products marketed under more than 38 premium brand names, our Division offerings are found wherever electricity is used. We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. For the ninth consecutive year, ABB Canada has been recognized as one of Canada's Best Employers by Forbes magazine. Consistently ranked as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers, Montreal's Best Employers, Canada's Best Employers for Young People, Canada's Greenest Employers and a long-time recipient of the Women in Governance Parity Certification, ABB's culture and commitment is to provide a caring workplace where everyone collaborates, feels valued, respected, included and supported. Also committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups
column2: women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to the applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process. ABB's Military Reservist Policy offers Canada's Reserve Force members the flexibility to undergo military training and activities while maintaining job security, seniority, pay, benefits, and privileges as ABB employees, including up to 15 paid working days per year for training, as well as extended leave for operations both in Canada and abroad, ensuring seamless career integration with our nation's defense forces.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:55:27,,

1006714,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1006714,Join Aker Solutions as an Architect Engineer in Stavanger!,,,,,,"As a global leader in the energy sector, Aker Solutions is shaping the future of sustainable energy. From managing assets throughout their lifecycle to enabling field life extensions and decarbonization, we are at the forefront of innovation. Together with our recruitment partner, NES Advantage, we are looking for an Architect Engineer who shares our passion for creating a better tomorrow.
Why Aker Solutions?
At Aker Solutions, we:
Innovate for sustainability: We’re driving the transition to greener energy by helping customers decarbonize operations and exploring opportunities in offshore renewable maintenance.
Empower our people: With over 11,000 skilled employees in 20 countries, we foster a collaborative and inclusive environment that values creativity, communication, and personal growth.
Deliver excellence: From brownfield electrification projects to life-extension solutions, our projects reflect our commitment to safe operations and optimized results.
What’s in it for you?
Expand your expertise: Work with a talented team in a dynamic, forward-thinking architectural department.
Professional growth: Access exclusive opportunities to grow within Aker Solutions’ global projects.
Top-tier facilities: Enjoy our fantastic office spaces with onsite canteen, training facilities, and proximity to restaurants and shopping.
Convenient transport options: Benefit from HjemJobbHjem transport discounts and a nearby train station.
What you’ll do:
As an Architect Engineer, your responsibilities will include:
Ensuring the quality and timeliness of your deliverables in line with project plans, procedures, and routines.
Collaborating on updates to architectural discipline procedures and integrating lessons learned.
Preparing, verifying, and delivering construction-friendly job packages.
Conducting 3D-model design verifications and ensuring adherence to project requirements.
Communicating with multiple stakeholders including suppliers, subcontractors, and production teams.
Maintaining a strong focus on HSSE (Health, Safety, Security, and Environment) performance and continuous improvement.
What we’re looking for:
Do you bring the right expertise? We’re seeking someone who has:
A MSc, BSc, Technical College, or equivalent relevant education and experience.

1006662,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1006662,Project Engineer,Exxon Mobil,,,,,"About us

At ExxonMobil, our vision is to lead in energy innovations that advance modern living and a net-zero future. As one of the world's largest publicly traded energy and chemical companies, we are powered by a unique and diverse workforce fueled by the pride in what we do and what we stand for.

The success of our Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses is the result of the talent, curiosity and drive of our people. They bring solutions every day to optimize our strategy in energy, chemicals, lubricants and lower-emissions technologies.

We invite you to bring your ideas to ExxonMobil to help create sustainable solutions that improve quality of life and meet society's evolving needs. Learn more about our What and our Why and how we can work together .
ExxonMobil's affiliates in India

ExxonMobil's affiliates in India supporting the Product Solutions business engage in the marketing, sales and distribution of performance as well as specialty products across chemicals and lubricants businesses. The India planning teams are also embedded with global business units for business planning and analytics.
ExxonMobil's LNG affiliate in India supporting the upstream business provides consultant services for other ExxonMobil upstream affiliates and conducts LNG market-development activities.
The Global Business Center - Technology Center provides a range of technical and business support services for ExxonMobil's operations around the globe.

ExxonMobil strives to make a positive contribution to the communities where we operate and its affiliates support a range of education, health and community-building programs in India. Read more about our Corporate Responsibility Framework.
To know more about ExxonMobil in India, visit ExxonMobil India and the Energy Factor India .
What role you will play in our team

The Primary role / function of the Project Engineer is to plan and execute project scopes. The role requires the ability to work across global teams, identify and drive problem resolution, interface and direct multiple project disciplines (e.g. safety, cost, schedule, quality, etc.), and communicate clearly to site teams, management, and contractor organizations
What you will do
Work with assigned global business units to identify project requirements and coordinate development of Project Management System deliverables and reviews.
Participate in ITT development, bid evaluation, and contractor selection.
Oversee engineering, execution planning, procurement, systems completion, and start up.
Stewarding contractor's performance, align key stakeholders, engage internal discipline experts.
Coordinates project issues identification and resolution process.
Ensure smooth transitions between project stages, across sites, and between key stakeholders.
About you
Skills and Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in an engineering field from a recognized university with CGPA 6.5 and above
Minimum 3 years of experience executing capital projects. Preference given to experience in oil and gas, petrochemical, power, construction, or fertilizer industry.
Size and complexity of assigned scope will be a factor of experience, skills, and performance. Candidates with additional years of experience are expected to have:
Diverse project experience in engineering, procurement, construction, project management and controls activities.

Exposure to more than one of the following aspects of project execution (engineering, procurement, fabrication, construction, brownfield execution, turnarounds, offshore installation, international project management assignments).
Additional consideration will be given to candidates with:
Experience of project screening, economic analysis and concept selection.
Strong experience in Engineering Management.
Preferred Qualifications/ Experience
Owner /operator Company experience ishighly preferred.
Strong leadership, influencing, and interpersonal skills.
Able to articulate technical issues to a non-technical audience.
Good command of English both written and spoken.
Strong organizational, coordination, planning, and interface skills.
Knowledge of industry standards and related work processes.
Flexibility to travel internationally.
Your benefits

An ExxonMobil career is one designed to last. Our commitment to you runs deep: our employees grow personally and professionally, with benefits built on our core categories of health, security, finance and life.We offer you:
Competitive compensation
Medical plans, maternity leave and benefits, life, accidental death and dismemberment benefits
Retirement benefits
Global networking & cross-functional opportunities
Annual vacations & holidays

Training and development program
Tuition assistance program
Workplace flexibility policy

What role you will play in our team

In this role, you are expected to deploy basic, front end and detail- Process Engineering expertise across both projects and operations with focus on development, optimization and technical follow-up of facilities design specifications, concept screening and selection, optimization for greenfield & brownfield project scope. You will be providing global Facilities Engineering support from a centralized organization supporting wide variety of projects and/or operating facilities, ranging from: small projects to major capital projects, greenfield to brownfield, onshore to offshore, sweet to sour designs, conventional/unconventional oil and gas production to LNG and downstream Refining and Chemicals. In this role, you are expected to deploy basic, front end and detail- Process Engineering expertise across both projects and operations with focus on development, optimization and technical follow-up of facilities design specifications, concept screening and selection, optimization for greenfield & brownfield project scope. You will be providing global Facilities Engineering support from a centralized organization supporting wide variety of projects and/or operating facilities, ranging from: small projects to major capital projects, greenfield to brownfield, onshore to offshore, sweet to sour designs, conventional/unconventional oil and gas production to LNG and downstream Refining and Chemicals.
What you will do
Concept Selection and Optimization:

Support studies on Facilities Planning & Technology Selection through Concept Selection, Pre-FEED & preliminary cost estimation and prepare feasibility reports, as individual contributor or SME for assigned area of responsibility, interfacing with other disciplines.
Lead/contribute to an integrated team for developing scope definition of various facility concepts and analyzing/recommending results to maximize business value

Ensure full alignment of recommended scope with Business Teams, Manufacturing Site/Operations, Process Technology Specialists and Engineering Specialists providing design input to cost estimating models.

Support the development of early Heat & Material Balances, Process Flow Diagrams, Design Philosophies and Design Basis documentation for new facilities in the Facilities Planning Stage & implement principles of the Right Scope Framework for concept stage projects.
Lead or participate in early optimization studies, field verifications, and equipment sizing.
Drive or participate in facilities and systems reviews and provides resolutions as required, including P&ID review, HAZOP, 3D Models review and other relevant reviews.

Responsible for development of the Project O&U basis and the integration of the O&U facilities within the existing plant or the new plant design, integrating other disciplines to ensure technical quality and completeness of facilities definition.
Develop planning documentation for internal company reviews for funding recommendation
Provide mentoring, oversight and perform technical reviews of the work of less experienced engineers, ensuring delivery of quality and capital efficiency while meeting schedule requirements
What you will do- Cont....
Project Development and front End Engineering Management:

Lead integrated project teams for early project development and concept selection activities and contribute towards Engineering Surveillance of contractor deliverables during FEED and Detailed Design.
Technical leadership for projects in Process Design and addressing complex technical challenges, supporting and leading projects from concept through commissioning and startup.

Ensure quality, compliance with job specification, design methods and safety factors of process design deliverables created both by contractors and by ExxonMobil self-perform methods in all stages of capital projects
Ensuring compliance with job specification, design methods and safety factors are correctly applied in the design.
Providing operability reviews for start-up, normal, turndown, and shutdown modes. Establishing design basis for normal and alternate operating conditions
Participate/lead design reviews, Risk Assessments, HAZOPs, vendor bid evaluations, and project readiness reviews

Review Utilities specifications, including steam generation / distribution systems, water supply / treating, fuel systems, compressed air / nitrogen systems, cooling water system, safety systems and power generation.
Develop project schedule to appropriate level of detail and set key milestone dates to support project goals, including aligning with turnaround milestones and unit outages.
Develop project Road Map with input from key stakeholders and manage internal and external interfaces.

Develop project resource plans, manage development phase budget, track scope changes, and coordinate cross-functional project support including benchmarking, cost and schedule estimating, and execution planning
Determine contractor scope of work for pre-FEED/FEED, monitor contractor performance against plans and job specification, and develop improvement plans to address any performance gaps.
About You
Skills and Qualifications
Bachelor's degree (B.E. / B. Tech) or higher in Chemical Engineering from AICTE recognized university
Authorization to work in India
Minimum 3 years of experience in Process Design, Engineering, Technical Services roles in either Upstream, Refinery, Downstream Petrochemical or Low Carbon Solutions industry
Prior experience in Owner / manufacturing / technical services/ Process Design in Projects would be preferred.
Functional Competencies:

Proven background in Process Design, Process operations or Technical Service support for Oil and Gas production facilities, Refinery or Petrochemical plants with demonstrated experience in Upstream, Downstream and Low Carbon Solutions domain. This includes, but is not limited to:
Conventional & unconventional Onshore production facilities, pipelines, tank batteries, and sales gas compression
Offshore Oil and Gas production, including platforms, FPSO, FPU, FLNG and FSRU
LNG Liquefaction & Regasification facilities, NGL Recovery, Sour Oil and Gas Treatment
Produced Water Treatment , Associated Safety Systems
Refining Processes, Chemical Processes, Hydrogen & Ammonia generation
Carbon capture & sequestration
Knowledgeable in the selection and application of Offsites and utilities systems aforementioned areas
Comprehensive understanding of safety aspects in design, hazard identification/risk assessment techniques, fire protection, and pressure relief analysis
Design new process equipment and evaluate existing equipment to ensure compliance with modified operating parameters.
Preferred Experience in planning and executing brownfield modifications & upgrades to existing facilities.
About you-Cont..
Proficiency in and understanding of integrated data flows in the following programs:
AspenTech Engineering Suite including HYSYS, Aspen Basic Engineering, Aspen Capital Cost Estimator, Flare System Analyzer
AVEVA Engineering Suite (Front End Engineering through 3D Modeling) Intergraph / Hexagon Engineering Suite, other similar types of commercially available engineering suites
PRO-II, Hysis, PROMAX, Unisim
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of programs
Familiarity with facility monitoring systems such as PI Vision, XHQ, SEEQ & others.
Behavioral Competencies:
Highly motivated team player who builds trust and contributes to a positive team dynamics.
Strong communicator with the ability to convey information clearly, listen actively, and tailor messages to different audiences.
Skilled in building successful working relationships in a virtual environment.
Demonstrates cultural sensitivity within the context of a multicultural and globally distributed team.
Capable of effectively self-prioritizing activities and demonstrating personal flexibility within the team environment to achieve business objectives.
Strong organizational, planning, coordination, interface, and technical judgment skills. Able to interface with non-engineering disciplines to achieve common objectives.
Demonstrated ability to lead projects in full or limited capacity, such as area lead or process lead roles.
Experience mentoring junior process engineers is advantageous.
Willing and able to travel or relocate domestic/ internationally as per business need.
Should not have attended an interviewed for any position with ExxonMobil in the last one year
Your benefits

An ExxonMobil career is one designed to last. Our commitment to you runs deep: our employees grow personally and professionally, with benefits built on our core categories of health, security, finance and life.We offer you:

req469323,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/985589,Aerospace Engineering (Neurodiversity Program) - Summer 2025 Internship U.S. PERSON required,Honeywell,,,,,"Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
Seeking to attract talented Neurodivergent candidates.
The future is what you make it.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.
Working at Honeywell isn't just about developing cool things. That's why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.
Are you ready to help us make the future?
ABOUT THE ROLE:

Honeywell is hiring an Aerospace Intern! Envision, design, and develop products and systems as a highly engaged and integrated engineering team. You will work closely with and partner across Honeywell engineering teams to create solutions and systems that meet the evolving needs of our customers. You will help participate in all phases of product development and will be part of a group of hardworking engineers whose expertise ensures the success of engineering projects and programs.

Through hands-on learning experiences, global exposure, networking, and professional development opportunities, Honeywell interns will shape the future. You'll have the opportunity to work alongside industry experts, guide initiatives that refine technical skills, and have unparalleled mentorship and growth opportunities that will elevate your career.
#Futureshaper
Location: Phoenix, AZ, Torrance, CA

Pay Range: The hourly base salary range for this position is $23.00/hr - $38.00/hr. Please note that this salary information serves as a general guideline. Honeywell considers various factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to the scope and responsibilities of the position, the candidate's work experience, education and training, key skills, as well as market and business considerations.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
• Must be pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Engineering
• Must graduate after December 2025
• Must continue enrollment in degree program upon completion of the internship
• Due to compliance with U.S. export control laws and regulations, candidate must be a U.S. citizen, U.S. permanent resident, or have asylum or refugee status in the U.S.
WE VALUE:
• Curiosity, Risk Taking, Flexibility, Real passion for growth, Drive to Succeed
• People who are results-oriented, who consistently take the initiative to get things done
• Aptitude to balance many priorities and results-oriented demands
• People who are motivated problem solvers
• Validated academic excellence (3.0 GPA and higher)

Interning at Honeywell provides hands-on experience with cutting-edge technologies, professional development, and mentorship within a global organization. Interns will receive relocation benefits and short-term housing if they are 50 miles or more from their assigned work location (excluding Puerto Rico and Canada).
The application period for the intern position is estimated to be through the end of March 2025

914450,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/914450,Nuclear Engineer - Radioactive Waste Management,Engie,,,,,"Nuclear Engineer | Radioactive Waste Management
TRACTEBEL Brussels office (Partial Homework possible)
Engineer your positive impact!

Tractebel is a global engineering and consulting company delivering integrated solutions for sustainable energy and built environment projects. Our expertise is trusted worldwide across multiple markets like nuclear, renewables, power & gas, electrical grids, hydropower & dams, water resources & supply, desalination, complex & high-tech buildings, transport infrastructures, and ports & waterways. By connecting strategy, design, engineering, social & environmental studies, project management and in-house digital applications, we partner with companies and public authorities to create a positive impact on people and planet. Backed by more than 150 years of experience, today Tractebel is a community of over 5,500 passionate experts across the globe, committed to ethical business and the fight against climate change. Tractebel is part of the ENGIE Group, a global reference in low-carbon energy and services.

Thanks to a strong increase in business activity, we are currently recruiting a fulltime Nuclear Engineer Radioactive Waste Management for a permanent position in our Brussels HQ, Namur, Hasselt or Ghent office (partial homework possible).
Function

As Nuclear Engineer Radioactive Waste Management you will join our dynamic team which is responsible for the expertise field related to Radiation Protection, Radioactive Waste Management and Nuclear Decommissioning. In close collaboration with your colleagues, your Group Manager and the Project Manager, you conduct Engineering Studies in the field of Radioactive Waste Management, this covers both the radioactive waste resulting from operations and from dismantling.
Core responsibilities
Technical expertise
Knowledge about solid, liquid and gaseous radioactive waste types and treatment
Knowledge about treatment and conditioning of solid radioactive waste
Development of waste management strategies
Verification of technical specifications, technical follow-up of contracts and commissioning of installations for the treatment and/or conditioning of radioactive waste.
Collaboration
Verify the technical work performed by your peers
Actively engage in knowledge sharing with others
Coaching of young colleagues
Working in close relationship with the final Client and interact with Safety Authorities and the Radioactive Waste Management Agency.
As an ambassador
Embody the image and values of Tractebel and the ENGIE group (Ethics, QHSE,...) in all your contacts, both inside and outside the ENGIE group, and other external stakeholders.
Working environment

Within the Tractebel Business Area Global Nuclear, you will join one of our technical departments which is managed by the Head of Métier and the Group Managers. Together with the engineers in the teams, we cover all Engineering aspects in the field of:
Radiation Protection, Radiological Characterization and Radiation Monitoring
Radioactive Waste Management (both waste from operational and from dismantling operations)
Nuclear Decommissioning Processes (preparation of the dismantling of the Belgian Nuclear Power Plants).
Our offer

We offer more than just a job: you get the possibility to carry out a complex job full of challenges in an inspiring environment in which we contribute to many projects in the (inter)national nuclear industry and in which you can develop your career. We offer opportunities to travel and expatriate, opportunities to attend prominent conferences, as well as trainings via our Tractebel Academy or other providers.
We do our very best to provide the best working environment for our employees in function of their personal work-life balance needs with:
the possibility for partial homework and flexible hours
well-designed and comfortable workspaces to boost productivity and focus rooms
lots of areas where you can take a break with your colleagues and have a snack or a drink
a free gym at the office which can be used within your preferred time schedule.
Your profile
Minimum requirements:
an experience of 5 years at least in the domain of radioactive waste management
a Master's degree in Engineering / Sciences
Language: (French or Dutch) and English
Knowledge of the Belgian Nuclear Ecosystem
Working principles of a Nuclear Power Plant (type Pressurized Water Reactor)
Knowledge about the waste management systems of the Belgian NPPs is an asset
You can relate to following skills or attitudes:
You can work autonomously and have a high sense of quality
You like to share your knowledge with less-experienced colleagues
You like to co-create with your team in order to make things better, faster or to boost business.
Tractebel welcomes candidates from all backgrounds, and actively promotes Diversity in the workforce.

1006557,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1006557,Completions Engineer – Electro/Instrument/Telecom/SAS,,,,,,"As Aker Solutions’ global recruitment partner NES Advantage is now looking for: Several Completions Engineers – Electro/Instrument/Telecom/SAS with experience in onshore or offshore projects.
The project is led from Stord and operates in 14/21 day rotation. Start-up is 01.04.2025

Aker Solutions’ New Build segment delivers oil & gas and renewables offshore developments and fabrication products, mainly focused on the Norwegian Continental Shelf and selective international markets. The segment is responsible for large EPCI projects, both within oil and gas and renewables, including business development and project execution, typically large topsides including fixed or floating substructures, onshore facilities, FPSOs offshore wind HVDC topside and jackets, offshore aquaculture floaters and decommissioning and recycling.
What will you be doing?
Plan, organize, and execute completions activities in line with project procedures.
Ensure HSE aspects are thoroughly assessed and followed up.
Contribute to budget and cost management for completions discipline.

1006502,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/production-jobs/1006502,Manufacturing Software Engineer,Emerson,,,,,"As the Manufacturing Software Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and implementing manufacturing systems to improve production efficiency, quality assurance and cost-effectiveness from single test equipment to advanced production lines with a fully integrated Manufacturing Execution System (MES).
In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:
To maintain and develop our Manufacturing Execution System for both new products and enhancements for existing products to create high Automation and Digitalization.
To maintain and develop software applications for test and traceability.
To analyze and lead continuous improvements for manufacturing systems.
To support activities for binding the Business System together with the Manufacturing Execution Systems.
To develop software for controlling ex: test objects, test instruments, torque drivers, pick-to-light, vision systems, welding systems etc.
To develop and implement automation solutions to reduce manual labor and increase capability.
Who You Are:

You are a skilled software developer and interested in manufacturing system engineering. You have a desire to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You analyze multiple and diverse sources of information to define problems accurately before moving to solutions. You quickly and significantly act in fact-changing, unpredictable situations. You pursue everything with energy, drive, and the need to finish. You work through formal and informal channels to build broad-based relationships and support!

Bachelor's degree in engineering, programming, data or a related field.
Strong understanding of manufacturing processes and digital automation systems and experience in software development, programming and Human Machine Interface development.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a team effort environment.
Fluency in English & Swedish, both written and spoken.

1006490,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1006490,Contract Senior Reservoir Engineer,Wood PLC,,,,,"JOB DESCRIPTION

Wood is currently searching for a Contract Senior Reservoir Engineer to support our growing Consulting business in Calgary, AB. The Contract Senior Reservoir Engineer is responsible for ensuring that the objectives of the Subsurface Group and its Customers are performed to a satisfactory high standard and that specific work tasks are performed safely, effectively and in compliance with the specified objectives. As such, he/she shall be viewed as a technical expert and a focal point for the Customer, Contractor(s), Suppliers/Vendors and other internal department(s).

This is an on-call as needed position, and is expected to be a 12 month contract. Due to the nature of the role, we will consider qualified applicants who are Canadian citizens or authorized to work in Canada only at this time.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Perform detailed technical work in support of project deliverables, including model upscale, local grid refinement, dynamic simulations and well optimization testing
Work as a key member of the subsurface team on data collection planning and production optimization strategies
Strategically advise on EOR with advanced applicable knowledge of enhanced recovery methods such as SAGD, water flooding, and gas injection
Interpret, QC and integrate production data into dynamic reservoir models for history matching and forecasting
Be able to interpret, QC and explain reservoir dynamics in multiphase settings
Work with geologists to develop and run sensitivity and scenario-based analyses
Provide guidance to others (technical and non-technical) in the areas of reservoir engineering and field planning
Engage with clients for the purpose of communicating critical information and presenting on project deliverables
Act as an expert technical interface as required for peer reviews, partner's meetings, etc.
Comply with the Company HSE Policy and Quality Management System (QMS)
Support other key work as may be required on a time-to-time basis.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree or higher in Reservoir Engineering with 10-15 years industry experience
Advanced expertise with industry standard simulation software such as GEM, Eclipse and Intersect
An understanding of Subsurface Geology and its impact on reservoir dynamics
Demonstrated applied experience in Thermal enhanced recovery techniques, such as SAGD, Steam Flood, and Cyclic Steam Stimulation (Huff-and-Puff)
Technical and Team Leadership skills
Good Organizational skills
Strong Written and Oral Communication capability
Established LLC
Must be a Canadian citizen or authorized to work lawfully in Canada, without sponsorship from Wood.
ABOUT US

Wood is a global leader in consulting and engineering, helping to unlock solutions to critical challenges in energy and materials markets. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in 60 countries, employing around 35,000 people. www.woodplc.com
Diversity Statement

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:56:55,,
1006403,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1006403,Senior Engineering Manager,ABB,,,,,"Senior Engineering Manager

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. Write the next chapter of your ABB story.
This position reports to
Local Divison Manager - MOSD
Your role and responsibilities

In this role, you will be working as Sr Engineer Manager and manage a team of designers/engineers to deliver high quality, cost effective and timely engineering solutions for various products, formulate plan, allocate resources to meet the agreed contractual and financial targets. Ensure team's compliance with standard processes, procedures, practices and safety requirements. The work model for the role is: #LI-Onsite This role is contributing to the Motion business for System Drives division in Nelamangala -Bangalore, India You will be mainly responsible for : • Defines and ensures implementation of operating guidelines for team. Oversees progress within own area of responsibility, identifies and manages technical issues. • Drives team performance to ensure that deliverables are met on time, as per the set contract, safety and quality requirements. • Ensures that the engineering team is adequately resourced, developed and • equipped to meet business needs. • Ensures correct assignments of tasks within the engineering team, defines relevant performance metrics. • Creates work plans and cost estimates for engineering work. • Collaborates with other stakeholders locally and globally to ensure the team's goals are aligned with the overall Division / Product Group goals and the systems and processes are implemented in line with global standards. • Collaborate with the Supply Chain function to ensure that correct suppliers services and equipment are available to support the engineering execution • Conceptualize new designs and translate concept into Product design. Designing products considering to project requirements (performances, manufacturability, serviceability, testability, etc) as per Global Engineering Process.
Qualifications for the role
Requires a Bachelor's / Master's degree in electrical/Electronics/Power Electronics Engineering.
Prefer 15+ years of experience in a relevant senior position
Must have good experience in power electronics applications in Industrial, Energy Storage or similar fields.
Proficiency in design software's including MATLAB etc and also in design simulations and prototyping.
Desirable Attributes:
Good experience in technical aspects in the field of Electrical and Power Electronic.
Team Management, Possess team orientation toward accomplishing common goals
Ability to interact, communicate and work effectively with all like Internal cross function Teams, Global team, Customer, and vendors.
Experienced with all phases of Engineering activities and should have demonstrated an active working relationship with both internal and external customers
Good communication skills, written and verbal
More about us

ABB System Drives is the market leader in high-power, high-performance drives, drive systems and packages for industrial process and large infrastructure applications, and a leading supplier of power conversion equipment for renewable energy and other applications. The Division offers global support to help customers, partners and equipment manufacturers with asset reliability, performance improvement and energy efficiency in mission critical applications We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory ""It has come to our attention that the name of ABB is being used for asking candidates to make payments for job opportunities (interviews, offers). Please be advised that ABB makes no such requests. All our open positions are made available on our career portal for all fitting the criteria to apply. ABB does not charge any fee whatsoever for recruitment process. Please do not make payments to any individuals / entities in connection to recruitment with ABB, even if is claimed that the money is refundable. ABB is not liable for such transactions. For current open positions you can visit our career website https://global.abb/group/en/careers and apply. Please refer to detailed recruitment fraud caution notice using the link https://global.abb/group/en/careers/how-to-apply/fraud-warning""",,,,,2024-12-01 15:57:00,,

957513,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/957513,Design Engineer,NOV,,,,,"JOB DESCRIPTION
PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Evaluate design ideas based on design-function relationships, serviceability, materials, methods of engineering, application, budget, price, production costs, methods of production, market characteristics, and client specifications.
Prepare illustrations from quotations and purchase orders to convey information to the Drafting Team.
Design products for custom applications. Coordinate preparation of submittal drawings. Perform detailed review and redline of drawings prepared by the Drafting Team.
Liaison for technical project-related inquiries. Provided technical support to sales, project management, and drafting.
Review of contract specifications and quotes for adequate information before quote finalization.
Minor travel may be required on an as-needed basis.
Periodically lead the design of plant equipment hoists, tables, covers, etc., and investigate alternative fabrication techniques for products.
Other duties as assigned.
JOB REQUIREMENTS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit
column2: use hands/fingers to handle or feel
column4: and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand
column6: climb or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

column1: Must have a valid driver's license and possess or be able to successfully apply for a passport.

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to fumes or airborne particles. The employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions
column2: moving mechanical parts
column3: high, precarious places, and outside weather conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

column1: EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS
An Associates Degree or Bachelor's Degree in Engineering from an accredited university. Mechanical Engineering preferred.
1-2 years' professional experience minimum.
Experience in Water and Wastewater Industry with an understanding of water dynamics and composite manufacturing experience.
Effectively manage the assigned workload as scheduled.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills. The ability to multi-task and suggest/adapt to design changes in a fast-paced environment is preferred.
Structural knowledge
column2: strong mechanical aptitude

column1: Working knowledge of SolidWorks, AutoCAD, Mathcad, and Microsoft Office applications.
PAY RANGE:
$79,380 - $92,000 annual salary
To learn more about our Benefits: https://usbenefits.nov.com
To learn more about the Business Unit: Fiber Glass Systems Webpage
ABOUT US
Every day, the oil and gas industry's best minds put more than 150 years of experience to work to help our customers achieve lasting success.
We Power the Industry that Powers the World

Throughout every region in the world and across every area of drilling and production, our family of companies has provided the technical expertise, advanced equipment, and operational support necessary for success-now and in the future.
Global Family
We are a global family of thousands of individuals, working as one team to create a lasting impact for ourselves, our customers, and the communities where we live and work.
Purposeful Innovation
Through purposeful business innovation, product creation, and service delivery, we are driven to power the industry that powers the world better.
Service Above All
This drives us to anticipate our customers' needs and work with them to deliver the finest products and services on time and on budget.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:57:08,,
985399,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/technicians-or-service-jobs/985399,Electrical Field Engineer - Dubai,,,,,,"What are you going to do
Be fully conversant with electrical codes, regulations, and safety standards applicable to the Project
Review design/construction documents at site and be fully familiar with all scope of work related to his/her discipline
Responsible to make site decisions where required to enable the project to move forward
Responsible to keep good communication with discipline Electrical Engineer
Attend regular site query engineering meetings
Review/endorse discipline raised site queries/deviations
Inspecting construction sites frequently and ensuring that there are no outstanding site issues that have not been raised related to his/her discipline
Provide technical assistance during construction to resolve any technical issues arising related to Electrical installations
Responsible to ensure the EPC contractor implements the Electrical scope are per project requirements
Provide expertise to site team to avoid/resolve site engineering problems
Ensure the Electrical scope of work and technical drawings is being implemented and that all work is inconformity to standards and specifications
Prepare and provide daily field engineering updates to management team
Will not hesitate to issue ‘STOP WORK’ when witness potential hazard or risk that could cause harm to themselves, their co-workers, the environment, or the equipment
As and when requested/required, conduct regular inspections checks to ensure electrical installations meet the required standards
Participate and witness performance tests on powerlines, cables, etc. as well as other equipment used for the transmission of electrical power etc
When requested, review and endorse red line mark-up drawings.
Essential skills and knowledge
15 + years’ experience in the Oil and Gas industry in an appropriate discipline in an operator company
Experience in multi-Construction projects in several different countries of E&I Oil and Gas project Installations
Mandatory experience in a similar position: 10+ Years
Experience in understanding project engineering drawings
Experience in project specifications
Advanced troubleshooting skills
Experienced in HSE overall project requirements
Language: English as mother tongue or Fluent in English (speaking and writing), Arabic is Plus.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:57:30,,
914450,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/914450,Nuclear Engineer - Radioactive Waste Management,Engie,,,,,"Nuclear Engineer | Radioactive Waste Management
TRACTEBEL Brussels office (Partial Homework possible)
Engineer your positive impact!

Tractebel is a global engineering and consulting company delivering integrated solutions for sustainable energy and built environment projects. Our expertise is trusted worldwide across multiple markets like nuclear, renewables, power & gas, electrical grids, hydropower & dams, water resources & supply, desalination, complex & high-tech buildings, transport infrastructures, and ports & waterways. By connecting strategy, design, engineering, social & environmental studies, project management and in-house digital applications, we partner with companies and public authorities to create a positive impact on people and planet. Backed by more than 150 years of experience, today Tractebel is a community of over 5,500 passionate experts across the globe, committed to ethical business and the fight against climate change. Tractebel is part of the ENGIE Group, a global reference in low-carbon energy and services.

Thanks to a strong increase in business activity, we are currently recruiting a fulltime Nuclear Engineer Radioactive Waste Management for a permanent position in our Brussels HQ, Namur, Hasselt or Ghent office (partial homework possible).
Function

As Nuclear Engineer Radioactive Waste Management you will join our dynamic team which is responsible for the expertise field related to Radiation Protection, Radioactive Waste Management and Nuclear Decommissioning. In close collaboration with your colleagues, your Group Manager and the Project Manager, you conduct Engineering Studies in the field of Radioactive Waste Management, this covers both the radioactive waste resulting from operations and from dismantling.
Core responsibilities
Technical expertise
Knowledge about solid, liquid and gaseous radioactive waste types and treatment
Knowledge about treatment and conditioning of solid radioactive waste
Development of waste management strategies
Verification of technical specifications, technical follow-up of contracts and commissioning of installations for the treatment and/or conditioning of radioactive waste.
Collaboration
Verify the technical work performed by your peers
Actively engage in knowledge sharing with others
Coaching of young colleagues
Working in close relationship with the final Client and interact with Safety Authorities and the Radioactive Waste Management Agency.
As an ambassador
Embody the image and values of Tractebel and the ENGIE group (Ethics, QHSE,...) in all your contacts, both inside and outside the ENGIE group, and other external stakeholders.
Working environment

Within the Tractebel Business Area Global Nuclear, you will join one of our technical departments which is managed by the Head of Métier and the Group Managers. Together with the engineers in the teams, we cover all Engineering aspects in the field of:
Radiation Protection, Radiological Characterization and Radiation Monitoring
Radioactive Waste Management (both waste from operational and from dismantling operations)
Nuclear Decommissioning Processes (preparation of the dismantling of the Belgian Nuclear Power Plants).
Our offer

We offer more than just a job: you get the possibility to carry out a complex job full of challenges in an inspiring environment in which we contribute to many projects in the (inter)national nuclear industry and in which you can develop your career. We offer opportunities to travel and expatriate, opportunities to attend prominent conferences, as well as trainings via our Tractebel Academy or other providers.
We do our very best to provide the best working environment for our employees in function of their personal work-life balance needs with:
the possibility for partial homework and flexible hours
well-designed and comfortable workspaces to boost productivity and focus rooms
lots of areas where you can take a break with your colleagues and have a snack or a drink
a free gym at the office which can be used within your preferred time schedule.
Your profile
Minimum requirements:
an experience of 5 years at least in the domain of radioactive waste management
a Master's degree in Engineering / Sciences
Language: (French or Dutch) and English
Knowledge of the Belgian Nuclear Ecosystem
Working principles of a Nuclear Power Plant (type Pressurized Water Reactor)
Knowledge about the waste management systems of the Belgian NPPs is an asset
You can relate to following skills or attitudes:
You can work autonomously and have a high sense of quality
You like to share your knowledge with less-experienced colleagues
You like to co-create with your team in order to make things better, faster or to boost business.
Tractebel welcomes candidates from all backgrounds, and actively promotes Diversity in the workforce.

1006557,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1006557,Completions Engineer – Electro/Instrument/Telecom/SAS,,,,,,"As Aker Solutions’ global recruitment partner NES Advantage is now looking for: Several Completions Engineers – Electro/Instrument/Telecom/SAS with experience in onshore or offshore projects.
The project is led from Stord and operates in 14/21 day rotation. Start-up is 01.04.2025

Aker Solutions’ New Build segment delivers oil & gas and renewables offshore developments and fabrication products, mainly focused on the Norwegian Continental Shelf and selective international markets. Plan, organize, and execute completions activities in line with project procedures.
Ensure HSE aspects are thoroughly assessed and followed up.
Contribute to budget and cost management for completions discipline.
Develop and manage relevant procedures and work instructions.
Lead and perform completions activities in your assigned area.

Proficiency in tools like MIPS, MS Office 365, PCS (Pims, ProCoSys), and Autodesk Simulate.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken

1006227,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1006227,Sr Mechanical Engineer,,,,,,"Job Title: Sr Mechanical Engineer
Reports To: Engineering Manager
Job Type: Permanent, Full-time
Work Schedule: on-site
Location: Mobile, AL USA

NES Fircroft is a leading global technical recruitment company providing professional contract and permanent staff to a diverse world-wide client base within the energy industry. Our client, OneSubsea (JV of Schlumberger, Aker Solutions and Subsea7), located in Mobile, Alabama is looking to add a SR Mechanical Engineer.
Position Summary
OneSubsea is seeking to hire an experienced Senior Mechanical Engineer to join our dynamic Umbilical & Cable Systems Engineering team at our manufacturing and design facility in Mobile, AL.
Essential Duties
Lead the design and development of subsea umbilical systems, inclusive of umbilical cross section, topside and subsea umbilical terminations.
Function as primary technical contact with clients and suppliers.
Manage all project technical deliverables while adhering to project budget and schedule.
Engineering specification of sub-supplied ancillaries such as dynamic bend stiffeners, bend stiffener connectors, buoyancy and ballast modules, and various clamp assemblies.

Oversight and completion of engineering calculations and reports required for cross section design, end termination strength, seabed stability, corrosion protection, accumulated plastic strain, sea fastening and any other project specific requirements.
Develop manufacturing plan and umbilical layout for most efficient manufacturing of the umbilicals.

Design of test samples and procedures for typical API 17E umbilical tests such as umbilical flex fatigue, tensile and torsional, end strength, bending stiffness, bundle impact, crush, internal friction and tensioner hold back testing.
Produce all required technical project documentation to be delivered to and agreed upon with the client.
Provide technical support and troubleshooting during all phases of project execution.
Manage client and supplier interfaces.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including project managers, procurement, quality, manufacturing and offshore installation teams.
Lead and mentor junior engineers.
Support sales related activities such as estimating, technical reviews of proposals and client meetings as needed.
Education and Required Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering.
Minimum of 10 years of experience in engineering.  Subsea engineering experience is strongly preferred but not required.
Experience with subsea umbilicals, subsea distribution equipment, or subsea engineering.
Familiarity with engineering software and simulation tools such as SolidWorks, Abaqus, and Orcaflex.
Knowledge of applicable industry standards such as API 17E, ISO and DNV.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and lead projects.
Willingness to travel as required.

About our Client A global joint venture to expand the frontiers of subsea SLB, Aker Solutions, and Subsea7 have come together to create the world’s leading subsea technology and solutions provider. We are focused on accelerating innovation to create a step change in subsea production economics and reduce emissions in subsea operations.

The joint venture brings together deep reservoir domain expertise, broad front-end and system design knowledge. We provide an extensive field-proven subsea production and processing technology portfolio, world-class manufacturing scale and capacity, and unique pore-to-process integration capabilities.
For additional information, please contact Julie Watkins – Julie.watkins@nesfircroft.com

With over 90 years' combined experience, NES Fircroft (NES) is proud to be the world's leading engineering staffing provider spanning the Oil & Gas, Power & Renewables, Chemicals, Construction & Infrastructure, Life Sciences, Mining and Manufacturing sectors worldwide. With more than 80 offices in 45 countries, we are able to provide our clients with the engineering and technical expertise they need, wherever and whenever it is needed. We offer contractors far more than a traditional recruitment service, supporting with everything from securing visas and work permits, to providing market-leading benefits packages and accommodation, ensuring they are safely and compliantly able to support our clients.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:58:27,,
