1006208,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1006208,Senior Engineering Specialist,Vestas,,,,,"Do you have experience in the offshore wind industry, engineering design, and project management? Are you enthusiastic about sustainable energy and driven to protect the environment? We're seeking an experienced engineer with a positive attitude who is eager to advance their career!
Region NCE > Customer Project Execution > Heavy Lift & Site Engineering Offshore

Heavy Lift & Site Engineering team in Vestas is responsible for the technical and marine operations of Offshore Installation Vessels and Service Jack-Up Vessels for Main Component Exchanges in Northern Europe where we support our offshore wind projects. You will become a part of the team with skilled and experienced subject-matter experts within the offshore installation and service logistics area.
Responsibilities
Prepare and review seabed and site data, lifting plans, ghost positions, SSA/LPA, and coordinate with jack-up vessel owners and project teams.
Participate in interface meetings with clients, vessel providers, MWS, and other contractors to ensure smooth information exchange and task distribution within Vestas.
Assist Sales, Construction, and Service teams with technical and marine operations to ensure safe and efficient vessel sailing, jacking, and lifting.
Conduct thorough assessments of seabed and site conditions to inform project planning and execution.
Develop and review detailed lifting plans and ghost positions for operational accuracy.
Liaise with installation jack-up vessel owners and project teams to ensure alignment and coordination.
Support technical and marine operations across various functions to maintain safety and efficiency standards.
Qualifications
7+ years of experience, preferably in Offshore Wind or Oil & Gas with Rigs/Jack-Ups.
Engineering degree in mechanical, civil, geotechnical, or marine fields.
Extensive knowledge of projection and ship navigation systems.
Proficient in marine surveys and data modeling of LIDAR and bathymetric datasets.
Experienced in chart production and handling pUXO, MAG, SSS, and SUB objects.
Deep expertise in Offshore Wind Jack-Up Vessels, Marine Operations, and Heavy Lift and Transport.
Skilled in GIS, AutoCAD, and MS Office, with fluency in English.
Competencies
Capable of working both individually and as part of a team.
Team-oriented with proven cross-functional collaboration skills.
Progressive mindset with a self-motivated attitude.
Proficient in scheduling and prioritizing tasks.
What we offer

We offer an exciting job with great opportunities for development in an inspiring environment at a world leading wind turbine producer. We value initiative, responsibility and accuracy. You will become part of an international environment with a professional development commitment and colleagues that take care of each other. Vestas offers great healthcare and flexible work opportunities.
Additional information
Primary work location: we are open for candidates to be based in Aarhus, Hamburg, Malmo, Warrington, or Vaasa.
Expected travel: approximately 30 days per year.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, however, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Please be advised to apply on or before 1/1/2025.
You can apply online by clicking on the ""Apply Online"" button at the top or bottom of this page.
BEWARE - RECRUITMENT FRAUD
It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, www.vestas.com/en/careers/job-openings.
DEIB Statement

At Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, ""Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry"". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.
About Vestas

Vestas is the energy industry's global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore. Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field. With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution - today, tomorrow, and far into the future. Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity. HRD9085295,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1006151,Sr reliability engineer,Honeywell,,,,,"Senior Reliability Engineer

As a Senior Reliability Engineer here at Honeywell, you will be a driving force in ensuring the reliability and optimal performance of our products. Guiding a skilled team of reliability engineers, you will instill a culture of excellence and continuous improvement. Your role involves the development and implementation of robust reliability engineering strategies, plans, and processes, with a keen focus on driving initiatives to elevate our reliability practices. Collaborating seamlessly with cross-functional teams, you will identify and resolve reliability issues throughout the product lifecycle. Your guidance extends to analyzing product failure data, implementing corrective actions, and conducting advanced reliability testing to validate and optimize product performance. Efficient budget and resource management will be central to your responsibilities, ensuring the team operates with maximum effectiveness. If you are ready to guide transformative initiatives, drive continuous improvement, and contribute significantly to the success of our organization in a fast-paced environment, we invite you to join our dynamic team. You will report directly to our Maintenance Manager and you will work out of our [City, State] location on an On-site work schedule.

In this role, you will impact the reliability and performance of our products, ensuring they meet and exceed customer expectations. Your expertise in reliability engineering will drive continuous improvement and elevate our overall reliability practices.

At Honeywell, our people play a critical role in developing and assisting our employees to help them perform at their best and drive change across the company. Help to build a strong, diverse team by recruiting talent, identifying and developing successors, driving retention and engagement, and fostering an inclusive culture.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
• Guide and manage a team of reliability engineers, fostering a culture of excellence and accountability to ensure the reliability and optimal performance of products.
• Foster a collaborative and high-performance team culture, providing guidance, mentoring, and facilitating to team members.
• Develop and implement comprehensive reliability engineering strategies, plans, and processes, aligning them with organizational goals.
• Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance reliability engineering practices and methodologies.
• Work with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve reliability issues throughout the product lifecycle, ensuring a holistic approach to product reliability.
• Act as a key liaison between engineering teams to facilitate seamless communication and coordination.
• Analyze product failure data to identify root causes and trends, implementing corrective actions to improve product reliability.
• Utilize advanced reliability testing and thoughtful methods to validate and optimize product performance.
• Manage and optimize the reliability engineering budget and resources to ensure efficient and effective operations.
• Provide expert technical guidance and facilitate to the reliability engineering team and other stakeholders, contributing to the overall knowledge and skill development.
BENEFITS OF WORKING FOR HONEYWELL
• Benefits - Medical, Vision, Dental, Mental Health
• Paid Vacation
• 401k Plan/Retirement Benefits (as per regional policy)
• Career Growth
• Professional Development
ABOUT HONEYWELL

Honeywell International Inc. (Nasdaq: HON) invents and commercializes technologies that address some of the world's most critical demands around energy, safety, security, air travel, productivity, and global urbanization. We are a leading software-industrial company dedicated to introducing state-of-the-art technology solutions to improve efficiency, productivity, sustainability, and safety in high-growth businesses in broad-based, attractive industrial end markets. Our products and solutions enable a safer, more comfortable, and more productive world, enhancing the quality of life of people around the globe.

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, care or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

InOctober, 2024 Honeywell announced the spin-off of our Advanced Materialsbusiness to become a stand-alone publicly traded company, independent ofHoneywell. Our intention is that thisrole, dedicated to the Advanced Materials business, will be a part of thisfuture transaction when the separation occurs
YOU MUST HAVE
• Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution in a technical discipline such as science, technology, engineering, mathematics.
• 6+ years of experience in reliability engineering in a manufacturing environment.
WE VALUE
• Advanced Engineering degrees like EE (Electrical Engineering), ME (Mechanical Engineering) etc. based on job title.
• Strong knowledge of reliability engineering ethics, tools, and techniques.
• Demonstrated strong guidance and team management skills.
• Identify and mitigate potential reliability risks and issues throughout the product lifecycle, applying advanced techniques such as FMEA, FMECA, and fault tree analysis.
• Work with stakeholders to define and establish reliability goals and metrics, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Additional Information

Category: Integrated Supply Chain
Relocation Tier: Not Applicable
Security Clearance: No Clearance
Aviation Authority (FAA for US): No
Band: 03
Referral Bonus: 0
Requisition Type: Standard Requisition
US Citizenship: Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements.

1006059,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1006059,Specialist Process Engineer,Wood PLC,,,,,"JOB DESCRIPTION
Wood is presently looking to hire a Specialist Process Engineer for ADNOC Offshore Central Engineering Division in Abu Dhabi. Below are more details about the position.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for process design and prepare/review the basis of design, process specification, data sheets, process drawings such as PFDs / P&IDs / DPTDs / PSFS etc. and other process deliverables on a project
Carry out process simulation using HYSYS, Flare System Analyzer, PipeNet and Pipesim etc. and prepare heat and material balance
Undertake detailed calculations to develop the process design and be responsible for the accuracy of these calculations
Carryout equipment sizing, line sizing, pump hydraulics, safety relief calculations and produce process calculation report
Carryout dynamic simulation study, transient study, surge study, Minimum Metal Design Temperature (MDMT) study, etc.
Carryout depressurization studies, flare load estimation and flare system design
Ensuring that the design is carried out as per the industry standard practices and in conformance with the quality management system
Participate in PHA, HAZOP and other safety reviews
Be willing to mentor and engage in the training and development of junior engineers in the team
Identification of issues that impede project progress and reporting to Lead Engineer / Discipline heads
Assimilating the evolution of new products and technology and updating oneself on the latest international standards in terms of engineering design practices and their applications
Ability to make independent decisions in the planning, organizing, and coordinating to develop solutions to complex problems and assist Project and client team for decision making
As Senior Discipline Engineer, when assigned on projects, responsible for managing the team of engineers and designers and delivering the engineering requirements of the project
Support on tender or proposal, as per client standards, international codes, and project scope of work

1005999,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1005999,Project Engineer,ABB,,,,,"Project Engineer

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. Write the next chapter of your ABB story.
This position reports to
Sales Manager
Your role and responsibilities

In this role, you will have the opportunity to support customers by providing technical assistance and specialist support. You will also showcase your expertise by supporting the sales office in identifying the best technical proposals and establishing collaborative relationships with customers. Updating knowledge of B&R products and their applications, also promoting the transfer of the same knowledge within the technical office. • Independently providing technical assistance over the phone or on-site, solving product and application issues. • Organizing and preparing technical activities strategically to solve a wide variety of problems and applications. • Collaborating constantly with HQ regarding the escalation of technical issues and the implementation and transfer of innovative processes and methodologies to customers. • Assisting in the delivery of internal and external technical and professional training activities.
Qualifications for the role
Degree in Automation Engineering or Mechatronics or equivalent experience.
Possess an enhanced interest in automation, programming, digitalization, and innovation.

You are skilled in structured programming, with knowledge of IEC 61131 languages or C. You are familiar with industrial automation products, such as PLCs, motion control systems, and SCADA. You possess basic knowledge of electronics, mechanics, mathematics, and control theory. Knowledge of object-oriented programming is also appreciated.
Knowledge of major simulation and modeling tools (Matlab Simulink, MapleSim) and familiarity with theoretical and practical concepts of artificial vision are also appreciated.
You are at ease communicating in Italian and English languages, both written and spoken.
You have willingness to work in a team and have a strong inclination for continuous training and improvement
You are available to travel within the assigned area, as well as occasionally throughout Italy and abroad for short trips.
What's in it for you?
Bring your knowledge and expertise, make the difference in technology
Help customers in driving efficiency and sustainability, making a strong impact
Work in a company with a strong technology legacy and deeply rooted in local communities

Today, B&R is a leading global solution provider for automating machines and factories and is responsible for machine automation in ABB's Robotics & Discrete Automation division. 1005835,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1005835,PACO Engineer,Shell,,,,,"Where you fit in

Technical Asset Operations (TAO)team aims to develop central, competitive capabilities delivering end-to-end value through the AMS work processes as an integral part of our Downstream Manufacturing (DS-M), Integrated Gas & New Energies (IGNE) and Upstream (UP) asset teams. We support the business worldwide and often do so together with the deep capability of our Project & Technology (P&T), Information Technology (IT) and Finance & Data Operations (FO-Data) partners. You are going to play a vital role in the delivery of continued efficiency and effectiveness improvement by bringing cross-business learning on key processes.
Specific activities can include (but not limited to):
Perform engineering activities for the assigned Production Asset, covering all aspects of base layer control strategies HMI design and compressor control, and alarm management.

Carry out Proactive Technical Monitoring activities to identify unit performance improvement opportunities and reliability risks, and work with area team to determine and implement cost effective solutions.
alerts pass to site CSE and Inspector for further action.
review of unit control valve performance to aid in development of T/A control valve scope.
Participates in ESP Alarm Review Meetings with technical and operation resources to deliver lower alarm rates.
Alarm Configuration, Alarm Review Team, Alarm Metrics, Alarm rationalization, Revalidations and using ACM/UTL for PTM monitoring.
Author plant changes (MOC) within the Process Control discipline and provide Process Control design support of plant changes by other disciplines and departments.
Support or lead failure analysis and causal investigation of Base Layer control failures or incidents. Own, lead and resolve MTO threats with root cause solutions.

Network with other sites TAO personnel to maintain a high quality of work and proactively seek best practices and new technology opportunities (i.e., Wireless technology, Procedural Automation, MDPro).
Provide Control Systems Day-to-Day support for their designated Operating Area.
Troubleshoot problems with control and information systems (hardware and software).
Responsible for MDPro configuration changes for both R&M and Projects.
Monitor base layer controller performance. Identify problem loops and take steps to address.
Maintain the safety instrumented systems in their designated area.
Collaborate with instrument and maintenance specialists in developing, submitting, and providing data to support scope items in the turnaround worklist for assigned production areas.

Provide Asset Availability and Reliability: Safety Instrumented Systems (SIS), Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM), Ensure Safe Production (ESP), Turnarounds (TA), Mitigate Threats to Availability (MTA).
Skills and Requirements
Chemical Engineering/Instrumentation Degree preferred but will consider other applicable engineering degrees and experience.
4+ years of experience in the Oil & Gas industry (operating refinery or petrochemicals plants preferred) in any of the following fields
Extensive experience in Base Layer and Process Control

Process engineering/Process Control: Alarm management, different types of controller's operation philosophies and their performance monitoring, logic modifications in DCS, graphic design and System support in Process control space
Excellent analytical, oral, and written communication skills

he Process Control Systems Engineer has a functional working knowledge of Safety Instrumented Systems, control systems applications/hardware, process operation, operational goals, ESP alarm variables, process constraints, key quality specifications for feeds and products, impact on the environment, and major economic variables and how they impact site goals
Company Description

Shell Business Operations (SBO) is a chain of operational centers that form an integral part of Royal Dutch Shell. We influence business development for Shell globally, enabling the work of 93,000 employees in over 70 countries across the world.
An Innovative Place to Work

There's never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.

Our business has been built on a foundation of innovative technology and skilled employees. By providing energy to sustain people's lives for more than a hundred years, Shell has become one of the world's leading companies.
Join us and you'll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future. At Shell, everyone does their part.
An Inclusive & Progressive Place to Work

To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we're nurturing an inclusive environment - one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.

We're creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we'll take it from there.
We're closing the gender gap - whether that's through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.
We're striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.
A Rewarding Place to Work
Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.

We're huge advocates for career development. We'll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:59:23,,
1005839,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1005839,Process Safety Engineer,Shell,,,,,"About the Opportunity:
Shell Canada is seeking a Process Safety Engineer (PSE) to join their Shell Scotford Refinery team.

As a Process Safety Engineer, you will report to the Reliability and Process Safety Manager. This crucial role involves applying technical expertise to evaluate potential process safety risks and prevent adverse impacts and incidents. This team member collaborates closely with other engineering disciplines to enhance equipment availability, prevent containment losses, reduce operational disruptions and shutdowns, and manage costs effectively.

Shell Scotford currently operates under a Hybrid work model, where some flexibility to work from home is available. Please note, however, that this is a hands-on role so a minimum of 3 days/week on site is required.
Accountabilities:
Provide long term and ad-hoc support on process safety issues and incidents, identify potential hazards and prevent loss of process containment
Provide expertise in equipment safeguarding, pumps, tanks, pressure vessels
Perform equipment overpressure relief calculations, relief scenario development, PRV/PVSV selection and working knowledge of design of flare systems.
Support and assure the Site risk management program and site Management of Change program (MOC)
Safeguarding of operations, maintenance, troubleshooting, root cause analysis, process optimization and implementation of changes to ensure integrity and improve reliability
Facilitate PHAs (Process hazard Analysis), Bowties, HEMP (Hazard & Effect Management Process), LOPA (Layer of Protection Analysis) analysis, and other risk studies
Facilitate Hazard Identification and provide technical assurance as part of the MOC process
Ensure proper completion of PHA, Process Safety, and HAZOP (Hazard and Operability Analysis) action items are done in a timely manner
Develop and manage Line of defense process safety assurance programs, conduct health checks and process effectiveness reviews
Act as subject matter expert for process safety metrics, monitor process safety metrics and provide analysis to identify gaps to potential
Ensures process safety information such as safeguarding manuals are up to date. Apply RAM to Evaluate Potential Risks from Release of a Hazard to support incident reporting
Provide technical guidance for specialty procedures for activities such as decontamination, O2 freeing, cool downs/warmups, dry outs catalyst and furnace decoke
Identify and model fire and explosion hazards using computer programs such as Fire Release Explosion and Dispersion (FRED) models
Review Turnarounds and Major Maintenance scope and participates in review and challenge processes
Provide Process Safety, Hazard recognition, and barrier thinking trainings to the operating staff to improve process safety competency and culture
column2: craft training materials such as operating manuals or process overviews

column1: Manage process safety assurance to validate effective process safety systems are being implemented and maintained across all production units
Estimation of leak amounts from Loss of Primary Containment (LOPCs)
Provide assurance and guidance on Statement of Fitness-Pre-start-up Safety (SoF-PSSRs) for plant changes, major maintenance, turnarounds, and projects
Requirements:
Must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer
Bachelor's degree in Chemical, Mechanical Engineering, or any related engineering discipline
APEGA registered with Professional Engineering designation
Minimum of 6 years' experience in Oil and Gas industry is desirable
Deep understanding of Relief System and sizing is required
Knowledge of relevant codes and standards, including API 520/521, API 537, API 754, ASME Sec VIII
Familiarity with process simulation software - Unisym, Hysis, and Flarenet
Familiarity with dispersion modeling software such as FRED or PHAST
Familiarity with HAZOP and risk management tools such as Sphera and PHAPro
Strong facilitation skillset and able to manage multiple activities

If you don't see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed in the posting above, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. Research has shown that women from under-represented groups often only apply when they feel 100% qualified. Shell is a global group of energy and petrochemical companies with about 84,000 employees across more than 70 countries. We aim to meet the world's growing need for more and cleaner energy solutions in ways that are economically, environmentally and socially responsible.

We have expertise in among other exploration, production, refining and marketing of oil and natural gas, and the manufacturing and marketing of oil products, chemicals, electric power, renewables and energy solutions.

As a global energy company operating in a challenging world, we set high standards of performance and ethical behaviors. We are judged by how we act and how we live up to our core values of honesty, integrity and respect for people. Our Business Principles are based on these. They promote trust, openness, teamwork and professionalism, as well as pride in what we do and how we conduct business.

Building on our core values, we aspire to sustain a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone feels respected and valued, from our employees to our customers and partners. A diverse workforce and an inclusive work environment are vital to our success, leading to greater innovation and better energy solutions.
An innovative place to work

There's never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.

Join us and you'll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future - whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.
An inclusive place to work

To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we're nurturing an inclusive environment - one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential.

We're creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we'll take it from there.

We're striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.

A rewarding place to work
Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.

We're huge advocates for career development. We'll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:59:28,,
1005820,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1005820,Lead Rotating Engineer,,,,,,"Job Type: Contract

Promote proven engineering solutions for safety, operation, and maintenance of installations.

Review FEED contractor documents and approve deliverables in a timely manner.
Identify and monitor interfaces with other package developments that may impact the discipline.

Update and maintain engineering documentation and drawings.
Analyse system performance and provide energy-saving solutions.

Regularly interact with other professionals involved in capital planning and economic analysis.

Optional experience in rotating and mechanical discipline for gas facilities, FEED studies, EPC phases, value engineering, LLI definitions, CFT, technical reviews, HAZID, workshops, ad hoc meetings, industry standards, best practices, deviation requests, engineering documentation, drawings, system performance analysis, energy-saving solutions, upgrade recommendations, feasibility/profitability studies.

1005576,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/production-jobs/1005576,Lead Manufacturing Test Engineer - New Product Introduction,GE Renewable Energy Power and Aviation,,,,,"Job Description Summary
Job Description
About GE Aerospace

Are you ready to see your future take flight? At GE Aerospace, we are advancing aviation technologies for today and tomorrow. Your work will contribute to the production of advanced jet engines, components, and integrated systems that power commercial and military aircraft. You'll be part of a team that embraces your drive, your curiosity, and your unique ideas and perspectives. Most importantly, you'll share in our pride and purpose that affects the lives of millions around the world!
Working at our Grand Rapids Facility

For more than 15 years our manufacturing facilities in Grand Rapids have helped fuel the growth and success of GE Aerospace. We're producing high quality electronics and avionics parts and equipment to exacting standards. Including Avionics Computing Systems, Mission System, Navigation and Guidance and Vehicle Health & Data Management products. We're the career home for union and non-union employees who seek purpose and challenge in their careers. People just like you.
Role Overview

The Lead Manufacturing Test Engineer - New Product Introduction will be responsible for the development, implementation, and optimization of testing processes for new products, ensuring they meet our stringent safety, quality, delivery, and cost objectives. This role requires a strong background in test engineering, project management, and a deep understanding of lean manufacturing principles.
Roles and Responsibilities
Manage, define, and control production process including tooling and equipment.
Validate design specifications and shop floor application of new product, tools, and equipment.
Develop, maintain, and enhance production processes to ensure safe and cost-effective assembly, test, and inspection of avionics products.
Assess, design, and validate tool and equipment needs to facilitate safe, timely, and cost-effective production.
Coordinate design, procurement, and implementation of tooling and support equipment, executing to established budgets and timelines.
Collaborate with design engineering, quality, supply chain, and production teams to ensure testability and optimize product designs.
Provide technical support and/or training to production personnel to ensure successful product launches.
Read, understand, and interpret engineering drawings and specifications.

1005569,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1005569,Aerospace Engine Controls Logic Development Lead Engineer,GE Renewable Energy Power and Aviation,,,,,"Job Description Summary
Have you ever wondered what makes a turbofan engine so cool? Some people think it's the fan, or the high- or low-pressure turbines, or the combustor, or even the augmentor (on military engines).

On my team we think it's the logic and resultant software that stitch all those subsystems together to form a cohesive operating machine - one that can readily respond to pilot inputs while still providing safe and fuel-efficient thrust to complete the mission. This logic also provides diagnostic and prognostic capabilities to better support our customers' fleet needs.
In this role we design, develop, validate and certify new engine control algorithm and strategies to deliver innovative products for exciting Military applications
column2: we also support legacy, fielded product needs -- investigating field events and evaluating potential solutions to provide more robust, reliable engine operation.

column1: If you have a passion for delivering integrated hardware and software solutions I'd encourage you to come check out some of the really interesting projects that we are delivering.

- Prepare and present technical data to internal and external customers.

- Work with teams to address organizational initiatives.

- Assure proper documentation of technical data generated for the assigned projects and/or tasks consistent with engineering policies and procedures.
- Track project progress and report out on resource needs, spend, and progress towards deliverables.
- Mentor other engineers in Controls Systems and Transient Design disciplines

Passion to deliver technical solutions in support of innovative business needs

1005421,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1005421,Test Engineer Supervisor,ABB,,,,,"Test Engineer Supervisor

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. Write the next chapter of your ABB story.
This position reports to
Production Engineering Manager
Your role and responsibilities

In this role, you will be responsible for the overall management of the testing equipment and the team who are tasked with maintaining and calibrating the test equipment. You will also be responsible for internal and external testing of electrical distribution products. Testing will be focused on instrumentation transformers, cut-out fuses and switches and testing will be for both low voltage and medium voltage products. The work model for the role is: onsite (#Li-Onsite) This role is contributing to the Electrification Distribution Solutions division in Pinetops. You will be mainly accountable for: • Determining offered solutions and product versions, including the extent of standard and non-standard solution scope to meet customer requirements. • Working independently using solid competency in technologies, tools, and methods to solve critical issues. • Supporting technical reviews and participating in core technical meetings. • Coordinating technical support for the resolution of technical issues. • Ensure compliance with IEEE C37.20.1, C37.60 and C37.61, C37.09, IEC 62271-100 and IEC 62271-111 standards as well as ISO 17025
Qualifications for the role
4-year degree in electrical engineering with 3 years of relevant experience preferred or 4-year degree with 10-year relevant experience.
Experienced in planning and executing projects.
Experience in dealing with the cultural diversity of a global business environment.
Candidates must already have a work authorization that would permit them to work for ABB in the US.
More about us

ABB's Distribution Solutions Division facilitates the efficient and reliable distribution, protection and control of power by improving electric power quality while strengthening the resilience of the grid. The Division offers segment-specific products and solutions that largely serve utilities, industry and infrastructure segments, often providing the requisite medium voltage link between high-voltage transmission systems and low-voltage users. With ABB Ability™ enabled connected solutions at its core, the offering includes medium-voltage air- and gas-insulated switchgear (1 to 66 kilovolts), indoor and outdoor circuit breakers, reclosers, fuses, contactors, relays, instrument transformers, sensors, motor control centers, as well as low-voltage switchgear for the ANSI standard markets. We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action at ABB ABB is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizen status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, family medical leave status, or protected veterans status. 1005333,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1005333,Engineering Manager,,,,,,"What are you going to do
Brunel is currently searching for an Engineering Manager for a long-term contract opportunity on a 4x1 rotation in New Orleans, LA.

The primary purpose of this position is to provide engineering management in the planning, design and execution of capital projects. You would be responsible for the design scope, engineering schedule and budget. In addition, you will manage the planning, resourcing and scheduling of all engineering related activities and provide leadership and integrates the engineering disciplines into one team. Responsible to deliver all engineering deliverables to achieve the project objectives (scope and quality) within the specified timeframe and budget.
Duties:* Ensures input to scope definition for the appropriate Stage Gate are firm and meet company requirements before commencing work.

* Approve the Engineering Execution Plans (EEP) and contribute to the Project Execution Plans (PEP). Ensure scope of work is developed and effective change management system is in place to manage scope changes.* Review the engineering budgets to meet the scope and execution plan for the project. Review the Engineering Work Packages (EWPs) for all deliverable and time-based functions.

* Review the engineering schedule and overall project schedule to ensure it meets project requirements and guides overall project scheduled development. Review the engineering manpower plan to meet the engineering schedule.* Coordinate with Procurement, Construction, Commissioning, Operations and other Corporate functional groups early in the design effort to obtain their input and conduct any necessary reviews.

* Regularly review and appraise the structure of engineering project team in terms of its ability to meet short and long-term objectives and recommend appropriate changes. Ensure that Engineering Systems and 3D intelligent design environment is properly setup and being used. Direct and review the engineering activities to ensure that work quality is satisfactory and meets company objectives. Raise safety awareness and ensure the corporate design for safely principles are applied to the project.* Ensure engineering risk assessments and HAZOPs are carried out and all identified issues are addressed. Arrange and facilitate design reviews, key engineering review milestones and participate as required in engineering, management and construction reviews. Coordinate quality audit verifications to ensure compliance with all relevant engineering standards and internal procedures for all design activities. Recommend and execute corrective actions as required.

* Identify and/or develop options for value optimization through application of best practices, considering synergies across the full project scope and all project disciplines. Provide discipline engineering and project engineers with guidance on scope, design criteria, tenders, safety as well as environmental and legal documents as required.* Ensure compliance with company technical standards throughout project development and execution phases. Contribute to the development of an integrated engineering management methodology across all studies and execution projects, including commissioning and start up.

* Ensures the flow of valuable and analyzed information and reporting to the Corporate Management Team as it relates to Contracts management plans, status and results.* Develop and maintain Project Engineering Management framework to facilitate world class delivery of capital projects.
Scope:

* Works on large-scale project or oversee multiple projects with complex contractual related issues and implements solutions mostly through the analysis of the situation and determination of strategy and delegation to others in the project team.* Often collaborates with managers and/or functional or site leaders and has some interaction with external colleagues. It also requires direct interaction with contractors' representative and other external agents.

* Works under limited supervision and has significant latitude to set objectives, priorities and timelines that may impact a group or functional area within the company.* Prepares budget for review by others by pulling all components together and making recommendations.
* Manages other managers, supervisors and mid-level professional individual contributors.
Requirements:* Bachelor's degree in Engineering discipline AND 10 years' experience in engineering field, OR
* Master's degree in Engineering discipline AND 8 years of experience in engineering field.* Experience managing design engineering teams working on large scale projects for the mining industry.

* Experience leading teams of engineers both as the owner as well as on the EPC side.* An extensive technical knowledge of engineering systems, design, applications of engineering processes and materials, and engineering applications of current engineering technologies.
* General knowledge of industry, regulatory standards and design criteria in engineering disciplines.* Ability to plan, coordinate and organize at an advanced level.
* Comprehensive knowledge of project planning, controls and understanding of multi-discipline interdependencies.* Knowledge of drawing production and document control methodologies.
* Knowledge of progress assessment and measurement and engineering control strategies.* An extensive knowledge of administrative practices and strong communication skills across all levels.

* Ability to manage relationships with key stakeholders involved in the project.* A high degree of understanding of how engineering interacts with procurement and contracting, construction and commissioning disciplines throughout the project lifecycle.

* Ability to lead, motivate and inspire others, transfer expertise, and provide a coaching role to others in terms of best practice.* Ability to handle complex problem-solving tasks, applying appropriate analysis and consideration of high-level technical detail.

Brunel is an EEO Employer:We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for all positions without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Brunel participates in the E-Verify Employment Verification Program.
Essential skills and knowledge
* MUST be eligible to work for any employer in the U.S. without the need for sponsorship.",,,,,2024-12-01 16:00:32,,

column1: Notes to Applicants

Austin Energy's Distributed Energy Resource ( DER ) Integration program is responsible for integrating and strategically implementing innovative DER technologies within the utility's distribution system. As a DER Integration Engineer, you'll engage with cutting-edge technologies, including micro-grids, standalone solar and energy storage, residential and commercial solar-plus-storage, Distributed Energy Resource Management Systems ( DERMS ), DER system protection, and other DERs, including non-inverter-based generation.

This position is ideal for engineers eager to tackle real-world challenges, grow within a collaborative team, and contribute to transformative energy solutions. Join Austin Energy in leading the transformation of its distribution system through innovation and teamwork.

Working with Austin Energy provides a number of health and welfare benefits such as low-cost medical, dental, vision, paid leave time, a highly competitive retirement plan, career development opportunities and more. Please click HERE for more information.
EMPLOYMENT APPLICATION :
The City of Austin employment application is an official document
column2: incomplete applications will not be considered.

column1: Please be sure to detail on the application ALL current and previous employment that you wish to be considered as part of your qualifications.
The Employment Record should be complete with job titles, employment dates, job duties, functions, and responsibilities for each position held.
Starting salary will be based on overall relevant experience from your application.
Resumés will not be accepted and statements such as ""see resumé"" will not be accepted. You may use ""N/A"" for fields that are not applicable.
Please note that Austin Energy may close the job posting at any time after seven (7) days from the date of the initial advertisement.
Once the job posting has closed, applications cannot be changed.
FAIR LABOR STANDARDS ACT :
This position is classified as EXEMPT (Salaried). Exempt employees are not eligible for overtime compensation.
IF YOU ARE SELECTED AS A TOP CANDIDATE :

Verification of your education (which may include high school graduation or GED , undergraduate and/or graduate degrees) will be required. You must provide proof of education from an accredited organization/institution.
If you are identified as a top candidate and are in the military or a veteran, you will need to provide a copy of your DD-214 prior to confirming a start date.
This position requires a criminal background investigation ( CBI ).
WORK SCHEDULE :

This position has been designated as a Critical Employee position. Critical Employees are considered necessary and vital and supports activities that impact City or department operations. This work can be done while at a designated work site or while working at an alternate work location. Critical employees who are able to work at an alternative work location are required to do so. Schedules may be modified, and employees may be reassigned to another area during extraordinary situations or emergency conditions to provide essential services.
TRAVEL :

If you are selected for this position, and meet the Driver Safety Standards in the City of Austin Driver Safety Program, you may drive when necessary to multiple locations as part of your regular job duties. Otherwise, you are responsible for getting to and from these locations.
Preferred Qualifications
Preferred Experience:
Familiarity with Distributed Energy Resources ( DER ) and control systems
Proficiency in reviewing and interpreting circuit maps, electrical drawings, control diagrams, and charts
Collaborative team player who can work effectively in a team environment
Self-starter capable of working independently with minimal direction
Strong analytical skills and proven problem-solving abilities in both team and independent environments
Understanding of communication protocols relevant to smart grid technologies
Willingness to travel to project and/or client sites
Familiarity with data analysis, data visualization, and data management tools
Familiarity with SCADA systems, PLC programming, and communication protocols such as DNP3 or Modbus
Project management skills
Regulatory knowledge related to DER integration and grid interconnection.
Innovative thinking for developing new solutions for integrating DER into existing grid infrastructure
Technical writing skills for creating detailed technical reports and documentation
Experience working directly with clients to understand their needs and provide technical support.
Familiarity with power system simulation software
Duties, Functions and Responsibilities
Essential duties and functions, pursuant to the Americans with Disabilities Act, may include the following. Other related duties may be assigned.

Performs complex power system analyses, such as protective coordination, fault studies, load flows, service reliability, load forecasts, power quality, voltage stability, system expansion studies, and market operations.
Prepares and reviews standards, equipment specifications, design procedures, and test procedures.

Develops and prepares engineering designs, drawings, circuit maps, control diagrams, charts, databases, plans, and other documents for transmission and distribution systems, generation and substation facilities, market operation and settlement systems and SCADA / EMS .
Provides technical expertise in materials, design, welding, equipment standards, relay coordination, technology or other areas related to the utility industry.
Formulates, prepares, and implements operating and safety procedures and guidelines, and operating manuals for system facilities including substations, transmission, distribution, and generation.
Prepares necessary reports to regulatory agencies.
Assists in providing technical and financial inputs for projects in electric utility budget process.
Identifies, investigates, and analyzes engineering design problems, and develops corrective actions.
Provides technical leadership for major or complex engineering and construction projects, and works closely with field personnel to support project energization.

Assists efforts to keep up with the latest developments in the utility industry, to meet North American Electric Reliability Council ( NERC ), Federal Energy Regulatory Commission ( FERC ), Electric Reliability Council of Texas ( ERCOT ) and Texas Public Utility Commission (TX PUC ) standards and regulatory requirements.
Responsibilities- Supervision and/or Leadership Exercised:
May be responsible for the full range of supervisory activities including selection, training, evaluation, counseling, and recommendation for dismissal.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Must possess required knowledge, skills, abilities, and experience and be able to explain and demonstrate, with or without reasonable accommodations, that the essential functions of the job can be performed.
Knowledge of engineering design principles applicable to electric utility operations, such as generation, transmission, distribution and other related fields.
Knowledge of advanced mathematical techniques such as trigonometry, calculus, and coordinate geometry.
Knowledge of engineering standards, principles, methods, codes, practices, procedures, materials, and equipment used in the design, construction, and operation of the electric utility systems.
Knowledge of preparation of cost estimates and engineering and feasibility reports.
Knowledge of regulatory requirements within the local and state ordinances and laws.
Knowledge of City of Austin purchasing and contract policies and procedures.
Skill in oral and written technical and/or general communication including preparation of written reports.
Skill in negotiations and handling conflict resolution.
Ability to perform more complex engineering calculations and to analyze engineering problems.
Criminal Background Investigation This position has been approved for a Criminal Background Investigation. EEO/ADA

984247,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/984247,Senior Process Engineer,Wood PLC,,,,,"JOB DESCRIPTION
Wood is presently looking to hire a Senior Process Engineer for our Engineering team in Abu Dhabi. Below are more details about the role.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Be able to lead and supervise Process Engineering Teams in Feasibility, Conceptual Studies, Pre - FEED, FEED and EPC Projects
Undertake process design work of units as required, supervise and check works of assigned engineers on the project as appropriate
Execute process engineering activities within the budget and schedule, as well as maintaining technical integrity of the design
Ensure that detail design methods, standards and data used conform with Client's requirements and / or those issued
Be responsible for the checking or approval of basis of design, process calculations, safety related calculations to develop the robust design
Review and approve Process Flow Diagrams, P&IDs, PSFS, DPTDs, Equipment & Instrument specifications, Process Descriptions, cause, and Effect chart etc.
Review and approve dynamic simulation study, transient study, surge study, Minimum Metal Design Temperature (MDMT) study, etc.
Review and approve depressurization studies, flare load estimation and flare system design
Ensure a high standard of safety is achieved and Environmental and Quality Assurance procedures are followed
Review and approve safety related calculations and provide input to HAZOP, SIL and other safety reviews as required
Identifying new methodology of work process required for higher productivity
Contribute where necessary to review of supplier quotations and reviews of the project
Ensure that requirements of Licensor's Secrecy Agreements are known and complied within the work performed
Participate in technical meetings and handle discussions with client engineers
Identification of issues that impede project progress and reporting to Project Managers, Engineering Manager / Discipline heads
As Lead Discipline Engineer, when assigned on projects, responsible for managing the team of engineers, designers, and delivering the engineering requirements of the project
Be willing to mentor and engage in the training and development of junior engineers in the team
Assist project team in the preparation of planning package, scheduling, weekly reporting etc.
Assist as required in the preparation of pre - commissioning, commission procedures and operating Manuals
Provided assistance in Manhours estimation and scheduling for proposals
QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in chemical engineering or equivalent from an accredited university with a minimum of Ten (10+) years of relevant experience in the Offshore/Onshore Oil & Gas industry, including minimum (5) years (preferred) in GCC region.
Must have at least five (5) years of experience in similar position in a mega Oil & Gas or Petrochemical projects, managing team of Specialists, Senior Engineers and Engineers.
Proficient in Process Simulation software's such as HYSYS, Flare System Analyzer, PipeNet, Pipesim, OLGA etc. and should be a subject matter expert.
Knowledge of engineering computer programs and general business software
Experience of working in a multi - project / multi - disciplined environment and throughout all engineering and design phases of projects
Previous experience of working in the Middle East would be an advantage
ABOUT US

Wood is a global leader in consulting and engineering, helping to unlock solutions to critical challenges in energy and materials markets. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in 60 countries, employing around 35,000 people. www.woodplc.com
Diversity Statement

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.",,,,,2024-12-01 16:01:00,,

984263,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/984263,Project Engineer - Nuclear Fluid Systems,Engie,,,,,"Ready to engineer your positive impact? Then join Tractebel, part of the ENGIE Group, and our 5,600 passionate experts around the globe, driven by shaping a more sustainable world every day. It's your chance to be a part of the adventure of the century: accelerating the energy transition - while enhancing people's lives through meaningful projects. Make your contribution to carbon neutrality in markets like nuclear, renewables, power & gas, electrical grids, hydropower & dams, water resources & supply, desalination, complex & high-tech buildings, transport infrastructures, and ports & waterways.
Are you ready to make a difference? Then we look forward to meeting you!
What we offer

Tractebel is more than a place to work. It's your chance to evolve alongside top experts on impactful projects around the world. It's an environment built on team spirit, where you can reach your highest potential. Management actively supports the development of its people, and the opportunities for growth within the ENGIE Group are wide open.

We offer a competitive salary package including representation allowances, double paid holidays, meal vouchers, eco cheques, bonuses, health insurance, PC purchase plan, ENGIE stock options, and more.

Our mobility plans are customizable to your needs, including a company car, train pass, bike lease, or combinations thereof. You can also swap your company car for the flexible and tax-friendly Belgian Mobility Budget!

Flexible, hybrid arrangements enable working from home (2-3 days per week), on-site or on the go. Tractebel participates in your home office expenses, through advantageous purchase programs and generous contributions to your internet and mobile plans.
Holidays: 20 legal days + 12 compensatory leave days (for a full-time work schedule). You can also buy 5 extra days for even more relaxation.
To celebrate our successes, and just have fun, we get together for team sports, afterworks, team -building activities, our annual party, and more.
Your Mission

As Project Engineer in our Nuclear department, you will contribute to our mission by managing critical projects for our clients, ensuring technical and contractual compliance, and leading teams to success in the energy transition. You will oversee key projects such as those for EDF and Tractebel, ensuring their timely and effective completion while adhering to the highest standards of quality and safety.
Your Key Responsibilities
You manage and oversee the EDF project, including technical and intellectual modifications.
You coordinate and lead various stakeholders following **GIOP (EDF)** processes.
You ensure mastery of the project to critically assess proposed solutions in terms of planning, technical aspects, contracts, and finances.
You draft deliverables and lead project actions and planning, providing regular updates to the planning team.
You supervise and monitor subcontractors in terms of technical, planning, contractual, and financial aspects.
You organize and facilitate necessary meetings to ensure smooth project progress.
You are proactive in proposing the best strategies to achieve project success (planning, cost efficiency, sustainability, feedback, etc.).
You manage the Tractebel project, providing visibility on project goals, deliverables, and processes, including interaction with co-contractors.
We Would Love to Hear from People with
Engineering background in a technical field (e.g., Mechanical, Process, Fluid Systems) with knowledge of fluid mechanics.
Experience in technical project management, ideally within the energy or nuclear sector.
Familiarity with REP nuclear power plants is an asset.
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access).
Capable of analyzing, respecting, and challenging project schedules and reports.
Able to draft technical reports, summaries, and meeting materials.
Flexible and willing to travel occasionally to France as needed.
Who You Are
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in French.
You show strong ability to work effectively within a team.
You are proactive, methodical, and have an organized mindset.
You are able to manage stress and handle workload fluctuations.
You have a collaborative, solution-oriented attitude with a focus on teamwork.
Who we are

Our top priorities are people, ethics, safety, and sustainability. With Tractebel, you are uniquely positioned to make a positive impact on global net-zero targets. The driving force behind reaching these goals is our greatest asset: you. Our people come first, and our strength is in our diversity. Because diversity leads to fresh perspectives that drive performance and innovation! Therefore, we welcome all applicants and remain committed to an inclusive workplace.
Find out more about Tractebel, our activities and why you should join us here!
As part of the 96,000-strong ENGIE Group, your career path in pioneering low-carbon solutions around the world knows no limits. Every day is your opportunity to shape a more sustainable world.
913293,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/913293,Engineering Delivery Platform Manager (EDP) Mexico,ABB,,,,,"Engineering Delivery Platform Manager (EDP) Mexico

Manage internal customers as key accounts. • Define performance through the eyes of external customers through a seamless collaboration with the BLs/GSCs and served countries and as such build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders/internal customers. • As a key member of the Global EDP Management Team, contributes to the EDP Strategy and its execution for a world-class end-to-end order execution process in tight collaboration with peers from other factories and global functional managers. • Ensure adequate hands-on performance monitoring and reporting to steer performance. • With support from HR, constantly drive people and organization development nurturing talents, engaging, and motivating teams within a collaborative environment.

Problem-solving and decision-making abilities.

Flexible for travelling inside of Americas and occasionally overseas (Europe/Asia)
Proven and strong leadership, communication, influencing and coaching skills to develop a truly customer centric culture.
What's in it for you?
Play a part in anticipating, sensing and responding to technology trends
Join an undiscussed market leader, a strong brand that markets high quality products
Get motivated by continuous improvement in what we do and how we do it, bring your know-how.
Benefits
Paid Parental leave (gender neutral)
Life insurance
Retirement plan
Accident insurance
Wellbeing program
Dental insurance
Flex days
Employee Assistance Program (PAE)
Development platforms: Spark, Harvard Manager Mentor and English Learning EF English Live School (EF)
More about us

We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory",,,,,2024-12-01 16:01:08,,

1004990,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1004990,Senior QA/QC Engineer,,,,,,"Greetings from NES!!!
We have an opening for an Oil & Gas Operating company based in Qatar. If you are interested for the same, kindly share your updated resume.
Designation :- Senior QA/QC Engineer
Job Purpose

Ensures that the quality of engineering, design, procurement, construction, installation of new equipment and repair, modifications of onshore and offshore facilities is consistent with the Codes, Standards, Specifications and Company Policies and Procedures.
Key Job Accountabilities

1. Supervise the activities of QA/QC Inspectors, Contract hired Engineers/Inspectors and NDT Technicians to ensure compliance with procedure requirements and perform the supervisory function at the level established for the position.

2. Conduct metallurgical failure analysis on failed plant or offshore components to establish the cause of failure and recommendations. This involves preparation of the survey plan, mobilizing the Contractor, leading and supervising the activities.

3. Provide support to relevant Dept for QA/QC matters related to procurement of materials and equipment. Review purchase requisition for Inspection and certification requirements, technical bid evaluation, appointment of TPI and ensuring the inspection of material receiving at warehouse.

4. Review and approve all critical repair instructions including Welding Procedure Specification(WPS), Procedure Qualification Records (PQR) and QA/QC reports that are generated by QA/QC Inspectors and Engineers and specify alternative testing and inspection methods as applicable for repair or modification.

5. Participate and provide necessary inputs for Startup Readiness, Lessons learnt, Formal Risk Assessment (FRA), Engineering Management of Change (EMOC) and Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA) from QA/QC perspective.

6. Review and provide technical input on the Scope of Work (SOW) for Maintenance contracts related to repair and modification works, performing Technical Bid evaluations for the contracts, review and approve all Contractor documents and ensure compliance to QA/QC requirements during execution including shutdowns.

7. Carryout technical audits as requested on suppliers and contractors Quality Management Systems and provide technical evaluation and recommendation. Perform follow up for the observations and corrective actions.
8. Plan and ensure timely execution of inspection and certification of Gas Cylinders, Portable Tanks and Lifting Equipment as per QA/QC section KPI.
9. Promote quality awareness among OES-Maintenance, Supply Department and Contractors through training, knowledge sharing, and procedure roll out sessions.

10. Complete understanding of Policies and Procedures for Project and Plant QA/QC, eg: Material receiving Inspection, Control of Welding, Pressure testing and assist in revision or updating of the same including support for various other QA/QC Procedures.
Qualifications :-
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering
Professional certifications in Welding, NDT, Inspection or Auditing.
Knowledge and/or Experience :-
· 6 years’ experience in QA/QC related activities with the Oil and Gas industry.
· Proficiency in the field of design, engineering, procurement, fabrication, inspection and installation of process equipment and piping, including troubleshooting of welding and QA/QC issues.

With over 90 years' combined experience, NES Fircroft (NES) is proud to be the world's leading engineering staffing provider spanning the Oil & Gas, Power & Renewables, Chemicals, Construction & Infrastructure, Life Sciences, Mining and Manufacturing sectors worldwide. 953528,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/953528,Senior Engineer - Loss Prevention,,,,,,"Overview:

The Senior Engineer - Loss Prevention is responsible for executing design activities and preparing essential safety and reliability documents for projects. The role involves ensuring compliance with safety standards, liaising with various engineering disciplines, and overseeing the implementation of loss prevention measures under the guidance of the Lead Loss Prevention Engineer. The Senior Engineer will play a pivotal role in preparing, checking, and approving safety-related deliverables and coordinating with stakeholders to ensure project goals are met.
Key Responsibilities:
Execute design activities and prepare key safety and reliability documents.
Review interdisciplinary documents to ensure consistency and compliance.
Become fully familiar with the project's scope of work and monitor any changes, raising change notifications as necessary.
Liaise with Project Management Team (PMT) and other discipline engineers as directed by the Lead Loss Prevention Engineer.
Prepare and check the following deliverables as per project scope:
Loss prevention philosophy and safety concept.
Fire protection design basis.
Hazardous area classification schedule and layouts.
Criteria and specifications for passive fire protection (fireproofing), including schedule and layouts.
Fire and gas detection system layouts and associated design philosophy.
Layout drawings for safety equipment locations, escape routes, and safety signs.
Design basis and characterization for the firefighting protection system and related documents and layouts.
Hydraulic calculations for fire water networks and spray systems.
Supply specifications for firefighting, safety, and lifesaving equipment, including Material Requisitions (MR), Technical Bid Evaluations (TBE), and vendor documentation reviews.
Coordinate and lead safety workshops and review third-party safety studies.
Liaise with the drafting team for the development of safety and fire protection drawings.
Ensure the timely and accurate execution of all safety-related engineering tasks.
Education:
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (preferably in Mechanical, Chemical, or Fire Engineering).
Certifications / Specialization / IT Skills:
Certification in Fire Safety Engineering or Loss Prevention is a plus.
Proficiency in safety engineering software and fire water network hydraulic calculation tools.
Strong knowledge of industry standards and codes (Qatar Energy, ADNOC, SHELL, ARAMCO, etc.).
Experience:
8-10 years of experience in the Oil and Gas industry, preferably with offshore wellhead/process platform experience.
Proven experience in Loss Prevention and Fire Safety design, documentation, and project management.
Technical Knowledge:
Expertise in the preparation of fire water network P&IDs.
Familiarity with international regulations and standards, such as those from Qatar Energy, ADNOC, SHELL, and ARAMCO.

Note: Due to Visa limitations, your application will not be accepted if your nationality is Indian, Egyptian or Indonesian. Exception, if you are already a resident inside Qatar with a valid QID, transfer of sponsorship is possible!
953530,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/953530,Principal Packages Engineer,,,,,,"Overview:

Up-to-date knowledge of the latest industry technologies related to equipment and packages, as well as familiarity with rotating equipment such as pumps and compressors.

Note: Due to Visa limitations, your application will not be accepted if your nationality is Indian, Egyptian or Indonesian. Exception, if you are already a resident inside Qatar with a valid QID, transfer of sponsorship is possible!
953841,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/953841,Geotechnical Engineering Project Manager,,,,,,"Geotechnical Project Manager - Cleveland, OH

Client relations and business development activities

912490,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/912490,HVAC Engineer,ASSYSTEM,,,,,"Company Description

Job Description

Assess and address technical risks within the mechanical scope.
Maintain strong relationships with Responsible Designers and stakeholders.

Qualifications
