1004120,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1004120,HVAC Mobile Engineer,CBRE,,,,,"About the role

Operates, inspects, and maintains mechanical and electrical equipment for commercial HVAC systems in assigned facilities to achieve most efficient results. Assures that equipment is being maintained in a safe manner. Minimizes down time through proactive performance testing and scheduled maintenance.
What you'll do
Complies with all applicable codes, regulations, governmental agency and Company directives related to building operations and work safety.

Maintains, operates, and repairs HVAC systems and associated equipment, electrical distribution equipment, plumbing systems, building interior/exterior repair, and related grounds as it pertains to assigned building(s).
Inspects building HVAC and plumbing systems to ensure operation of equipment is within design capabilities and achieves environmental conditions prescribed by client.
Performs assigned repairs, emergency and preventive maintenance. Completes maintenance and repair records as required.
Responds quickly to emergency situations, summoning additional assistance as needed.
Reviews historical maintenance records to develop proactive inspection, testing and preventive maintenance schedule.
Operates company vehicle in a safe manner and follows prescribed routines to service locations in a timely manner.
Performs other duties as assigned.
What you'll need
High school diploma or general education degree (GED) plus a minimum of seven years experience as a certified refrigerant technician. Completion a formal apprenticeship program preferred.
Valid driver's license required.

Certification in two or more of the following: Electrical, mechanical, HVAC and refrigeration systems, process controls, mechanical power transmissions, painting, plumbing, carpentry or engine repair as well as CFC Certification.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles and to understand operating budgets. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.
Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

Uses personal computer and / or PDA for work order system, email, ESS and training. Basic skills with Microsoft Office Outlook. Physical requirements include stooping, standing, walking, climbing stairs / ladders and ability to lift / carry heavy loads of 50 lbs. or more.
Why CBRE?
A culture of respect, integrity, service and excellence crafts our approach to every opportunity!
We are guided by the needs of the cities we inhabit, the communities we build and the world we thrive in!
Benefits start 1st of the month: Medical, dental, vision, 401k, paid time off, holiday pay, and more!
Company Vehicle, gas card, phone, laptop, and tools
Internal advancement available after 6 month mark
40-45 hours a week
Competitive Pay
Disclaimers
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future

Equal Employment Opportunity: CBRE is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We have a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

Candidate Accommodations: CBRE values the differences of all current and prospective employees and recognizes how every employee contributes to our company's success. CBRE provides reasonable accommodations in job application procedures for individuals with disabilities. If you require assistance due to a disability in the application or recruitment process, please submit a request via email at recruitingaccommodations@cbre.com or via telephone at +1 866 225 3099 (U.S.) and +1 866 388 4346 (Canada).

NOTE: Some, but not all, of our positions may have an additional requirement to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing. If you have questions about the requirement(s) for this position, please inform your Recruiter.
CBRE GWS

CBRE Global Workplace Solutions (GWS) works with clients to make real estate a meaningful contributor to organizational productivity and performance. Our account management model is at the heart of our client-centric approach to delivering integrated real estate solutions. Each client is entrusted with a dedicated leader and is supported by regional and global resources, leveraging the industry's most robust platform. CBRE GWS delivers consistent, measurably superior outcomes for our clients at every stage of the lifecycle, and across industries and geographies.

1003834,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1003834,Sentinel Sr. Principal Nuclear Surety Systems Engineer (T4) -13819,Northrop Grumman,,,,,"RELOCATION ASSISTANCE: Relocation assistance may be available
CLEARANCE TYPE: Secret
TRAVEL: Yes, 10% of the Time
Description

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Northrop Grumman is looking for a talented system engineer to pioneer how to safely design and operate the next generation ICBM weapon system. A Nuclear Surety engineer has the opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a system designed to provide another 50 years of security for this great nation. Nuclear Surety ensures that nuclear weapons are protected against peacetime and wartime threats at all times. A Nuclear Surety Engineer at Northrop Grumman on the GBSD program will be provided the opportunity to:
Performing decomposition of Department of Defense safety manuals into requirements and allocating them to design teams for implementation
Provide systems engineering expertise to the design, integration, and testing of a next generation ICBM weapon system
Participate in technical planning, system integration, verification, validation, cost, risk, supportability, and analysis for mechanical, electrical, and integrated systems
Evaluate the physical security design based on the Department of Defense Safety manuals
Interface directly with various compartments of the Department of Defense and Department of Energy to ensure safe design and operation of nuclear weapon systems
Use model based engineering tools on a major weapon system to pioneer a new way to evaluate and analyze modern design
Learn a niche discipline that spans all aspects of Nuclear Power and Munitions
You'll Bring These Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics) discipline from an accredited university and 8 years of related experience, or 6 years with a Master's Degree in a STEM discipline
Experience with any of the following tools and languages: DOORs, Cameo, TeamCenter, GIT, JAZZ, NX, Capitol
Experience with any of the following - systems engineering, nuclear surety, electrical or software analyses/test
column2: verification of requirements

column1: Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government DoD Secret Clearance. Start date is contingent upon clearance.
Must have the ability to obtain and maintain Special Access Program (SAP) approval within a reasonable period of time, as determined by the company to meet its business need
Citizenship to the United States of America
These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:
Bachelor's degree in electrical or software engineering discipline
Active DOD Secret or Top Secret Clearance
Experience with any of the following tools and languages: DOORs, Cameo, TeamCenter, GIT, JAZZ, NX, Capitol
Position Benefits:
As a full-time employee of Northrop Grumman, you are eligible for our robust benefits package including
• Medical, Dental & Vision coverage
• Educational Assistance
• Life Insurance
• Employee Assistance Programs & Work/Life Solutions
• Paid Time Off
• Health & Wellness Resources
• Employee Discounts

This positions standard work schedule is a 9/80. The 9/80 schedule allows employees who work a nine-hour day Monday through Thursday to take every other Friday off. This role may offer a competitive relocation assistance package.
The above salary range represents a general guideline

1003816,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1003816,Senior Building Systems Energy Engineer,Whitham Group Executive Search,,,,,"Job Description
COMPANY SUMMARY

We are a highly skilled and experienced company, providing energy efficiency and sustainability solutions to commercial, industrial, institutional, multifamily, and municipal customers for over 30 years. We focus on attracting, retaining, and developing people who share our passion and commitment to improve quality of life. In return we offer our prospective employees the opportunity to transform their world and the world around them, that is through client work, as we all care about the sustainability of our planet and to shape our collective future.
POSITION SUMMARY
We are seeking a Senior Building Systems Energy Engineer/Analyst to support energy efficiency and green building projects. The individual will support and lead tasks in the following areas:
• Assist with energy audits to identify energy and cost savings measures, i.e. ASHRAE Level 1-3 energy audits
• Performing utility billing and interval data analysis, and energy benchmarking
• Conducting spreadsheet analysis and assessment of energy conservation measure (ECM) improvements
• Developing custom spreadsheet calculators and analysis tools
• Developing construction cost estimates for ECMs and determining economic paybacks.
• Commissioning and retro-commissioning of building energy systems
• LEED and green building consulting
• Communication of results from analysis verbally and customer facing written reports
• Effectively communicate with clients
• Supporting business develop activities
• Building/Developing an energy model for customer
• Energy Audits
This position will manage junior analysts and junior building engineers and will be in the Clifton Park, NY HQ 3 days a week.
Requirements
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
• The ideal candidate will have a degree in Mechanical Engineering, Energy Engineering, Energy Policy, or other related discipline.
• Certified Energy Manager (CEM), Certified Energy Auditor (CEA) or Building Energy Analysis Professional (BEAP) certifications are a plus.
Benefits
Compensation: (negoatiable) Base, Bonus and profit sharing. Full health benefits.",,,,,2024-12-01 16:10:08,,

1003812,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1003812,Power Systems Electrical Engineer,"Electrical Consultants, Inc.",,,,,"ECI has immediate openings for power systems engineers of all experience levels to join our Planning and Studies team. If you have experience performing planning studies for electric utilities or are currently involved with detailed study of renewable power or heavy industrial systems, we want to hear from you.

The position responsibilities include performing a variety of electrical studies that may include steady state loadflow, short circuit, transient analysis, harmonics, insulation coordination, and dynamic system response studies. We use tools such as PSS/e, PSLF, ASPEN Oneliner, PSS Cape, PSCAD, and EMTP-RV - experience in these not required - related experience in tools such as TARA, ETAP, SKM, PowerWorld, EasyPower considered applicable.

Many but not all the studies will be related to large scale (50 -2000+ MW) renewable energy projects (wind, solar, energy storage). Our team helps customers with project conceptual development, support during design, equipment selection and assistance with plant operating issues after COD. We assist with apparatus ratings and specifications development for EHV/HV/MV/LV transformers, circuit breakers, switches, cables, switchgear, inverters, wind turbines, DC and AC aux power systems, etc.

We also provide services to large and small utility and industrial clients. These studies can involve typical transmission level load additions, long range plans, generation interconnections, black start analysis, voltage unbalance/line transposition analysis, breaker TRV assessments, insulation coordination studies, etc. We have a separate distribution planning group as well.
Minimum Requirements:
BSEE (MSEE and PhD are desirable)
1+ year performing any one of the following studies:
Load flow, Short Circuit, Transient Stability/Dynamic System Response, HV/LV Ridethrough, TOV, TRV, Insulation Coordination, Harmonics, Interconnection studies.

Ability to acquire a PE license is preferred. Successful applicant must meet ECI's auto insurance carrier requirements. Successful applicant may be subject to client mandated drug and background checking. Applicants must not require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B visa status) now or in the future.
Salary commensurate with experience and education. Benefits include:
Medical, dental and vision insurance
Flexible spending account
Health savings account
Life insurance
Disability insurance
401(k), profit sharing and employee stock ownership plan
Paid vacation, personal days and holidays
Paid Parental Leave
Continued professional education reimbursement

ECI employs over 800 engineers, designers, project managers, surveyors, right-of-way agents, environmental planners, construction professionals and support staff in 20+ engineering offices across the U.S. ECI has over 35 years of experience in the planning, engineering and construction of a wide range of power delivery projects including substations, transmission lines, energy storage facilities, distribution systems, communication systems and industrial electrical facilities. Visit our website at .
An Equal Opportunity Employer",,,,,2024-12-01 16:10:12,,
1003694,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1003694,Engineering Lead Gas Cluster Emsland d/w/m,RWE,,,,,"RWE Generation SE
Start zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt, Vollzeit, unbefristet
Die Rolle

Als Engineering Lead (EL) für das Gas-Cluster Emsland im Bereich Gas Engineering and Outage (E&O) bist du für die disziplinübergreifende Koordination aller E&O - Aktivitäten an den Anlagen innerhalb dieses Clusters verantwortlich. Du stellst sicher, dass die vereinbarten Engineering- und Outage-Strategien wie vorgesehen umgesetzt werden. Die erforderlichen technischen Fachkenntnisse und Ressourcen werden von den E&O - Disziplinteams bereitgestellt.

Du wirst eng mit den Operations & Maintenance (O&M) sowie dem Asset Management Partner (AMP) und den weiteren E&O - Teams zusammenarbeiten, um die technische Leistung zu verbessern, aufkommende Probleme zu lösen und die effektive Durchführung von Projekten einschließlich Ausfällen zu unterstützen.

Du wirst eng mit anderen ELs innerhalb des gesamten RWE-Portfolios zusammenarbeiten, um ein Verständnis für die besten Praktiken bei der Aufgabenerfüllung zu erlangen und einen kontinuierlichen Verbesserungsansatz zu fördern.
E&O Ansprechperson für Asset O&M und AM.

Koordinierung des spezifischen technischen bzw. ingenieurtechnischen Scopings für Ausfälle und größere Änderungsprojekte, z. B. bei komplexen Fragen, die Expertenwissen erfordern, oder bei aufkommenden und komplexen Instandhaltungsaktivitäten, die einen bestimmten Schwellenwert überschreiten.
Vorantreibung und Durchführung kurzfristiger technischer Analysen zu aufkommenden Problemen (RCA, Risikobewertung und -management usw.).
Zusammenführung von technischen Sitzungen und Projekt- und Ausfallteams zur Überprüfung, Entwicklung und Bereitstellung von Lösungen.

Koordinierung und Zusammenstellung der detaillierten technischen Budgeterstellung und des Budgetmanagements (einschließlich Ausfallzeiten) für alle zugewiesenen technischen Aktivitäten der Anlage und Unterstützung bei der Formulierung des Geschäftsplans der Anlage.

Unterstützung bei der Planung, Durchführung und Überprüfung von Überholungen, größeren Projekten und Änderungen in Zusammenarbeit mit den Asset O&M- und AM - Teams in einer sicheren und zeitgerechten Weise.
Umsetzung und Weiterentwicklung einer übergreifenden E&O - Strategie für Anlagen in Zusammenarbeit mit O&M sowie AM.
Dein Profil
Abgeschlossenes Ingenieurstudium (z. B. Maschinenbau, Verfahrenstechnik oder Elektrotechnik) oder vergleichbar.
Erfahrung im Umgang mit technischen Fragen und Projektmanagement in allen technischen Disziplinen.
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeiten zur erfolgreichen Koordinierung multidisziplinärer Ressourcen.
Nachweis der Fähigkeit zu komplexem Denken, einschließlich analytischer und konzeptioneller Fähigkeiten.
Kooperativer Ansatz bei der Fokussierung, der Ausrichtung und dem Aufbau effektiver Beziehungen, um den Anforderungen der Aufgabe gerecht zu werden.
Bereitschaft, an 2 - 3 Tagen pro Woche an verschiedene Standorte zu reisen, in intensiven Zeiten (z. B. bei Ausfällen) auch länger.
Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.

RWE ist bestrebt, ein vielfältiges und inklusives Umfeld zu schaffen - wir schätzen deine Leidenschaft, deine Bereitschaft zu lernen und deinen Wunsch, dich zu entfalten. Auch wenn du nicht alle der oben genannten Fähigkeiten mitbringst, aber der Meinung bist, dass der Job gut zu dir passen würde, du flexible Arbeitsregelungen benötigst oder wir Anpassungen vornehmen müssen, die hier noch nicht aufgeführt sind, freuen wir uns, von dir zu hören.
Deine Benefits
Vielfältige und verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben in einem dynamischen Umfeld mit einem kompetenten Team und der Möglichkeit, wichtige berufliche Erfahrungen zu sammeln.
Zahlreiche Möglichkeiten zur persönlichen und beruflichen Weiterentwicklung.
Attraktive Vergütung und Sozialleistungen.
Eine spannende, abwechslungsreiche und herausfordernde Aufgabe in enger Zusammenarbeit mit den anderen Abteilungen des RWE - Konzerns.
Jetzt mit wenigen Klicks bewerben: Anzeigencode 88576, Bewerbungsfrist: 20.12.2024
Fragen: Kontakt HR: Jamil Chaudhry, +49 201 5179-6595
Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen. Natürlich findest du uns auch bei LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, YouTube und Xing.

Wir schätzen Vielfalt und begrüßen daher alle Bewerbungen - unabhängig von Geschlecht, Behinderung, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Alter, sexueller Orientierung und Identität. #inclusionmatters

RWE Generation ist Europas Nr. 2 im Gassektor. Unsere rund 3.000 Mitarbeitenden - darunter viele hochspezialisierte Techniker:innen und Ingenieur:innen - betreiben Kraftwerke in Deutschland, Großbritannien, den Niederlanden und der Türkei und arbeiten zielstrebig an unserer Vision für eine saubere Zukunft. Mit den bereits in Betrieb befindlichen Wasser- und Biomassekraftwerken trifft Know-how im Bereich konventioneller Energie auf die Innovationsdynamik bei den Erneuerbaren.

Wir schaffen die Brücke für den Weg in das grüne Zeitalter und fokussieren uns dabei auf Wasserstoff, Biomasse und Batteriespeicher. Mit der Umrüstung unserer Kraftwerksflotte auf klimaneutrale Energieträger wie Wasserstoff und Biomasse und der erfolgreichen Entwicklung neuer Speichertechnologien leistet RWE Generation einen wichtigen Beitrag bei der Erreichung unserer ehrgeizigen Ziele. Überzeug dich selbst: Wir fordern uns immer wieder aufs Neue heraus. In einem Team, dessen Grundlage Vertrauen und Respekt sind.",,,,,2024-12-01 16:10:15,,

1003645,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1003645,Gas Engineer,Sureserve,,,,,"The Sureserve Group of businesses provides market-leading compliance and energy services across the UK, with over 3,200 employees working from over 20 offices.

Sureserve Compliance South, part of the Sureserve Group, delivers heating services within the social housing sector across London & the South East. We support our clients across domestic gas, commercial gas, renewables, and electrical services. We are London's largest, most successful gas contractor, focusing on long-term contracts with our clients to offer our staff job security and progression opportunities.
Role
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Gas Engineer to join our growing team, the successful candidate will be responsible for:
Carrying out day-to-day repairs
Fault finding
Completing annual servicing visits
Meeting first-time fix targets
Maintaining high-quality standards
Focusing on customer satisfaction
Attending jobs on time, notifying the contact centre/customer of any delays
The successful candidate will have
Valid ACS & other relevant gas qualifications
Full UK Driving Licence (less than 6 points)
Experience within Social Housing desirable, but not essential
Experience delivering high levels of customer service
The ability to work with a diverse customer base
What we can offer you
Additional earnings via ECO
Overtime opportunities
Salary exchange pension
Employee assistance programme
28 days annual leave including bank holidays, rising by one day with each full year of service (max five additional)
Enhanced family leave (dependent on length of service)

Sureserve is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We celebrate individual differences and believe that they contribute to our collective success. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

As part of our commitment to Inclusivity, we offer reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process for individuals who may require them. If you feel you need any adjustments, please speak to your recruiter.
Successful applicants will be subject to eligibility checks including the right to work in the UK and DBS checks.
Business Swale Heating Locations Canterbury area Yearly salary £28,000 - £50,000 Employment type Full-time",,,,,2024-12-01 16:10:19,,

We use tools such as PSS/e, PSLF, ASPEN Oneliner, PSS Cape, PSCAD, and EMTP-RV - experience in these not required - related experience in tools such as TARA, ETAP, SKM, PowerWorld, EasyPower considered applicable.

Many but not all the studies will be related to large scale (50 -2000+ MW) renewable energy projects (wind, solar, energy storage). Our team helps customers with project conceptual development, support during design, equipment selection and assistance with plant operating issues after COD. We assist with apparatus ratings and specifications development for EHV/HV/MV/LV transformers, circuit breakers, switches, cables, switchgear, inverters, wind turbines, DC and AC aux power systems, etc.

We also provide services to large and small utility and industrial clients. These studies can involve typical transmission level load additions, long range plans, generation interconnections, black start analysis, voltage unbalance/line transposition analysis, breaker TRV assessments, insulation coordination studies, etc. We have a separate distribution planning group as well.
Minimum Requirements:
BSEE (MSEE and PhD are desirable)
1+ year performing any one of the following studies:
Load flow, Short Circuit, Transient Stability/Dynamic System Response, HV/LV Ridethrough, TOV, TRV, Insulation Coordination, Harmonics, Interconnection studies.

Ability to acquire a PE license is preferred. Successful applicant must meet ECI's auto insurance carrier requirements. Successful applicant may be subject to client mandated drug and background checking. Applicants must not require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B visa status) now or in the future.
Salary commensurate with experience and education. Benefits include:
Medical, dental and vision insurance
Flexible spending account
Health savings account
Life insurance
Disability insurance
401(k), profit sharing and employee stock ownership plan
Paid vacation, personal days and holidays
Paid Parental Leave
Continued professional education reimbursement

ECI employs over 800 engineers, designers, project managers, surveyors, right-of-way agents, environmental planners, construction professionals and support staff in 20+ engineering offices across the U.S. ECI has over 35 years of experience in the planning, engineering and construction of a wide range of power delivery projects including substations, transmission lines, energy storage facilities, distribution systems, communication systems and industrial electrical facilities. Visit our website at .
An Equal Opportunity Employer",,,,,2024-12-01 16:10:44,,
1003694,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1003694,Engineering Lead Gas Cluster Emsland d/w/m,RWE,,,,,"RWE Generation SE
Start zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt, Vollzeit, unbefristet
Die Rolle

Als Engineering Lead (EL) für das Gas-Cluster Emsland im Bereich Gas Engineering and Outage (E&O) bist du für die disziplinübergreifende Koordination aller E&O - Aktivitäten an den Anlagen innerhalb dieses Clusters verantwortlich. Du stellst sicher, dass die vereinbarten Engineering- und Outage-Strategien wie vorgesehen umgesetzt werden. Die erforderlichen technischen Fachkenntnisse und Ressourcen werden von den E&O - Disziplinteams bereitgestellt.

Du wirst eng mit den Operations & Maintenance (O&M) sowie dem Asset Management Partner (AMP) und den weiteren E&O - Teams zusammenarbeiten, um die technische Leistung zu verbessern, aufkommende Probleme zu lösen und die effektive Durchführung von Projekten einschließlich Ausfällen zu unterstützen.

Du wirst eng mit anderen ELs innerhalb des gesamten RWE-Portfolios zusammenarbeiten, um ein Verständnis für die besten Praktiken bei der Aufgabenerfüllung zu erlangen und einen kontinuierlichen Verbesserungsansatz zu fördern.
E&O Ansprechperson für Asset O&M und AM.

Koordinierung des spezifischen technischen bzw. ingenieurtechnischen Scopings für Ausfälle und größere Änderungsprojekte, z. B. bei komplexen Fragen, die Expertenwissen erfordern, oder bei aufkommenden und komplexen Instandhaltungsaktivitäten, die einen bestimmten Schwellenwert überschreiten.
Vorantreibung und Durchführung kurzfristiger technischer Analysen zu aufkommenden Problemen (RCA, Risikobewertung und -management usw.).
Zusammenführung von technischen Sitzungen und Projekt- und Ausfallteams zur Überprüfung, Entwicklung und Bereitstellung von Lösungen.

Koordinierung und Zusammenstellung der detaillierten technischen Budgeterstellung und des Budgetmanagements (einschließlich Ausfallzeiten) für alle zugewiesenen technischen Aktivitäten der Anlage und Unterstützung bei der Formulierung des Geschäftsplans der Anlage.

Unterstützung bei der Planung, Durchführung und Überprüfung von Überholungen, größeren Projekten und Änderungen in Zusammenarbeit mit den Asset O&M- und AM - Teams in einer sicheren und zeitgerechten Weise.
Umsetzung und Weiterentwicklung einer übergreifenden E&O - Strategie für Anlagen in Zusammenarbeit mit O&M sowie AM.
Dein Profil
Abgeschlossenes Ingenieurstudium (z. B. Maschinenbau, Verfahrenstechnik oder Elektrotechnik) oder vergleichbar.
Erfahrung im Umgang mit technischen Fragen und Projektmanagement in allen technischen Disziplinen.
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeiten zur erfolgreichen Koordinierung multidisziplinärer Ressourcen.
Nachweis der Fähigkeit zu komplexem Denken, einschließlich analytischer und konzeptioneller Fähigkeiten.
Kooperativer Ansatz bei der Fokussierung, der Ausrichtung und dem Aufbau effektiver Beziehungen, um den Anforderungen der Aufgabe gerecht zu werden.
Bereitschaft, an 2 - 3 Tagen pro Woche an verschiedene Standorte zu reisen, in intensiven Zeiten (z. B. bei Ausfällen) auch länger.
Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.

RWE ist bestrebt, ein vielfältiges und inklusives Umfeld zu schaffen - wir schätzen deine Leidenschaft, deine Bereitschaft zu lernen und deinen Wunsch, dich zu entfalten. Auch wenn du nicht alle der oben genannten Fähigkeiten mitbringst, aber der Meinung bist, dass der Job gut zu dir passen würde, du flexible Arbeitsregelungen benötigst oder wir Anpassungen vornehmen müssen, die hier noch nicht aufgeführt sind, freuen wir uns, von dir zu hören.
Deine Benefits
Vielfältige und verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben in einem dynamischen Umfeld mit einem kompetenten Team und der Möglichkeit, wichtige berufliche Erfahrungen zu sammeln.
Zahlreiche Möglichkeiten zur persönlichen und beruflichen Weiterentwicklung.
Attraktive Vergütung und Sozialleistungen.
Eine spannende, abwechslungsreiche und herausfordernde Aufgabe in enger Zusammenarbeit mit den anderen Abteilungen des RWE - Konzerns.
Jetzt mit wenigen Klicks bewerben: Anzeigencode 88576, Bewerbungsfrist: 20.12.2024
Fragen: Kontakt HR: Jamil Chaudhry, +49 201 5179-6595
Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen. Natürlich findest du uns auch bei LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, YouTube und Xing.

Wir schätzen Vielfalt und begrüßen daher alle Bewerbungen - unabhängig von Geschlecht, Behinderung, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Alter, sexueller Orientierung und Identität. #inclusionmatters

RWE Generation ist Europas Nr. 2 im Gassektor. Unsere rund 3.000 Mitarbeitenden - darunter viele hochspezialisierte Techniker:innen und Ingenieur:innen - betreiben Kraftwerke in Deutschland, Großbritannien, den Niederlanden und der Türkei und arbeiten zielstrebig an unserer Vision für eine saubere Zukunft. Mit den bereits in Betrieb befindlichen Wasser- und Biomassekraftwerken trifft Know-how im Bereich konventioneller Energie auf die Innovationsdynamik bei den Erneuerbaren.

Wir schaffen die Brücke für den Weg in das grüne Zeitalter und fokussieren uns dabei auf Wasserstoff, Biomasse und Batteriespeicher. Mit der Umrüstung unserer Kraftwerksflotte auf klimaneutrale Energieträger wie Wasserstoff und Biomasse und der erfolgreichen Entwicklung neuer Speichertechnologien leistet RWE Generation einen wichtigen Beitrag bei der Erreichung unserer ehrgeizigen Ziele. Überzeug dich selbst: Wir fordern uns immer wieder aufs Neue heraus. In einem Team, dessen Grundlage Vertrauen und Respekt sind.",,,,,2024-12-01 16:10:47,,

1003645,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1003645,Gas Engineer,Sureserve,,,,,"The Sureserve Group of businesses provides market-leading compliance and energy services across the UK, with over 3,200 employees working from over 20 offices.

Sureserve Compliance South, part of the Sureserve Group, delivers heating services within the social housing sector across London & the South East. We support our clients across domestic gas, commercial gas, renewables, and electrical services. We are London's largest, most successful gas contractor, focusing on long-term contracts with our clients to offer our staff job security and progression opportunities.
Role
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Gas Engineer to join our growing team, the successful candidate will be responsible for:
Carrying out day-to-day repairs
Fault finding
Completing annual servicing visits
Meeting first-time fix targets
Maintaining high-quality standards
Focusing on customer satisfaction
Attending jobs on time, notifying the contact centre/customer of any delays
The successful candidate will have
Valid ACS & other relevant gas qualifications
Full UK Driving Licence (less than 6 points)
Experience within Social Housing desirable, but not essential
Experience delivering high levels of customer service
The ability to work with a diverse customer base
What we can offer you
Additional earnings via ECO
Overtime opportunities
Salary exchange pension
Employee assistance programme
28 days annual leave including bank holidays, rising by one day with each full year of service (max five additional)
Enhanced family leave (dependent on length of service)

Sureserve is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We celebrate individual differences and believe that they contribute to our collective success. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

As part of our commitment to Inclusivity, we offer reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process for individuals who may require them. If you feel you need any adjustments, please speak to your recruiter.
Successful applicants will be subject to eligibility checks including the right to work in the UK and DBS checks.
Business Swale Heating Locations Canterbury area Yearly salary £28,000 - £50,000 Employment type Full-time",,,,,2024-12-01 16:10:52,,

1003562,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1003562,Senior ICT/Cyber Security Engineer (m/w/d),Honeywell,,,,,"Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
Wir suchen derzeit zur Verstärkung unseres europäischen Teams einen engagierten und erfahrenen „Senior ICT / Cyber Security Engineer (m/w/d)"".

In dieser vielseitigen und zukunftsorientierten Position sind Sie verantwortlich für die Sicherheit und Resilienz unserer ICT-Systeme im Geschäftsbereich Building Automation. Sie spielen eine entscheidende Rolle beim Schutz der Infrastruktur unserer Kunden vor Cyberbedrohungen und stellen die Vertraulichkeit, Integrität und Verfügbarkeit von Daten sicher. Mit Ihrer umfassenden Expertise in den Bereichen ICT und Cyber Security entwickeln und implementieren Sie robuste Sicherheitsmaßnahmen und Best Practices. In dieser Schlüsselposition tragen Sie maßgeblich zur Sicherheit und Integrität unserer Systeme bei und ermöglichen die Bereitstellung innovativer Kundenlösungen auf höchstem Sicherheitsniveau.
Ihre Aufgaben:

Konzeption, Entwicklung, Konfiguration, Implementierung, Inbetriebnahme, Sicherung und Support sowie kontinuierliche Verbesserung der ICT-Infrastruktur (Server, Storage, Netzwerke, virtuelle Plattformen) und Enterprise-Anwendungen (Honeywell-Software: EBI, DVM, EM, ProWatch, Tridium und mehr) an neuen und bestehenden Kundenstandorten. Aktive Mitarbeit im Globalen ICT & Cyber Security Centre of Excellence zur Förderung der operationellen Effektivität und Standardisierung in Ihrer Region.
Förderung und Sensibilisierung für das HBS ICT & Cyber Security Angebotsportfolio sowie die Umsetzung entsprechender Angebote als zentraler Fokuspunkt.

Bereitstellung technischer Expertise und Verantwortung für die Wartung komplexer bestehender ICT-Infrastrukturen an den Kundenstandorten. Implementierung und Förderung von Honeywell-Softwareplattformen wie EBI, DVM und Energy Manager.

Entwicklung effektiver Arbeitsbeziehungen mit den technischen Support-Gruppen von Honeywell, Systembenutzern und Softwareanbietern, um sicherzustellen, dass die Systeme gut gewartet und effektiv genutzt werden. Zudem stellen Sie sicher, dass Systemprobleme effektiv und zeitnah behoben werden.
Ihr Profil:
Zertifizierungen und/oder Weiterbildungen in relevanten ICT-Technologien wie CCNA (Cisco), MCSA (Microsoft), VCP (VMware) sowie im Bereich Cyber Security, einschließlich CISSP und CEH.
Langjährige Erfahrung als IT-Systemingenieur oder in einer vergleichbaren Position.

Aktuelles und fundiertes Wissen sowie praktische Erfahrung in einer Unternehmensumgebung mit Technologien wie Windows Server, Virtualisierungstechnologien (VMware/Hyper-V), Netzwerktechnologien (TCP/IP, LAN/WAN), SAN-Speicher, Microsoft SQL Server und Cybersecurity.
Erfahrung im Umgang mit VPN-Technologien sowie in der Konfiguration und Verwaltung von SonicWALL und/oder Fortinet Firewall-Systemen.
Verständnis von Gebäudeleitsystemen wie BMS, Sicherheits- und CCTV-Systemen.
Von Vorteil ist Erfahrung in der Implementierung und Wartung von Honeywell-Software (EBI, DVM, Energy Manager, ProWatch, Tridium).
Erfahrung in der Implementierung von IT-Lösungen und in der Zusammenarbeit mit Anbietern, vorzugsweise in einem Bauprojektumfeld.

Hervorragende Analyse- und Problemlösungsfähigkeiten sowie die Fähigkeit, innovative und kreative Lösungen in einem komplexen, heterogenen Systemumfeld zu entwickeln, die den Industriestandards wie ISO 27001, NIST, IEC/ISA 62443 und NIS2 entsprechen.
Erfahrung in der Implementierung von ITIL-Praktiken, kontinuierlicher Verbesserung und kundenorientierten Servicebereitstellungsstandards und -methoden in großen und komplexen Organisationen.
Bundeweite Reisebereitschaft (ca. 50%).
Teilnahme an Rufbereitschaften.
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.
Wir bieten:
unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis
Attraktives Gehalt
Aufstiegsmöglichkeiten
Firmenwagen: Profitiere von einem attraktiven und nachhaltigen Angebot an Fahrzeugen inklusive Tankkarte, die du auch privat nutzen kannst.

971176,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/971176,"Senior Engineer, Piping Design",,,,,,"JOB DESCRIPTION
About Technip Energies

At Technip Energies, we believe in a better tomorrow, and we believe we can make tomorrow better. With approximately 15,000 talented women and men, we are a global and leading engineering and technology company, with a clear vision to accelerate the energy transition. Designing and delivering added value energy solutions is what we do.

If you share our determination to drive the transition to a low-carbon future, then this could be the job for you. We are currently seeking Senior Engineer -Piping to join our team based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
Successful candidates would be offered a fixed term of employment.
About The Job
He reports to Piping Lead, Piping Deputy Lead and his/her respective Area/Unit/Module Lead.
Senior Piping Design Engineer shall be able to guide other Piping Designer with good Piping Design knowledge.
Senior Piping Design Engineer shall route and consider the equipment and piping design modeled meets the objectives and is accordance with the relevant document requirements.
His/Her responsibilities shall include the following but not limited to:
Determining and coordinating interfaces, tie-ins, liaising with client, site personnel and other
engineering disciplines to facilitate design activities.
Supervising and managing of personnel, piping design activities, planning and preparing of contract documentation.
Reviewing and checking of documentation, ensuring deliverables are produced on time and within job constraints.
Achieving schedule and producing a quality product, meeting or exceeding project expectations.
Answering queries, supporting construction team, resolving construction issues and field clashes.

In the case of Stress engineering activities, Stress Lead Engineers shall take responsibility for their technical aspects. They shall liaise with the Piping Lead for scope and schedule related activities as well as co-ordination with Project Team and Client.
Main Accountabilities
Preparing 3D model and performing piping study for all equipment, based on the followings:
Make sure latest inputs of Equipment Vendor Data, Equipment Layouts, Equipment List, Plot Plans, and etc. is implemented.

Maintain conformity with Project Specifications and Requirements, and with respect to accessibility, operability and maintainability of equipment e.g. nozzle orientation, equipment elevations, orientation and adequacy of ladders, service platforms, PSV lines, outlet fire water network for hydrants, monitors and deluge valves and etc.
Coordinate closely with Mechanical Equipment Engineer to ensure that the vendor data are available for all equipment and highlight any missing data for equipment to the Mechanical Equipment Engineer.
Perform pipe routing study and modeling of all lines ≥ 2.
Maintain conformity to P&ID and Line List. He shall ensure that specific process requirements such as slope, free flow and no pockets etc. are incorporated.
Maintain conformity with JSD for Piping Design, Workplace Design Specification and Working Instruction.
Perform incorporation of Stress Calculation Notes into his Piping Design.
Consider Pipe Spacing (insulation thickness, guide and stopper).
Consider pipe flexibility for stress lines category 1, 2 and 3 in his piping design activities.
Prepare adequate operation and maintenance space such as ladders, stairs and service platforms and etc. for valves, flanges, joints and instruments.
Perform study, identify and propose pipe support locations, span. Then, prepare pipe support attachments for issuance to Stress team.
Prepare reserve volume for equipment removable space model.
Transfer all changes and mark-up from personal copy onto the Piping Master Copy (P&ID, Equipment layouts and etc.).
Responsible to correctly fill in all the model attributes.
Line attributes to be validated only if the level of maturity is acceptable.
Solicit advice from either Piping Lead or Piping Checker or Area/Module/Unit Lead if there is any Piping Design Concerns.
Ensure 3D Models designed are clash free via coordination with various disciplines such as E&I, Structural and etc.
Model Piping Standard Support in 3D Model.
About You
Qualification, years of experience and skills
Must have : -Recognized Degree in Mechanical Engineering
At least 10 years of working experience in Oil & Gas and Petrochemical field (especially
EPC project experience).
Nice to have
Able to understand Aveva 3D Tool E3D or Intergraph SP3D
Technical sound in Piping Engineering and Piping Design requirement.
Experience working with 3D system (SP3D/E3D)
Working experience in brownfield project. Strong multi-tasking, problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
Whats next?
Starting Date: Immediate

Once receiving your application, a recruiter performs an initial check and a review is further carried by hiring manager. We expect to take up to a few weeks to perform that review. If you hear from us, it is because we want to organize interviews and meet with you physically, or virtually, depending upon the location. To get an overview of the recruitment process, visit our dedicated webpage here.
We invite you to get to know more about our company by visiting www.ten.com and follow us on LinkedIn , Instagram for company updates.
892932,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/892932,Planning Engineer,AtkinsRéalis,,,,,"Job Description
We are currently looking for a Planning Engineer to be part of our Project team in Al Ula, Saudi Arabia.
Responsibilities
Ability to develop initial baseline schedules with little project information. This requires previous experience in infrastructure projects.
Assist in the preparation and management of overview and strategic programme, including design, procurement, and construction schedules together with supporting information required schedules.
Include all project stages from initiations to completion in the baseline and identify stage gates accordingly.
Coordinate and manage the preparation and development of master planning, engineering, procurement, and construction schedules together with associated information required schedules.

Establish and agree project reporting procedures, prepare, and present monthly project progress. Develop project and programme dashboard templates to be used across the programme by designer and contractors.
Review the schedules and related documents from the designers and contractors including monthly reports and analyse the content to ensure compliance with project objectives.
Review schedule trends to identify problem areas and recommend corrective action to management. Monitor actual progress against planned progress.
Monitor engineering design progress, material and equipment procurement and construction and commissioning status.

Prepare progress monitoring tools using earned value for the management and monitoring of the above-mentioned schedules. Monitor progress both on and off site. Identify deviations (progress trends) in both construction and procurement progress and suggest possible courses of corrective action.
Working closely with the Project Controls Manager and Project Team to ensure that the 'programme' is feasible, complies with the Project Master Plan and contractual documents.
Interface daily with the designers, PMCs, main contractor sub-contractors and internal management.
Carry out studies into scheduling, manpower, cash flow, and material flow as needed.
Attend offsite meetings as requested by the client.
Review schedules for slippage of key dates
Assist in the defence / approval of any claim for time extension or major change to the schedule.
Other duties as requested from time to time.

Establish and maintain consistent and adequate administration procedures, in their field. These procedures will be followed across the project by the respective planners working under the Construction Managers.
Participate with the project management team, as directed by the Project Director, to achieve project deliverables.
Involve key stakeholder requirements and approvals in the baseline.
Issue high-level schedule weekly updates
Identify and report main issues interfering with progress.
Identify and report on measures for improving schedule performance.
Establish Scheduling, reporting procedures, tools, templates, instruction, etc. to standardize the work across the programme.
Monitor the timing of submittals against schedule requirements.
Develop and monitor programme KPIs.
What we're looking for
Ideally you should possess a degree in construction management and / or civil engineering and hold a membership/chartership from a construction related professional body.

Generally, you will have 10+ years total experience and have a track record of working in a construction/engineering industry with infrastructure background, ideally with minimum 5 years' experience working in the region.
Arabic speaking and writing an advantage.
Worker Type
Employee
Job Type
Regular

At AtkinsRéalis, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.",,,,,2024-12-01 16:11:18,,
1003450,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1003450,Sr Engineering Manager - Operations,GE Renewable Energy Power and Aviation,,,,,"Job Description Summary

As the Operations Leader for Chief Engineer Manufacturing, you will coordinate and align priorities of Controlled Title Holders and Technical Talent Pipeline to enhance their effectiveness, aligning them with the business outcomes and critical initiatives. This role will establish key processes to set, track and manage metrics that drives efficiency and enable the team's ability to meet objectives in a timely manner to maximize the impact to the business. The role is subject to operating policy objectives.
Job Description
Roles and Responsibilities
Responsible for streamlining the operations and business processes for all manufacturing pyramids (Controlled Title Holders) with focus on strong operational cadence.
Influence the development of metrics and KPIs, that ensures clear alignment of the priorities to the business outcomes.
Working closely with the CTH Pyramid Leaders, support the CTHs in meeting their CTH expectations and pyramid priorities.
Own the operating reviews (WOR, MOR) and strategy sessions for Manufacturing Pyramids and provide leadership updates on operational metrics.
Lead Technology Roadmap sessions supporting various business operating rhythm on technology development and maturation.
Support CTH engagement on critical priorities of the division and SQDC (such as zero-defect culture, lead time reduction, productivity) enabling alignment of key CTH resources.
Establish strong connectivity with Aerospace Chief's Office, bringing alignment on initiatives and actions for Manufacturing pyramids.

Champion and drive the adoption of FLIGHT DECK for CTH/Pyramids and the Pyramid Leaders, aligning with divisional priorities by fostering a culture of continuous improvement, respect for people, and servant leadership through activating, coaching, facilitating, and promoting.
Build strong partnership with part families and manufacturing engineering organizations across the business to deploy outcomes and break constraints.
Interprets simple internal and external business challenges and recommends best practices to improve products, processes, or services. Stays informed of industry trends that may inform work.
Coordinate process improvement activities incorporating lean principles and Flight Deck.
Develop a strong communication strategy for CTH community, focused on engagement, information sharing and technical communities.
Required Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university (or a high school diploma/GED with a minimum of 10 years engineering or technical manufacturing experience) + minimum of 5 years engineering or technical manufacturing experience
Desired Characteristics
Humble: respectful, receptive, agile, eager to learn
Transparent: shares critical information, speaks with candor, contributes constructively
Focused: quick learner, strategically prioritizes most impactful work, committed
Has demonstrated experience using & implementing FLIGHT DECK Fundamentals with visible impact
Extensive experience in running Engineering / Technology operations of organizations managing both tactical and strategic metrics.
Strong influencing skills working with leaders across other organizations driving consensus and collaboration.
Uses high level of judgment to make decisions and handle complex tasks or problems in areas of operational, product and project management, manufacturing, technology or engineering.
Lead functional projects with minimal resource requirements, risk, and/or complexity.
Communicates difficult concepts and may influence others' options on topics. May guide others to consider a different point of view.
Strong oral and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills.
Prior experience and background in Lean.
Additional Job Description

This role is in the Chief Engineer ' Manufacturing Office supports Supply Chain, Quality, Commercial Engines Services, Avio and Edison Works Manufacturing, coordinating the activities with Manufacturing Leaders in these divisions. In this role, you will also work closely with Engineering Chief's Office.
Compensation Grade
SPB3

This role requires access to U.S. export-controlled information. If applicable, final offers will be contingent on ability to obtain authorization for access to U.S. export-controlled information from the U.S. Government.
Additional Information

GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunities Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

1003273,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1003273,Piping Engineer Stress Analysis,,,,,,"As Aker Solutions’ global recruitment partner NES Advantage is now looking for:

We do business development and execute modifications and maintenance projects. There is a global trend towards decarbonization, and we aim to help our customers to decarbonize their operations and measure their emissions to manage them more efficiently, for instance by delivering brownfield electrification of existing offshore facilities. Now we explore opportunities in the aftermarket for renewables, to deliver offshore maintenance for the renewable sector when the market is ready. Aker Solutions employs approximately 11,000 people in more than 20 countries.

Perform stress analysis/calculations and issue loads for pipe support design
Evaluate piping systems and liaise with other trades within the piping discipline
Interact with other disciplines, clients, and suppliers to resolve piping system issues
Produce drawings and other documents according to project requirements

Norwegian and English both written and spoken
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Understanding of ASME B31.3 and experience with EN-codes
Familiarity with regulations and standards (NORSOK L-001, L-002, L-003, L-004)
Experience with various load cases for piping systems
Ability to handle flange leakage issues and perform fatigue analysis
Proficiency in Caesar II and computer technology
Basic skills in PDMS/E3D

Working in Aker Solutions' outstanding office facilities, which include fully equipped onsite canteens and training centres at all locations, designed to foster a productive and engaging work atmosphere

Paula Galinska | Recruiter | NES Advantage AS |  Paula.Galinska@nesadvantage.com

1003272,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1003272,Sr. Engineer - Electrical(1 year contract),,,,,,"About you: Join us. Unleash your energy within.

If you have world-class ambitions to reach the stars while keeping your feet on the ground, we're the team for you. We've created a new breed of company - future-focused with reimagined ambition across all disciplines within the energy sector.

We love people who know their own potential and are not afraid to use it. We know that together, we're far more than the sum of our parts. So, we celebrate people who want to grow and develop as we work together on some of the largest projects on the energy world stage.
Our purpose and beliefs: As Kent, we're tackling the greatest challenge of our time - to bring our world the energy it needs in the most responsible way ever imagined.

It's the energy of every member of our team driven by our beliefs that is making this happen. Whatever our skill, our language, or our culture. These beliefs define and direct us every day to be the very best - for ourselves, our clients, our key stakeholders, the communities we operate in and the planet:
We PLAY BIG
We thrive on EMOTIONAL AGILITY
We are FANATICAL ABOUT PERFORMANCE
We are built on INFINITE THINKING
Read more about the Purpose, Beliefs and Guiding Principles that drive us: https://kentplc.com/who-we-are/purpose-beliefs

Our vision for Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging: We recognise that diversity & inclusion are catalysts for success. We're heightening awareness on the benefits of people diversity, diversity of experiences and diversity of our perspectives. Creating a culture of inclusivity where all employees feel a sense of belonging.

Our combined energy is fueled by different nationalities, across 6 continents and 24 countries. Our commitment is to celebrate character - no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability.
About the job:

The successful candidate will report to the Electrical and Instrumentation Discipline Manager and will be assigned to various projects associated with the Oil, Gas and Petrochemicals industry as directed by the Project Management group.

The candidate will possess a solid understanding of electrical design principles complemented by practical working experience with industrial power distribution systems within Oil and Gas processing facilities. The candidate is required to be a well-organized and effective communicator. The candidate will be able to work independently, lead a team of professionals (engineers and designers) and be effective when working in a team environment. Skills and Responsibilities:
Assigned as working lead (sub-lead / area lead or project lead) for multiple sustaining capital projects.
Manage assigned work effectively, prioritizing, executing, reporting, managing schedule and budget.
Establishing the scope of work, effort hour estimates and deliverable lists.
Design of LV, MV and HV Single Line Diagrams, including PC&M (Protection control and metering) Diagram with strong knowledge of relay and metering systems associated with substations and e-houses.
Prepare Electrical load List and perform electrical equipment sizing calculations (i.e. Transformer sizing, Cable sizing, NGR sizing, MCC sizing, grounding calculation etc.)
Define electrical Area Classification, and develop area classification schedule/report.
Provide procurement support by p reparing Electrical equipment specifications, data sheets, material requisitions for quotation/purchase, and technical bid evaluation and vendor drawing reviews.
Perform electrical system studies using ETAP or SKM to develop load flow, short circuit, arc flash, harmonic and motor starting the analysis, protection/relay coordination and setting files.
Review and support the development of electrical layouts (Electrical Substation/E-house layout, Cable tray, lighting, grounding, Schematic, wiring drawings etc.)
Knowledge of Interfacing with DCS, SCADA, PLC etc.
Review and support EHT design and calculation
Supervise, Mentor, Coach, and support the team members on projects.
Providing Electrical BOMs and major equipment costs for capital cost estimates at various project stages
Attending project team meetings, Client meetings and vendor review meetings
Reviewing designs for constructability and accordance with project requirements.
Performing field visits to validate existing drawings and confirm tie-in locations.
Utilize the workshare office or HVEC (High-Value Engineering Center) to complete the electrical deliverables.
Other duties as required.

In addition to the responsibilities listed herein, the employee may be required to perform other ad-hoc tasks as needed or directed by the supervisor or management. These tasks will be within the reasonable scope of the employee's skills, capabilities, and role within the organization. The intent of this provision is to allow for flexibility and adaptability in meeting the dynamic needs of the organization, ensuring that operational requirements can be met efficiently. All such tasks will be assigned considering the employee's current workload and with respect to their professional development.
Your knowledge/skills, education, and experience: Knowledge/ Qualification/ Training/ Certification:
A degree in Electrical Engineering from a recognized institution
Registered as a Professional Engineer in Canada
Minimum 10 years of experience, preferably in the Energy, Oil & Gas, and petrochemical industries for Conceptual, Pre-FEED, FEED and detailed engineering projects.
Knowledge of domestic and international codes (CEC, CSA, NEC, IEEE, ANSI, API, NEMA, etc.)
Strong interpersonal leadership skills are critical due to the requirement for effective communication of complex issues across the organization as well as for mentoring and consensus building.
Exhibits an understanding of business drivers, management of change requirements, project management processes, and construction workflow.
Experience managing vendor electrical packages (substation, e-houses, Transformers, VFD etc.) as a responsible engineer (RE) will be an asset.
Experience with High-voltage design, ETAP or SKM experience will be an asset.
Experience with Lightning Protection will be an asset.
Experience in the EPC industry, leading the local and workshare team will be an asset.
Experience with performing EHT calculations by using Thermon or N-vent software will be an asset.
Communication:
Excellent English communication skills, both verbal & written
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to coordinate workflow with High-Value Centers (HVEC).
Establish / Maintain good working relationships with the Clients and the ability to represent the employer professionally.
Behavior/ Core Competencies:
Leadership skills, team player, Proven multi-tasker with strong organizational skills.
Ability to meet assignment schedules & deliver quality products under competing priorities
Self-motivated & goal-oriented.
Proven attention to detail, analytical, and strong customer service skills required.
Good writing skills to produce technical reports, scope documents and presentations.
HSSEQ:
The Employee shall observe the Health, Safety, Sustainability, Environment and Quality rules of the Company

951525,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/951525,"Assistant Professor - Nuclear Science/Engineering, School of Energy Resources Directors Office",University of Wyoming,,,,,"Job Description

The University of Wyoming is delighted to receive your interest in our vacant position! We strive to connect with qualified and uniquely talented individuals to join our campus community. We would love to hear how your experiences translate to this position, the University's Mission, Vision, and Values, and encourage you to submit an application today!
JOB TITLE:
Assistant Professor - Nuclear Science/Engineering
JOB PURPOSE:

The Department of Mechanical Engineering and the School of Energy Resources at the University of Wyoming invites applications for a tenure-track position in nuclear engineering, broadly defined. Individuals with research interests in any relevant areas are encouraged to apply, including reactor/nuclear physics, advanced energy systems, reactor thermal hydraulics, advanced computational methods, or materials science relevant to nuclear applications. The position will be filled at the Assistant Professor level and candidates must hold a Ph.D. or equivalent with postdoctoral experience highly desirable. The successful candidate will be expected to excel in teaching at the undergraduate and graduate levels, establish a nationally-recognized research program with significant external funding support, and contribute to departmental and university-wide governance.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop and oversee an externally-funded research program of significant relevance to nuclear engineering. Teach undergraduate and graduate coursework.
SUPPLEMENTAL FUNCTIONS:
Carry out necessary service to their home department.
COMPETENCIES:
Ability to develop coursework and teach effectively at the undergraduate and graduate levels.
Ability to design, securing funding for, and mentor students in the execution of research projects related to nuclear engineering.
REMOTE WORK ELIGIBILITY:
This position provides vital support to campus customers and requires the successful candidate be available to work on campus.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
A Ph.D. in a relevant discipline (e.g., materials science, nuclear engineering, mechanical engineering).
Valid driver's license with a motor vehicle record (MVR) compliant with the University Vehicle Use Policy.
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Postdoctoral research experience
A strong track record of research accomplishments in their respective field supported by peer-reviewed publications and conference proceedings.
REQUIRED MATERIALS:
Complete the online application and upload the following for a complete application:
Cover Letter
A detailed CV
Research Statement (< 5 Pages) - Discuss your plans for establishing an independent, externally-funded research program in Nuclear Science or Engineering.
Teaching Statement (< 2 Pages) - Describe your teaching philosophy and interests.
Three letters of recommendation.
This position will remain open until filled. Complete applications received by 11/15/2024 will receive full consideration.

**Please note: This position is cross-posted with this position - Assistant Professor - Nuclear Science/Chemistry, School of Energy Resources Directors Office (Requisition #242980). Only one person will be hired following a search involving both applicant pools.
HIRING STATEMENT:

UW is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Educator and Employer (UW Reg 4-1). The University does not discriminate in employment or personnel practices on the basis of race, gender, religion, color, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, creed, ancestry, political belief, pregnancy, or any other protected category or participation in any protected activity. In compliance with the ADA Amendments Act (ADAAA), if you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation to apply for a position, please call 307-766-2377 or email jobapps@uwyo.edu
ABOUT LARAMIE:

The University of Wyoming is located in Laramie, a town of 30,000 in the heart of the Rocky Mountain West. The state of Wyoming continues to invest in its university, helping to make it a leader in academics, research and outreach. The university has state-of-the-art facilities in many areas and the community provides the advantages of a major university.

Located in a high mountain valley near the Colorado border, Laramie offers both outstanding recreational opportunities and close proximity to Colorado's Front Range, a bustling group of metropolitan cities including Denver, Boulder, and Fort Collins. This beautiful mountain landscape offers outdoor enjoyment in all seasons, with over 300 days of sunshine annually. For more information about the region, please visit http://visitlaramie.org/",,,,,2024-12-01 16:12:15,,
977173,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/977173,Senior Battery Engineer,,,,,,"Senior Battery Engineer - Plymouth MI

Intertek, a leading provider of quality and safety solutions to many of the world's top-recognized brands and companies, is actively seeking an experienced Battery Engineerto join our Transportation Technologies team in Plymouth, MI. Intertek's Transportaion Technologies team offers Total Quality Assurance expertise, delivered consistently with precision, pace and passion, enables our customers to power ahead safely. Our automotive, battery and energy storage, and related transportation industry testing and certification expertise is recognized by leading manufacturers worldwide for evaluating how their products and services meet and exceed quality, safety, sustainability and performance standards.

This position is responsible for performing testing and evaluation on a variety of products to the provisions of client-provided or other national, international or industry-specific performance and durability standards or U.S., Canadian and other International product safety standards

Read and determine applicability of national codes and standards (UL/IEC) clauses for the EUT (equipment under test) such as IEC 62133, UL1973 and others

column2: Vibration Test Controllers
column6: AC/DC power supplies and loads
column8: multi-meter
column11: digital multi-meter
column15: and articulated probes. Use hand tools to build/calibrate test fixtures.

Communicate project status and test results to client, sales personnel, and management throughout testing. Provide on-going support to clients as needed.
Within policy guidelines, identify, properly document, and recommend engineering judgments.

This position outline is a general guideline and does not represent all encompassing details. The position assumes that the incumbent has both the mental and physical requirements to carry out the above defined duties.

Demonstrated experience in battery testing and battery testing equipment (ie. Battery cyclers, electronic loads, power supplies, environmental chambers)
Strong understanding of battery performance and safety standards such as UL 1973, IEC 62133, UN 38.3

Demonstrated experience with Automotive (SAE, OEM specific), or International performance and environmental simulation test standards, and/or U.S., Canadian, and other International product safety standards, i.e., ANSI, CSA, UL, EN, IEC
Knowledge of cell and battery performance and safety standards
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, organization and time management skills and customer service skills
Must be self-motivated and able to work independently in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment
Prior project management experience is a plus
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions
Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables
Ability to make technical decisions and engineering judgments independently within established parameters
Microsoft Office expertise
Ability to travel as business needs dictate
Preferred Requirements & Qualifications:
Knowledge of Cells, Batteries, and Electrical Energy Storage Systems
Strong understanding of battery performance and safety standards such as IEC 62638, 62619, and UL 1642, 2580 and 2271
Intertek: Total Quality. Assured.

951888,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/951888,Senior Civil Structures Engineer,AtkinsRéalis,,,,,"Job Description
Shape the Future of our cities and environments.

Are you ready to take up a vital role in shaping some of our exciting projects? How about joining our talented team, where everyone has a voice, and together we face our clients' challenges head-on. It's a diverse and inclusive work environment where world-class talent knows no distinctions.

Bring your skills to the mix as a Senior Civil Structural Engineer, you'll play a vital role in every aspect of heavy civil engineering on Transformational Programmes for critical UK infrastructure with opportunities to work on iconic engineering projects at home and abroad.

We specialise in all aspects of heavy civil engineering, within multiple challenging and engaging sectors such as Defence, Energy and Water. We continue to provide industry-leading engineering solutions right through the project lifecycle, with value added through client-side support as well as construction phases. If being a part of a team with a passion for this industry is for you then we would love to talk to you.
We currently have opportunities in our Epsom, Bristol, Birmingham, Manchester, Belfast and Glasgow offices.
Your Purpose:
Manage a team to undertake technical design work following relevant design standards and codes, and to high-quality levels.
Prepare briefs, scopes of work, and input into bid proposals.
Successfully manage time and budgets to key project milestones and programmes.
Work closely with teams in the UK and overseas to deliver integrated design solutions.
Adhere to quality assurance standards in design.
What you can bring:
Chartered Civil / Structural Engineer.
Experience in design delivery, including multidisciplinary design.
Sound knowledge in design and analysis of heavy concrete and steel structures, and familiarity with current design standards and working practices, both British Standards and American codes.
Proficiency in designing with appropriate structural analysis packages.

Experience in the nuclear sector, particularly in the design and implementation of safety-related structures, systems and components (strongly preferred, but dependent on level of overall experience).
What we offer?

AtkinsRéalis recognise that there are many well qualified people who are looking to further their career, but who cannot commit to full time employment. We support flexible working arrangements and are interested to discuss how we can accommodate individual requirements. As part of this commitment, we understand the need for a diverse and flexible workforce, where a work-life balance is important. So, by default AtkinsRéalis offers flexible working, where there is no fixed 9 'till 5, no need for a 5-day week, no requirement for a full-time contract, and no requirement to spend all your working time in the office.
Rewards and Benefits:

We offer a competitive salary that is regularly tested against other consultants with a default 25-days leave each year plus bank holidays and options to buy some or sell of that leave. Salary and benefits will be commensurate with experience and qualifications.
New name, new era. We are AtkinsRéalis. It will take some time for all our information to update - you can still refer to our fantastic benefits via the link below:
YourReward at SNC-Lavalin (snclavalin.com).
Training:

AtkinsRéalis is committed to developing its people both personally and professionally. Our colleagues have the advantage of access to a high ranging training portfolio and development activities designed to help make the best of individual's abilities and talents. We also actively support staff in achieving corporate membership of relevant institutions.
Additional Information:

This role may require security clearance and offers of employment will be dependent on obtaining the relevant level of clearance. If this is necessary, it will be discussed with you at interview. The vetting process is delivered by United Kingdom Security Vetting (UKSV) and may require candidates to provide proof of residency in the UK of 5 years or longer. If applying to this role please do not make reference to (in conversation) or include in your application or CV, details of any current or previously held security clearance.

We are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive community - a place where we can all be ourselves, thrive and develop. To help embed inclusion for all, from day one, we offer a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements and employee networks to support staff from different backgrounds. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we value applications from all backgrounds, cultures and ability.

976851,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/production-jobs/976851,Production Engineering Specialist,ABB,,,,,"Production Engineering Specialist

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.
This position reports to
Operations Manager
Your role and responsibilities

In this role, you will have the opportunity to optimize the Production organization's assembly methods, processes, and equipment to minimize labor hours in accordance with business strategies related to quality, efficiency, costs, and safety. Each day, you will ensure appropriate production methods, cycle time, equipment performance, and materials/components in support of production targets. You will also showcase your expertise by defining the working phase sequence of a new production process to achieve the targeted product cost and equipment investment budget. The work model for the role is: #LI_Onsite This role is contributing to the Electrification Distribution Solution in Bac Ninh,Vietnam. You will be mainly accountable for: - Defines the working phase sequence of a new production process to achieve the targeted product cost and equipment investment budget. - Ensures appropriate production methods, cycle time, equipment performance, and materials/components in support of production targets. - Identifies and recommends improvement opportunities and implements improvement projects, ensuring adherence to timeframe, quality, and cost requirements. Ensures the production process complies with the project targets. - Approves the design for processes developed internally or externally and performs final tests with respect to the project. - Provides support to Production during the internal/external process/equipment start-up, defining action plans and training relevant maintenance and production resources. - Evaluates new process technologies to improve productivity, quality, and cost reduction, defining and leading testing activities, approval criteria, and external provider choices.
Qualifications for the role
Bachelor's Degree in engineering or related field with at least 5 years of experience in manufacturing development
column2: alternatively, a special combination of education and experience and/or demonstrated accomplishments.

column1: Good communication skills, strong quality mindset, strive for betterment, diversity and team player.
Well Lean Manufacturing understanding, the Lean 6Sigma belt certificate is very preferred (green, black)
Fluency in English
What's in it for you?
Evolve in your career: through trainings and our Open Job Market, your career development continues!
Flexibility: we have hybrid work options, make the best out of them!
Learn from highly experienced, genuine, and caring colleagues - people who are committed to helping you achieve your personal and professional goals.
More about us

ABB's Distribution Solutions Division facilitates the efficient and reliable distribution, protection and control of power by improving electric power quality while strengthening the resilience of the grid. The Division offers segment-specific products and solutions that largely serve utilities, industry and infrastructure segments, often providing the requisite medium-voltage link between high-voltage transmission systems and low-voltage users. With ABB Ability™ enabled connected solutions at its core, the offering includes medium-voltage air- and gas-insulated switchgear (1 to 66 kilovolts), indoor and outdoor circuit breakers, reclosers, fuses, contactors, relays, instrument transformers, sensors, motor control centers, as well as low-voltage switchgear for the ANSI standard markets."" 1000808,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1000808,"Construction Specialist (Civil, Structural & Project Engineering)",,,,,,"Job Purpose

·         Ensure civil, earthwork and structure fabrication/construction activities are undertaken in accordance with project needs in general and compatible with project safety, quality, schedule, and cost objective in NFS Project -Off plot area.
