932957,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/932957,Electrical Engineer (Building/Power Systems) - Intern/Co-Op (Sep 2025),Dennis Group,,,,,"The Building Electrical Group is responsible for all building electrical systems including lighting, fire protection and low voltage for our design build, industrial projects. We design and build food and beverage production facilities. Our building electrical team is involved with designing the electrical systems, calculating power loads, determining, and selecting equipment sizes, and vetting and selecting suitable vendors, suppliers, and sub-contractors. The professional will have technical responsibility for scoping, performing, and delivering multiple concurrent project assignments. His/her specific responsibilities will include, but not limited to:
Responsibilities
Design electrical systems for building power, i.e. normal, emergency, and standby power distribution systems for 208v, 480v, and medium voltage for industrial facilities.

Document all necessary calculations for the design such as short circuit, selective coordination, arc flash, generator sizing, steady state and transient voltage drops, load calculations, conductor sizing, raceway fills, etc.
Maintain project document organization
Manage time and meet commitments
Understand Ohms Law, AC/DC, Electric and magnetic fields
Understand power system theory - 3-phase vector math, power factor, symmetrical components
Understand capacitors, inductors, and resonance
Design lighting for food processing spaces, including lighting calculations for emergency and inspection lighting level needs. Coordinate fixture placement/mounting with other trades.
Design fire alarm systems per NFPA 72, 101, and local building code.
Design low voltage systems such as LAN, phones, PA, Wi-Fi, access control, cameras, etc.
Produce bid documents consisting of layout drawings, one-line, riser, schedules, details, and specifications.
CAD - add 2D devices to Xrefs
Procure long lead light fixtures and power distribution equipment such as switchgears, switchboards, panelboards, transformers, MCC's, generators, variable speed drives, and UPS's.
Transformer configurations
Estimate weights of main tray/trapezes and equipment needing support
Assist in managing electrical bid process for clients, observing construction, and assisting with startup.
Project planning and feasibility studies.
Actively participate in and support department-wide standard development, updates, and maintenance.
Research electrical building/power materials and best practices
Support talent growth within our organization
About You
Sophomore, Junior or Senior pursuing a bachelor's degree in electrical engineering or related field.
Proficiency with MS Office (Excel, Word, Access).
Familiarity with three phase power, the National Electric Code, wireless radio systems, fire and security systems, Fiber or LAN cabling is a plus.
Familiarity with designing lighting, fire alarm systems, and low voltage systems for building spaces, including lighting calculations, and coordinating fixture placement with trades.
GPA: 3.0 or above
Travel to customer project sites for fieldwork, review, audit, and meetings, estimated 25%.
Familiarity AutoCAD, Revit, or similar software.
Physical Requirements
Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Must be able to lift-up to 15 pounds at times.
Travel Requirement
Up to 25% travel required to visit project site and other offices.
About Us

We plan, design, engineer, and build food plants for major brands across the country and the world. For the past three decades, we've focused exclusively on the food and beverage industry, helping your favorite brands put your favorite foods in the grocery store. Simply put, food isn't one thing we do, it's all we do.

Dennis Group offers competitive compensation packages commensurate with experience. We provide comprehensive employee benefits including medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, paid time off including an open vacation policy, as well as bonus, profit-sharing, and retirement plans.

Dennis Group is proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or genetics.
931955,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/production-jobs/931955,Mechanical-Chemical Biofuels Engineer,"KBR, Inc.",,,,,"Title:
Mechanical-Chemical Biofuels Engineer
KBR - Delivering Solutions, Changing the World.

KBR brings together the best and brightest to deliver science, technology, and engineering solutions that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most critical missions and objectives. In everything we do, we are guided by our ONE KBR Values:
We Value Our People - We create diverse, inclusive environments in which each person can feel safe, respected, and valued, and where everyone has opportunities to grow and reach their full potential.
We Deliver - We are uncompromising in our commitment to deliver innovative, high-quality, technology-led solutions for our customers and exceptional, sustainable value for all our stakeholders.

We Are People of Integrity - We value honesty, trust, courage, fairness, prudence, and tenacity. We believe doing what's right for the planet, the communities where we work, and our people is good for business.
We Empower - We empower our people with a shared purpose, the right tools, and the supportive culture they need to be proactive decision-makers, to be adaptive to change and to succeed.

We Are a Team of Teams - We have a will to succeed, but we value the achievements of our team of teams over individual accomplishments. Our collective focus makes us a better, stronger, more effective company.
The preferred candidate will be able to function in multiple technical roles with the specific roles to be dependent upon the candidate's background and skills as explained below.

A licensed Professional Engineer with proven track record of managing multiple mechanical design efforts from conceptual design through construction support for world class Chemical and Biofuel clients. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to be a part of a team leading new technology deployment on a wide range of sustainability initiatives for our key clients. In-depth knowledge of mechanical equipment normally found in the chemical industries and biofuels industries along with industry codes is critical to provide leadership on these challenging projects.
In addition to the work group lead role described above, be able to bring to the table an area of focused technical leadership
column2: the specific areas are open and somewhat flexible with the current areas of interest noted below:

column1: Broad experience with any sustainability technologies and / or biofuels experience.
Heat transfer technology and equipment such as boilers, heat exchangers, char boilers, gasification, mechanical vapor recompression systems etc.
Large complex packaged equipment systems such as thermal oxidizers, cooling towers, process units etc.

The selected candidate will be expected to function in this dual role depending upon the project mix and technical demands of our Clients. Candidate must be flexibility to accommodate a varying blend of each role depending upon the specific needs of the Projects.
These roles are expected to function in a hybrid work environment and must have the ability to travel to client sites to attend walk-downs, kick-off meetings and design reviews.
*Fully remote work will be considered for the right candidate*
RESPONSIBILITES - MECHANICAL WORK GROUP LEAD ROLE
Early project planning and coordination while handling two to three small to mid-cap sized projects with ability to quickly provide engineering work hour estimates and risk memos.
Develop and manage the preparation, review and checking of mechanical specification packages in accordance with Client requirements and industry best practices.
Manage and successfully influence the entire procurement life cycle while working closely with all disciplines.
Managing development of complex multi-discipline Construction packages including diagrams, drawings, equipment schedules, details, and Scopes of Work.
Maintain positive relationships with clients, vendors, and contractors in a professional manner.
Track Project Scope and Schedule and notify project manager of deviation from original design, budget, or schedule.
RESPONSIBILITES - TECHNICAL SPECIALIST ROLE
Actively engage key clients while extending our already successful collaborative relationships in the candidate's area of specialty.
Act as subject matter expert for KBR local office and participate in KBR's worldwide network of SME's.
Train and mentor early-to-mid career engineers in the candidate's area of expertise.
Provide consultation services to in-house projects on as-needed basis and provide external consulting services when requested.
REQUIREMENTS
Preferred Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering or another related field.

10+ years (minimum) of experience in the EPC industry or chemical / biofuels operating companies. Will consider experience with chemical site team or project engineering backgrounds in related industries. Operations / Maintenance and Reliability experience is a plus.
Professional Engineering License (P.E.) is mandatory.
Proven experience with any of the following core areas:
Broad experience with any chemical's technologies and / or biofuels experience.
Heat transfer technology and equipment such as boilers, heat exchangers, char boilers, gasification, mechanical vapor recompression systems etc.
Large complex packaged equipment systems such as thermal oxidizers, cooling towers, process units etc.
Working knowledge of other engineering disciplines while providing proactive leadership on all interdiscipline design coordination efforts.
Ability to travel as needed to survey client sites.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with supervisory experience.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Travel to client sites will comply with all KBR and Client Safety Rules, Processes and Procedures
Work at client sites may require using and wearing personal protective equipment such as fire-retardant clothing, hearing and eye protection, hard hat and steel-toed boots
Work at client sites may require moderate physical exertion including walking to operating areas, ascending/descending stairs, walking the client property
This may include climbing ladders, lifting to up to 35 lbs, etc
BENEFITS

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits, which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.
INCLUSION AND DIVERSITY AT KBR
At KBR, we are passionate about our people, sustainability and our Zero Harm culture.

These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to and ongoing journey toward being a more inclusive and diverse company. That commitment is central to our team of teams philosophy and fosters an environment of real collaboration across cultures and locations. Our individual differences and perspectives bring enhanced value to our teams and help us develop solutions for the most challenging problems. We understand that by embracing those differences and working together, we are more innovative, more resilient and safer.
We Deliver - Together.

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.",,,,,2024-12-01 16:17:32,,
932017,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/932017,2025 Entry level Gas Turbine Products Engineering,Solar Turbines Incorporated,,,,,"Career Area:
Engineering
Job Description:
Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do - but also about each other. Solar Turbines Incorporated, the leading designer and manufacturer of Industrial Gas Turbines in the 1 to 24 MW size range, has exciting opportunities for recent graduates to join our world-class team of turbomachinery professionals as we work together to develop new product capability aimed at reducing emissions, improving efficiency, and burning low-to-zero carbon fuels.

Entry Level engineers will gain access to challenging assignments intended to generate critical business value and enable the engineer to acquire gas turbine product knowledge. 931735,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/931735,Power System Protection Engineer - Substation,Burns & McDonnell,,,,,"Description

Responsible for leading or executing power system protection and control engineering projects. Projects range in size, complexity, and voltage class from small distribution equipment upgrades to large transmission projects. This position can influence the future of the resiliency, reliability and economic operation of the electric grid. Opportunities to advance into leadership/management roles are available.
Position may include following assignments:
Executes complex assignments requiring the use of advanced electrical engineering techniques, resulting in the development of new or improved processes, equipment, and/or technological methods.
Develop and evaluate plans for major projects. Assess feasibility or soundness of proposed applications when data is insufficient or testing is advisable.
Coordinate departmental or divisional project studies, reports, or project design assignments.
Responsible for performing power system studies and system protection settings coordination on various projects (up to 500-kV voltage level).
Develop design basis documentation for protective settings and generate native relay configuration files.
Provide technical guidance to the project team, conduct design reviews, and support quality control.
Act as primary contact for both internal and external client-side communication.
Assist project manager to develop scope of work and conceptual design for the projects.
Train, guide, and mentor lower level engineers.
Support business development and marketing initiatives
Qualifications

Requires a Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or a directly related field plus seven (7) years of experience in electrical systems studies in the electric utility or industrial power distribution industry.
Will accept a Master's degree plus six (6) years of related experience in lieu of Bachelor's degree plus seven (7) years of related experience.
Preferred Experience/Skills:
A Professional Engineer licensure is strongly preferred

Protection and Control system design for substation applications and automation (69kV - 500kV), one-lines, three-lines, AC/DC schematics, control panel layouts, bill of materials, and protection specifications.

Application of industry standards for the protection of system equipment, including power busses, power transformers, HV/MV circuit breakers, capacitor banks, reactors, transmission lines, and distribution feeders.
Power systems modeling and protective relay coordination analysis using ASPEN OneLiner or Electrocon CAPE software.

Designing calculations, including short circuit calculation, current transformer performance and ratio selection, over-current element coordination, zone-distance element selection and coordination, and relay loadability calculation.
Developing native relay setting files using SEL's AcSELerator and GE's Enervista software programs.
Providing engineering support with construction and commissioning activities for substations.
Leading multiple engineering teams on engineering design and scope for multiple projects.
Knowledge of FERC and NERC requirements as they pertain to electric utility reliability requirements is a plus.
Knowledge of IEC61850 and its implementation is a plus.
This job posting will remain open a minimum of 72 hours and on an ongoing basis until filled

931714,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/931714,Design Engineer - Gas - Expression of Interest,Cordoba Corporation,,,,,"Overview

Cordoba Corporation is a leading civil engineering firm based in California. We are growing and looking for talented Design Engineers to join our Gas team. Working primarily in the capacity of Cathodic ""Design Engineer"" supporting Cathodic Protection, Metering Instrumentation & Controls, Stations-Facility and Pipeline projects. In this dynamic position, the candidate will be reporting directly to a Cordoba Project Manager & Engineer Team along with supporting the Cordoba Design group with overflow projects. Desirable traits include attention to details, excellent work ethic, emphasis on quality control, and Willing to Learn and Grow with Project Team. Applicant expected to have a good understanding of piping design and equipment layouts.
Responsibilities
AutoCAD Plant 3D CAD Design / Civil 3D Design:

Prepares working drawings using computer-assisted design (CAD) from rough sketches, verbal instructions, and engineering data (approved drawing templates, previous drawings, and drawings from clients) considering the agreed project schedule.
Front end design-engineering, substructure research/identification, detailed design, quality assurance review, construction support, As-built drawings.
Piping plans and conduit routing plans and foundation design drawings as directed by the Project Manager and/or Project Engineer team.
Work with Survey Files - Import, Identify Coordinate Points within Civil 3D.
Create bill of materials for utility design plans.
Provide general notes per supervisor's instructions without grammatical errors.
Must be diligent to constantly seek improvement of drafting skills through self-study.
Engineering Support:
Support the initial pre-planning efforts, engineering/design stages, construction support, execution stages and closeout efforts.

Coordinate with the project team, including Utility Managers and Technical Supervisors, Field Engineering Representatives, and other departments, subcontractors, and organizations to complete the assigned projects.
Field verify existing conditions and create utility design sketches in the field.
Work with Land Survey Files/GIS/Maps/Record Drawings, work order sketches, CP facilities, understand gas/electric materials and CP equipment.
Interface with the client and the project team to complete the assigned work within schedule and budget hours.
Attend meetings with Cordoba Project Manager/Engineers, Client, Vendors and Governing agencies as required.
Qualifications
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in civil, electrical, mechanical engineering or related field required.
1-3 years of experience related to Utilities-Gas & Electric scope of work (Design/Engineering) required.
Advanced computer skills and familiarity with AutoCAD Civil 3D and Plant3D.
Good problem-solving, decision-making, communication, analytical and human relations skills required.
Ability to work effectively as part of a large team and work independently.
Must be adaptable and flexible.
Excellent written and verbal English language communication skills.
Proficiency utilizing knowledge and skills with MS Office Suite (including MS-Word, MS-Excel, MS-PPT, MS-Project, MS-Outlook) and computer applications is mandatory for this position.
Must be adaptable and flexible.
A high level of personal integrity and a strong work ethic are required.
Must have legal authorization to work in the U.S.A. on a full-time basis without sponsorship.
Ability to pass a pre-authorized physical, including a drug screening and background check, is required.
Preferred
Utility design experience.
Proficiency with AutoCAD Plant 3D, Autodesk BIM 360 & Bluebeam Revu experience.
Engineer-in-Training.
Salary Range: $55,000 to $75,000 per year.
Work Location: Hybrid 1 day per week in one of the 8 Cordoba Corporation office locations or remote.
Our Company

Cordoba Corporation is a nationally recognized civil engineering, construction management, program management, and planning firm. We specialize in education and facilities, transportation, and water and energy. In collaboration with our clients, Cordoba has facilitated the development of several complex and highly visible infrastructure projects throughout California. Our efforts have resulted in national recognition from Engineering News-Record as a ""top 100 construction management firm"" and a ""top 50 program management firm"". We are proud to share that ENR has also recently recognized Cordoba in 2018 as a ""top 100 design firm"" in California.

Cordoba's business model has been commended for its efficiency, encouraging work dynamic, and its multifaceted approach toward projects. Many of our professionals have received praise in the media as leaders in their fields of expertise. We have established a statewide presence throughout California. Headquartered in Los Angeles, we also have offices located in San Francisco, Sacramento, San Ramon, Chatsworth, Santa Ana, and San Diego.

Cordoba Corporation provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. Cordoba Corporation expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. If you need special assistance or accommodation, please contact Cordoba Corporations HR Department at: (213)895-0224.
1000586,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1000586,Senior Project Engineer - Construction,,,,,,"Senior Project Engineer - Farmers Branch, Texas

Intertek, a leading provider of quality and safety solutions to many of the world's top-recognized brands and companies, is actively seeking a Senior Project Engineer to join our Professional Services Industries, Inc. (Intertek-PSI) team in the Dallas area at our Farmers Branch, Texas office. This is a fantastic opportunity to grow a versatile career in the architectural, engineering, and construction (A/E/C) industry.

Professional Service Industries, Inc. (Intertek-PSI) is a leading US based provider of construction assurance, testing and inspection in civil and commercial construction. Our broad service offering includes construction materials testing, geotechnical services, environmental engineering, industrial hygiene, and specialty testing.
What are we looking for?

The Senior Project Engineer is responsible for performing a variety of assignments that include independent evaluations using standard techniques, procedures and criteria using engineering judgement to make minor adoptions and modifications during the course of work.

In addition to competitive compensation packages, when working with Intertek you can expect benefits including medical, dental, vision, life, disability, 401(k) with company match, generous vacation / sick time (PTO), tuition reimbursement and more.
What you'll do:
Make decisions and recommendations in reference to test report results, project field circumstances and inspections
Prepare and review inspection and testing reports, project procedural plans and specifications prepared by others
Prepare scopes, budgets, and schedules for task assignments
Attend client site meetings and review recommendations with Principal Consultant and/or Quality Manager
Maintain and leverage client relationships and develop new project opportunities
May perform on-site observations, sample collection, and specific tests and/or inspections
May work both in the field and laboratory regularly

This position outline is a general guideline and does not represent all encompassing details. The position assumes that the incumbent has both the mental and physical requirements to carry out the above defined duties.

Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering from accredited engineering/ABET school

PE License
Day shift with 7am start time

column1: Ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, (hearing) and to make the discriminations in sound
Ability to kneel and squat occasionally
Ability to walk and stand for long periods of time
Ability to work outdoors in adverse weather conditions, including hot and cold temperatures
Ability to climb occasionally, and work at various heights
Preferred Requirements & Qualifications:
All requirements listed above

We Value Diversity

1000452,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1000452,Senior Advanced Systems Engineer,Honeywell,,,,,"Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
At Honeywell, our people are driven by a desire to contribute, be challenged and grow. Our people make Honeywell a special company and are a key competitive advantage.

Honeywell Aerospace is a $10B+ SBG (Strategic Business Group) with 40,000 employees in over 125 domestic and international locations. We are a leading global aviation supplier designing, manufacturing, and distributing advanced electronic systems, products, and services to commercial, defense and space industries.

As a Cabin Pressure Systems Engineer here at Honeywell, you will play a crucial role in providing production line support for our Tucson, AZ factory. You will be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of cabin pressure systems and providing technical expertise to resolve any issues that may arise. Your knowledge and skills in cabin pressure systems will contribute to the efficiency and quality of our production processes.
U.S. PERSON REQUIREMENTS

Due to compliance with U.S. export control laws and regulations, the candidate must be a U.S. Person, which is defined as a U.S. citizen, a U.S. permanent resident, or have protected status in the U.S. under asylum or refugee status or have the ability to obtain an export authorization.
Key Responsibilities
Electro-Mechanical CPCS Production, Vendor, and Quality Management
Management of Class 2 and Class 1 drawing and BOM changes.
Customer technical white papers, safety assessments, and technical communication. Resolution of manufacturing, vendor, and quality issues impacting smooth delivery of CPCS product.
Updates/improvement routing and MOT (manufacturing operation and tooling).
Daily coordination with non-Honeywell contract manufacturing and support organizations (Celestica, KBR).
Manage IRB, HSR, transitions from inception to closure.
Troubleshoot and maintain mechanical and electromechanical production test equipment to maintain and support production targets.
Test Integration
Experience in HW/SW design, Test equipment design, HW/SW integration, and test.
Closed-loop testing, circuit analysis, circuit troubleshoot, and RCCA.
Write test cases and procedure/scripts for requirement validation (Python).
Perform validation tests and write analysis reports (HMATS).
Validate development SW packages and modifications to customer requirements.
Integrate system-level test equipment, electronic/mechanical hardware, and software.
Model Based Development
Basic understanding of Requirements Based Management (ARP4754, DOORs, PTS).
Basic understanding of model-based development tools (HAM, Beacon).
Able to generate basic control models and simulations (MatLab/Simulink).
Able to understand and run advanced model simulations.
Engineering Documentation / Process

Familiarity with basic engineering development process (IPDS per AP-1235 or equiv). Able to independently write technical documents (qualification documents, design review material, acceptance test reports).
Able to read and understand engineering drawings, schematics, interface drawings, and trees (PDM).
Familiarity with PDM ECR/ECO initiation and review process.
Able to define and estimate System Engineering tasks needed to support efforts associated with new programs/scope changes.
General
Familiarity with aerospace industry specifications (DO-160, DO-178, DO-254, ARP4754, ARP4761, Mil-spec).
Familiarity with FAA and other aircraft certification processes (FAR Part 23, 25).
Understanding of Aircraft Cabin Pressure and/or Environmental Control Systems.
Interpersonal communication skills for effective interaction with cross-functional disciplines as well as suppliers, vendors, and customers.
Understanding of System Safety Analysis and Functional Hazard Assessment.
Must Have
Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution in a technical discipline such as the sciences, technology, engineering, or mathematics.
5-7 years in Aerospace systems design, production build, vendor management, test equipment design, SW/HW test integration, certification.
Design, Manufacturing, and Test experience preferred.
Team Center drawing management, Test equipment, and test SW experience.
Customer technical requirements management experience, using formal tracking systems (DOORS, PTS, Clearcase).
We Value
Familiarity with aerospace industry specifications (DO-160, DO-178, DO-254, ARP4754a, ARP4761, Mil-spec).
Familiarity with FAA and other aircraft certification processes (FAR Part 23, 25).

Understanding of Aircraft Cabin Pressure and/or Environmental Control Systems. Interpersonal communication skills for effective interaction with cross-functional disciplines as well as suppliers, vendors, and customers.
Understanding of System Safety Analysis and Functional Hazard Assessment.
Additional Information
JOB ID: HRD249390
Category: Engineering
Relocation Tier: Not Applicable
Security Clearance:
Aviation Authority (FAA for US):
Band: 03
Referral Bonus: 1500
Requisition Type: Standard Requisition
US Citizenship: Must be a US Person or able to obtain export Authorization.
FLSA Statement:
FLSA CODE: Exempt

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.",,,,,2024-12-01 16:18:11,,
1000598,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1000598,Junior Design Engineer,NOV,,,,,"JOB DESCRIPTION

NOV Lifting and Handling, Poland is seeking a Junior Design Engineer. We are looking for a person who will contribute to the development of new designs, improvement of existing solutions and has a proactive, analytical and positive attitude.

Why Join Us? Our Engineering Team at National Oilwell Varco Poland has more than 25 years of experience with design of various mechanical equipment, machines and steel constructions. Supporting other NOV locations gives us an opportunity to work in international environment. Our mechanical, hydraulic and structural calculation engineers share their knowledge to support worldwide not only NOV entities. They are all high-level users of variety of engineering tools and software. Therefore, our team is extremely flexible and open and ready for any new challenges. Starting from working mainly with offshore rig equipment we have been more and more involved in renewable energy production systems. This gives us tremendous opportunity to be close to the highest technologies and cutting-edge solutions in an industry.
Key Responsibilities:
Creating or modification of engineering drawings and components to meet customer requirements.
Ensure relevant Bills of Materials are created in correct format and on time to meet customer order requirements.
Provide engineering support to machinists and assemblers on the shop floor.
Ensure correct and thorough maintenance of project documentation.
Apply technical knowledge to innovate, design and develop engineering solutions.
Respond to technical enquiries in a timely and positive manner.
Perform other duties that may be necessary from time to time assigned by Superior.
Comply with all NOV Company and HSE policies and procedures.
Qualifications:
Master's or Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering.
Good skills in 2D and 3D CAD design, preferably Inventor and NX.
Experience in mechanical design is welcome.
Enthusiastic, hardworking, honest, self-starter, team player.
Good communication in English written and spoken.
What We Offer: At NOV, we believe in rewarding our employees for their contributions. In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes:
Medical Insurance: Get seen, diagnosed, and treated when you're unwell. The individual package is fully paid by NOV and comes with the flexibility to extend to your family.
Life and Disability: Insurance cover 24/h throughout the world.
Retirement: 1.5% contribution from the Employer and 2% from the Employee.
Multisport: Co-financed sport card.
ABOUT US
Every day, the oil and gas industry's best minds put more than 150 years of experience to work to help our customers achieve lasting success.
We Power the Industry that Powers the World

Throughout every region in the world and across every area of drilling and production, our family of companies has provided the technical expertise, advanced equipment, and operational support necessary for success-now and in the future.
Global Family
We are a global family of thousands of individuals, working as one team to create a lasting impact for ourselves, our customers, and the communities where we live and work.
Purposeful Innovation
Through purposeful business innovation, product creation, and service delivery, we are driven to power the industry that powers the world better.
Service Above All
This drives us to anticipate our customers' needs and work with them to deliver the finest products and services on time and on budget.",,,,,2024-12-01 16:18:23,,

899610,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/899610,Quality Engineer,ABB,,,,,"Quality Engineer

1000459,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1000459,Project Engineer,Engie,,,,,"Chi è ENGIE

ENGIE mette al centro delle sue attività (elettricità, gas naturale, efficientamento energetico e servizi) lo sviluppo sostenibile, per far fronte alle sfide della transizione energetica verso una low carbon economy: accesso ad un'economia sostenibile, mitigazione e adattamento al cambiamento climatico e ottimizzazione delle risorse.
Chi cerchiamo
Una risorsa da inserire presso la nostra sede di Trieste, nell'ambito della Global Business Unit PA&BtoT.

ENGIE nell'ambito della linea di business PA&BtoT, suddivisa in 3 macro aree geografiche (North, Center and South), si occupa della vendita e gestione di servizi di hard facility, servizio energia e public lighting, per i clienti del settore pubblico locale e nazionale.
Attualmente, con una copertura capillare dell'intero territorio nazionale, conta nel suo portafoglio circa 650 punti luce, 80 ospedali, più di 2000 scuole, 30 università e 350 comuni.
Che cosa farai?
Riporterai al Project Manager e, in coordinamento con il team, gestirai le attività di progettazione e cantiere in accordo alle tempistiche contrattuali.
Quali saranno le tue responsabilità?
Provvederai a redigere e/o verificare le specifiche tecniche di acquisto materiali e servizi.
Ti occuperai dello scouting dei fornitori e degli expediting.
Verificherai l'andamento della commessa e certificherai lo stato avanzamento lavori per i progetti di competenza.
Verificherai che tutte le attività vengano svolte nel pieno rispetto della normativa tecnica e delle normative in materia di ambiente e sicurezza.
Provvederai alla preventivazione e alla contabilizzazione dei lavori e delle attività di manutenzione straordinaria.
Gestirai il ciclo passivo e attivo su SAP per le attività di propria competenza.
Coordinerai il personale tecnico assegnato al contratto e le ditte in subappalto.
Gestirai l'interfaccia tecnica con le altre funzioni interne all'azienda coinvolte nel progetto.
Che cosa porterai in Engie?
Laurea in Ingegneria o comprovata esperienza nel settore
Conoscenza delle tecniche di governo dei processi, della programmazione e della progettazione
Esperienza nella gestione della manutenzione e nella contabilità lavori
Conoscenza dei sistemi informativi e software (ERP, SIM, CAD, Pacchetto Office, Project)
Perché scegliere Engie?
Lavorare in ENGIE, gruppo multinazionale, significa avere un'ampia varietà di possibilità di carriera in oltre 30 paesi.
Ma significa anche mettere la comunità al centro della tua vita professionale e contribuire a un vero cambiamento nel corso di una carriera stimolante.

Il nostro impegno è chiaro: sosteniamo un modello sociale che concilia la performance economica con l'impatto positivo sulle persone e sul pianeta. Scommettiamo sul potere della collettività e agiamo come parte di una comunità impegnata a sconvolgere e reinventare il futuro. Diversità e inclusione sono al centro della nostra cultura aziendale.

ENGIE si impegna a combattere tutte le forme di discriminazione in materia di occupazione, accesso alla formazione e promozione. Pertanto, l'integrazione e il sostegno di giovani, adulti, persone con disabilità, senza alcuna distinzione di genere, etnia o religione, sono priorità fondamentali della politica delle risorse umane.
Le Certificazioni EDGE e UNI PDR 125/22 conquistate, dimostrano tale impegno.",,,,,2024-12-01 16:18:37,,

1000312,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1000312,Engineer I Technical Support Proposals,Emerson,,,,,"Emerson's 133 years of history have been filled with achievements and challenges that have driven innovative thinking and bold transformations, molding us into the company we are today. By joining us as an Engineer I Technical Support, Proposals, you will be providing technical sales and application support to Emerson Process Management-Australia and New Zealand (ANZ) in generating quotations and/or booking orders for ANZ operating units.

In this capacity, you will have the opportunity to demonstrate your technical skills in providing excellent customer service to Emerson as a member of the Manila Australia New Zealand Alliance Team (MANZAT) organization. This gives you a very vital role in helping drive growth platforms and supporting operational pillars while striving for long-term value creation.

If this sounds like a perfect fit for you, apply now and join our team in Quezon City, transferring soon to Mandaluyong City, Philippines. All roles are currently in a blended Work-From-Home arrangement and company-provided IT assets are given on your first day. Enjoy our market-competitive pay, comprehensive benefits package, well-being programs, and career development opportunities.
In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:
To handle the proposal and quotation management.
To perform commercial or technical reviews of proposals.
To monitor workload management.
To participate in functional unit pivotal initiatives.
Who You Are:

You have a strong drive for results and exhibit passion and enthusiasm to get things done. You can efficiently carry out tasks independently and generate accurate, high-quality reports. You are a proactive self-starter with a strong sense of urgency when meeting tasks and deadlines. 1000478,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1000478,Automation Engineer 2 EMCS India,Schneider Electric,,,,,"About the Position

The scope of our division within Schneider Electric is to provide automation solutions for our customers from the business segments of Energies (Oil and Gas, Electro-intensive, Power and Grid, Transport, etc.,) in and beyond the APAC region.

We are seeking a highly self-motivated, customer-focused, team-oriented engineer. The professional we are seeking will work on the design, documentation, and execution of automation projects for our customers.

Specification, Design & Validation, Customer meeting, and approval on the design submission
knowledge of power system value chain & well versed with substation switchgear components functioning, representation, their international codes, etc.
well versed with all the communication protocols such as Modbus, IEC 61850, IEC-101/104, OPC, DNP3 protocol, etc.
Knowledge and experience of different Bay Control Unit, Protection IED, RTU & PLC-based products.

Fully conversant with communication network design, configuration & commissioning including their latest standards such as RSTP, PRP, HSR, Dual-Homing, etc. Knowledge of Router, Modem & Firewall, etc. would be an added advantage.
Hands-on experience with the EPAS / EPO (PSO) Engineering Tool Suite such as EPAS/ M580/Visio/PSO/EPO/Citect etc.

Understand the customer technical specifications, and prepare functional design specifications based on SE offer in line with customer specifications. S/He should be able to handle the customer discussions & approvals.
International projects execution experience, Good English communication skills, and any other language proficiency could be add-on advantages
Perform Engineering, validation & Commissioning activity for short- and long-term deputation.
Qualifications
To be equipped with -
A Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Engineering.
Advantageous to have a degree or equivalent in Electrical/ Electronics, Computer Science, Instrumentation engineering, etc.
Must have a minimum of 2~5 Years of experience in the energy automation project execution , project team handling, and internal-external customer handling experience.
Good knowledge and understanding of the electro-intensive business.
Must have interpersonal skills.
Team Spirit
Self-Motivated.
Schedule: Full-time

1000134,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1000134,Lead of Civil & Structure Engineering,,,,,,"Vacancy Overview
Lead of Civil & Structural Engineering

Airswift is an international workforce solutions provider within the energy, process, and infrastructure industries. Airswift serves as a strategic partner to our clients, offering a turnkey workforce solution to capture and deliver the top talent needed to complete successful projects by aligning with the unique needs of our clients. With over 800 employees and 6,000 contractors operating in over 50 countries, our geographical reach and pool of talent available is unmatched in the industry.
Airswift is seeking for a Lead of Civil & Structural Engineering to work with our client based in Qatar.
Job purpose:

Responsible for overseeing Civil and Structural engineering discipline and Pre-FEED/FEED Contractor in delivery of all aspects of civil and structural design to ensure technical objectives are met within the approved scope, budget and schedule. Ensures technical requirements such as project specifications, data sheets, procedures, etc. developed during FEED fully comply with project requirements and executed in the field.

Provide clear guidance to the Pre-FEED/FEED contractor and facilitate resolution of technical issues to complete civil/structural field engineering activities to meet project objectives and milestones.

Provide field engineering oversight of Pre-FEED/FEED civil and structural building scope and deliverables to support pre-FEED/FEED Contractor and sub-contractors in the execution of civil/structural activities.
Monitor civil/structural/building field execution quality, schedule and progress.
Qualifications:
Minimum of 10 years' experience in EPC projects, in civil/structural discipline including detailed design and field engineering construction/commissioning phases
Experience in Oil & Gas Facilities, especially LNG facilities and or large utilities systems with large civil/structural/building scope
Knowledge in geotechnical, foundations design, underground installations, drainage, precast concrete, steel structures
Knowledge of key relevant civil engineering and Qatar building codes (QCS2014, ACI, AISC, BS EN, etc)
Experience with building design and field execution
Some construction execution experience, and understanding of the interfaces with other disciplines related to work installation and sequencing
Key accountabilities:
Support Civil/Structural Head on civil/structural/building field engineering execution activities to meet project milestones and objectives

Leads Civil/Structural/building field engineering support activities for the Pre-FEED and FEED scope. Provides leadership, coaching and guidance to the Pre-FEED/FEED contractor and sub-contractors to make them successful in delivering project civil/structural/buildings scope
Applies sound engineering judgement to address technical issues as they arise during construction and commissioning execution.
Demonstrates visible safety program leadership.
Ensures Contractor and Sub-contractors have adequate plans and work schedules (short term and long term)
Maintain design integrity and quality requirements through the management of change, specification deviation, Technical Query and field design change processes.
M aintain full project chronology of civil and structural engineering design revisions (including cause / effect data) to ensure change management is clearly documented
Ensures quality and timing of civil/structural/building field execution activities.
Works side by side with quality organization to address systematic quality issues for civil/structural/building scope
Engages resources outside the PMT on a timely basis to resolve key engineering issues beyond experience
Conduct site surveys to validate field conditions in relation to queries or validation of completed works, including witnessing of field executed testing
Verify site conditions to facilitate construction works such as suitability of ground conditions for heavy lefts
Support the review of temporary works designs for any critical site construction activities, including design review of Critical Temporary Construction Aids (CTCA)
Review of construction method statements for critical construction works including lifting studies (when required)",,,,,2024-12-01 16:19:46,,

818952,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/818952,Cost Control Engineer F/M,,,,,,"JOB DESCRIPTION
About Technip Energies

At Technip Energies, we believe in a better tomorrow and we believe we can make tomorrow better. With approximately 15,000 talented women and men, we are a global and leading engineering and technology company, with a clear vision to accelerate the energy transition. Designing and delivering added value energy solutions is what we do.
If you share our determination to drive the transition to a low-carbon future, then this could be the job for you. We are currently seeking a Cost Control Engineer to join our team based in Paris.
Introduction to the Job

At Technip Energies, we deliver industrial projects of a scale, scope and complexity that you simply wont find anywhere else. We are looking for a Cost control Engineer F/H who can join our multicultural team in Paris.
Key Interactions
Internally: Project Manager, Project Engineering, Procurement, Subcontracting, Construction, Finance and other internal departments as required
Externally: Client, potential partners, subcontractors, and vendors
Job description
Hierarchically reports to the Head of Cost Control Department and operationally reports to the Lead Cost Control of the Project, you will:
Estimates total project cost at completion for complex projects
Develops, updates and maintains project budget and forecasting
Monitor the project financial performance in a multicultural environment
Main responsibilities
Sets up Cost Control Procedures
Sets up Budgets and the specific tools to follow the project costs
Implement the in-house digital solutions and their latest enhancements
Estimates Total Forecasts, Quantity / Costs and Expected Outcomes
Provides support to the Risk Manager to prepare the Quantitative Risk Analysis
Approves commitment control and vendor/subcontractors invoice
Assists Project Managers in optimizing and improving the budgeted profits
Prepares change orders / claims, and follows up
Generates monthly internal Project Management Review (PMR) / external status reports (client reports)
Develops statistical and close-out reports, with a view towards improving feedback data and estimation tools on future contracts / proposals
About you :
Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent
2 to 5 years of experience in related field
Confirmed experience (ideally 2 years minimum) in Engineering & Construction Industry within project environment is a plus.
Professional English
Rigorous
Solid analytical and problem solving skills
Team worker and able to chair meetings within multi-cultural teams and Clients
Establish good relationship and cooperation with colleagues in the project team
Seen as a plus :
Digital culture
Background in a technical engineering discipline.
Other experience in Project Control, such as: Risk Management, Scheduling, Estimating.
Whats next?

Once receiving your application, a recruiter performs an initial check between your skills and qualifications with our stated requirements prior to a detailed and focused review carried with the hiring manager. We expect to take up to a few weeks to perform that review. If you hear from us, it is because we want to organize interviews and meet you physically or virtually upon locations. To have an overview of the recruitment process, visit our dedicated webpage here
We invite you to get to know more about our company by visiting www.ten.com and follow us on LinkedIn , Instagram for company updates.
All our positions are open to people with disabilities

At Technip Energies, we believe in a better tomorrow and we believe we can make tomorrow better. This role will primarily undertake reliability engineering activities under the direction/supervision of a Lead RAM Engineer / RAM Team Leader for conceptual engineering and feasibility studies for the Oil & Gas and Energy Transition industries. You will also have the opportunity to support Technical Safety & Risk and Functional Safety scopes when required under the direction of a Lead Technical Safety Engineer.

Relevant Engineering Degree
Good knowledge of Reliability concepts and techniques, e.g. Fault Tree, Reliability Block Diagrams and FMEA/FMECA
A key desire to grow your experience within conceptual studies for the energy industry
Advantageous Experience:
Certified Functional Safety Engineer
Experience of using DNV GL MAROS and/or TARO is desirable
Experience of refinery or chemicals industries
Experience in data manipulation and Python language desirable
Post graduate qualifications in a reliability related subject
Basic understanding of Technical Safety & Risk Studies
It is essential that applicants must have the right to work in the UK
We invite you to get to know more about our company by visiting www.genesisenergies.com and follow us on LinkedIn for company updates.

As an equal opportunity employer Technip Energies considers only qualified applicants without regard to colour, age, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender expression, disability, national origin, veteran or marital status

column1: With over 65 years of history and with a presence in 34 countries, our 15,000 employees are fully committed to bringing our clients game-changing innovative projects to life, pushing the boundaries of what is possible to accelerate the energy transition to a better future.
We offer you not only an opportunity, but also an inspiring experience in a truly international environment where you team up to push boundaries through innovation, creativity, and team spirit.
About Technip Energies Paris:

Within Technip Energies universe, the Operating Center of Paris is referenced as the group's center of excellence and expertise. The Process and Technologies Division is involved in many areas, such as low-carbon energy production technologies (including Liquefied Natural Gas), biofuels and synthetic fuels, ethylene and polyolefins, plastics recycling, carbon dioxide capture and sequestration, green hydrogen, blue and green ammonia and other low-carbon or carbon-free energy carriers.

Our Reference Technologies are settled in the Energy Transition process and are fully steered towards the decarbonized future of energy production, Chemistry, and Petrochemistry. In addition, our Operating Center of Paris is a key player in the Group in terms of R&D, for the development of new and innovative technologies.
About the position
We are currently looking for a Senior Process Engineer to join our team based in Paris, France.

Reporting to the Head of one of the Technological Departments of the Processes and Technologies Division of the Paris Operating Center, you will be involved for all types of projects (feasibility, conceptual, Basic, FEED, EPC, etc.)
As a Senior Process Engineer, you will be in charge of the following tasks and assignments:

Management and lead of the activities of a Processes team on projects (calculation notes, sizing, process simulations, PFD, H&MB, P&ID, specifications (equipment, instrument and piping), design philosophies, control and safety philosophies / logics, technical reports, etc.):
Team supervision (up to 5 junior process engineers), and checking/validation of the produced results,
Supervision of the production and of the issuance of the process deliverables,
Involvement in the training of the junior engineers and in developing their skills,
Participation in safety, environment and operation reviews (HAZOP, SIL, HAZID and ENVID),
Management of complex design problems and technical support for process-related subjects,
Organization and lead of the process design reviews and of the P&ID reviews,

Coordination of the technical interfaces for the process-related matters with all stakeholders (e.g. Clients, Suppliers, Partners, Subcontractors, Licensors, Engineering Disciplines, Project Management, etc.),
Support to pre-commissioning, commissioning and start-up operations of facilities in France and abroad,
Contribution to R&D activities, development of feedback notes at the end of projects, involvement in the development of methods, tools, procedures and technical guidelines.

You will carry out these tasks and assignments in compliance with the applicable rules and procedures, in accordance with the schedule, budgets, and objectives that are defined, and with a constant focus on Quality, safety, and Client satisfaction.
About you:
Interested and motivated to be a player in the energy transition, you want to discover new technologies or innovative processes or deepen your knowledge of certain types of processes.

Independent, dynamic and meticulous, you have good communication skills, and you feel at ease in a multicultural environment. You also encourage diversity and inclusion and make a point of participating in the right work atmosphere.
You enjoy teamwork in an international environment on a variety of projects. You are fluent in English. You have a basic knowledge of French or are willing to learn it.
You are a diploma holder of an engineering degree or a masters degree in chemical engineering or process engineering.
You have sound knowledge in the area of the material and energy transformation applied to the Industry (thermodynamics, chemistry, energetics and fluid mechanics).
You have sound knowledge and proven experiences in one (or more) of the technological area(s) covered by our Operating Center of Paris:
Development of Fields, Gas Treatment, Liquefied Natural Gas and low-carbon energies,
Ethylene, Olefins, circularity and plastics recycling,
Refining, biofuels and e-fuels,
Carbon-Free technologies (e.g. green hydrogen, blue/green ammonia, etc.),
Carbon management and decarbonization of the Industry (including CO2 Capture).
You are proficient in several process simulation tools, including HYSYS, UniSim, PRO II, ProSim, Pipenet and Flarenet.
You are proficient in process design (modeling and process simulations, PFDs, H&MBs, P&IDs, instrument and equipment sizing, PDSs, etc.).

You have a minimum of 5 years' successful and validated experience in process engineering and process design (or related activities, such as process licensing, operations/production, etc.), in the Energy, Chemicals or Petrochemicals sectors.
You have already managed and led small teams of engineers.
Your future at Technip Energies:
The diversity of the business sectors, technologies and processes dealt with by Paris Operating Center will satisfy your curiosity and your thirst for learning for many years to come.
You will also have occasions for assignments abroad, in the other operating centers of Technip Energies or at the construction sites.
In addition, there will be many opportunities for career advancement:
Management (process manager on project),
Technological developments (expert),
Advancement to other professions within the engineering sector (project management, project control, business development, etc.).

All our positions are open to people with disabilities.
